review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. title: Old world charm with modern amenities, friendly staff and centrally located.
review: Wonderful stay while in Florence.  Centrally located, close walk to everything, very clean rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast was good and hot.  Would definetly stay here again in the future.  Highly recommend

title: Nice little gem!
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the great review.  I'm really glad you enjoyed your stay by the Rivoli Boutique Hotel, we try every day to offer our guests the best of our attentions and we  love when this is appreciated.  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence,  Best regards  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Nice place; lousy WiFi and TV.
review: My wife and I just returned from a tour of italy with Perillo tours.  We stayed in three very different but very nice hotels on our 8 day tour. Rivoli Boutique hotel was our absolute favorite of the three. Old world charm with very modern amenities, a comfortable bed, a bathroom which was very modern and spotless and even a pressing machine for people who need to iron while on the road.  The breakfasts were excellent and tried to accomodate all guests and their cultural tastes.   We found the staff to be attentive and very pleasant.  The only 'glitch' was that the hair dryer did not work.  We notified the desk and a brand new unit was installed while we were out.  Problem solved by the cheerful and attentive staff.  The hotel is close to many if not most of the major attractions and just steps from the Train station.  Of all the places we visited in Italy, we will be sure to visit Florence and will stay at the  Rivoli Boutique Hotel again!  …

title: Great location
review: This is a great place! Our travel agency selected this hotel and we were very pleased. Very clean and the staff here is so nice! It is one block over from the train station and literally a 5-8 min walk.  Easy access to the Ponte Vecchio and Duomo.  Breakfast here is included and it is very elaborate spread with fresh fruits, pastries, breads, and hot and cold foods. Mostly Americans here if it makes any difference to anyone.  Mini fridge in the room. Cozy bar with fun bartender.  We'd stay here again.

title: Just fabulous small boutique hotel in Florence
review: My husband and I came to Florence for our 20th wedding anniversary. This place is amazing, great wifi, lovely room, got a balcony room so rooftop views.  The staff here have been exceptional friendly and helpful, have found and booked all our tours, even last minute ones... the hotel itself is like a rabbit warren, it’s got character and I love that. It’s pretty central to lots of things and only minutes walk to the train station. We stayed here from the 2nd Nov 2019 till the 6th Nov 2019. Best anniversary present yet. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

title: Very comfortable
review: The hotel Boutique Hotel Rivoli  is very nice! Just 2 minutes walk from the railway station, 10-15 minutes walk to the center. There are many hotels in this area, but Hotel Rivoli has its own merits that set it apart from a number of others. The hotel is located in an ancient building, the interior of the halls has echoes of antiquity and history.  The staff if nice and hospitable. In the room you can find the greeting letter of the hostess of the hotel.  My room was light and spacious, and the bathroom was spacious too. The interior of the room is beautiful, the walls are covered with exquisite stucco, the floors are wooden, very nice. The bed and sofa are comfortable, the textiles are good. The hotel has patios - quiet, green, cosy places to enjoy.   And most distinctively -…

title: Superb and interesting five days
review: Very comfortable hotel. Well located for the city sights. Friendly staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Breakfast very nice. Has a Michelin star restaurant, which we didn’t know until after we’d eaten there. Not Michelin star to me. Just a nice plate of pasta. Tried to use hot tub, but it was cold???

title: Linda Cassens and Linda keutmann
review: Dear Elaine,   thanks for the nice review, concerning Jacuzzi temperature, I will ask the maintenance to check it .  Regarding the Benedicta Restaurant, we do not have any Michelin star, we had since last year the 3forks (not the star) and we decided not anymore to be rated with that. Hoping to welcome you again, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Dated and unfriend
review: I would highly recommend this hotel and the helpful, knowledgeable, kind staff members who help make the experience perfect. The outdoor patio is lovely even if you don't want to swim. Upgrading to a room with a balcony is completely worth it if possible. They are private little terraces and mine even had a little table to sit overlooking the view in the picture. Very safe and charming, great location near many restaurants.

title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
review: Let me start with the positive about the hotel.... location, close to the train station and close to the sites; but Florence is small so most of the hotel are close to everything.... so no really great benefit there... but okay, it’s a good location! Unfortunately my experience was not good due to the fact the staff was NOT friendly at ALL!! At the arrival a very serious gentleman helped us.... not 1 time, show any king of appreciation to us as guests.... a second person, I am assuming in training, starring at us as if we had just arrived from a different planet... the other 2 people were very busy with their paperwork and also did not have the courtesy to tell us hello. So we arrive to the room..... well.... let me say.... sad!!! I understand the beauty of antique and vintage…

title: Excellent place to hang your hat
review: I wasn't sure what to expect with this reservation, but this adorable boutique hotel blew us away. The location was great, just a few minutes to the train station and then very close to all of the attractions. There were a million restaurants within such a short distance. We received a welcome drink since we are VIP expedia members, and the bar tender Amelia (I think that's how it's spelled) provided such great service. Our room was spacious and adorable, the balcony was an excellent perk. I can't rave enough about our experience at this hotel. Breakfast was also really delicious.

title: Horrible hotel
review: We had a lovely stay and at the Rivoli!  The front desk was excellent (special shout out to Mattia who helped us numerous times with reservations, cabs to the airport, directions etc.). The location was unbeatable for walking to everything we wanted to see, so we didn't worry about transportation in the city. There are also plenty of close places to grab a drink and a bite, quick or otherwise.  We ate at the hotel the first night and the staff in the restaurant was very kind and attentive, the ambiance was relaxing and the food didn't disappoint.  We enjoyed drinks at the hotel bar 2 nights and the drinks (as well as the bartender) made for a great end of the night.  We had 2 upgraded rooms at the end of the hall and an outside door that we could lock to shut us off from the…

title: Good location close to train station
review: The location was in walking distance to all that Florence has to offer.  There are so many incredible restaurants behind the hotel as you walk to the Ponte Vecchio. The front desk employees were so patient with us. Our first room was nice but we had to walk up 2 narrow flights of stairs and we asked to be switched.  They found us a comparable room (we booked a balcony room) that was a junior suite.  The junior suite was a great size room with a modern  bathroom. It overlooked the courtyard and was quiet and serene.  The hallways are a little dated but I will definitely stay here again if a junior suite is available on our next visit.

title: Excellent hotel
review: The hotel has a lot of character although it looks tired in areas - but this did not bother us. The triple room was a good size with a fridge and kettle. However the fridge did not work. The room was very cold and road facing so very noisy. The bathroom was a good size and to have a bath was a bonus. The hotel was in a good location which was the main reAson for our choice. There was a good a selection at breakfast. The staff were all polite and friendly. Florence is a lovely city and we would like to return, we would consider using this hotel again mainly due to the staff but would definitely want a room away from the roadside.

title: Lovely hotel in the middle of a busy city...great location
review: Greeted by friendly staff. Thunderstorm struck after checking in our rooms. One of the rooms was flooded due to leak in the roof. Three of our party members were immediately assigned suite upon bringing it the the attention of the front desk. 5 minutes walk from the train station close to restaurants and other attractions. Breakfast was OK. Rooms were spacious with amenities

title: A pleasant stay and good location.
review: Dear Kausar,  thaks for the great review, I'm really glad you appreciated your stay by the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  We do try to offer the best ou our attentions, specially on "special" events, and I'm glad we solved the problem.  Hoping to welcome you again in the future, best regards,  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Great position, great cleanliness, great service
review: The hotel is located near the train station which was ideal for us. The breakfast was good with friendly staff providing help. The rooms were quite large and well air conditioned. One of our rooms seemed to be very different to the second. The second appeared refurbished while we stayed in a 'normal room'. I have yet to find a hotel that doesn't have issues with the showers. Water went down the top side of the bath to create a little pool at the end for the day 😁 The jacuzzi could do with a spruce up. Overall it was a nice stay and great location 👍

title: Pros and cons
review: as soon as we arrived, the gentleman at the desk welcomed us and gave us the keys (around 2.00pm) . The room is very nice, I would definitely recommend this boutique hotel to whom is looking for a great place spending just a small amount of money.   Appena arrivati, il signore alla reception ci ha accolti e ci ha dato le chiavi della camera (intorno alle 14:00). La stanza è molto carina, la consiglio per chi cerca un buon hotel qualità prezzo.

title: Great location
review: Pros - Good variety of food at breakfast, lots of information paperwork on offer at reception   Cons - Very poor WiFi access (only good in lounge area) , difficult to obtain towels/toilet roll etc. from reception (on one occasion, waited up to an hour)

title: Great 👍
review: We just spent a nice weekend at Rivoli Hotel and it was a perfect place to explore the city. Located near SMN made it ideal to walk to duomo and other sites near by.. Station is just 5 min walk away making it convenient location even to do day trips to pisa.  Lots of nice restaurants and shops nearby.  We also had dinner at hotel restaurant and it was perfect.   The rooms are nice, clean and comfortable.   Definitely a good place to stay and would consider staying there if we visit Florence again...

title: Unfriendly staff
review: Just returned from a great 5-night stay. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Lovely decor throughout, and a bright, clean, good-sized room with modern bathroom and separate shower. Great base for exploring the city, within easy walking distance to the tourist sites on the north side of the Arno and with good bus and train links nearby to explore further afield. Highly recommend!

title: Very spacious room with stunning view & perfect location.
review: Due to a glitch in the Expedia Application wrong dates were booked and we contacted the hotel immediately through Expedia (within 5 minutes) but they won't budge on changing the date on our reservation and we stand to lose the funds we paid for the hotel.

title: Perfect base for exploring Florence
review: Dear Dsinghca,   I would say that before saying unfrendly, you should at least know Personally, We just applied the rules and restrictions preview for the room rate you accepted and booked.  You bought a room for the night of the 20/08 (which had a very special bargain rate) and than after more than 5 hours not minutes we received a message from Expedia reporting that you were asking to change it to 15/08 (which is a National Holiday and very requested date with a totally different rate). We informed Expedia that it was not possible to switch those dates, for the reasonos above mentioned and this this does not make of us "Unfriendly staff" , but just correct and Professional staff that respect what promised and allowed.  Best Regards,  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: VERY Close to Rail Station
review: We absolutely loved our stay here!  We were easy walking distance to everything! Our room was very spacious, clean & had the most beautiful outlook.  The staff were lovely and friendly.  The Christmas nativity set up in the function room was absolutely gorgeous. I wouldn't say the breakfast was spectacular - but it was absolutely fine (& we have a teenage boy travelling with us)!!  If we're ever back in Florence we'll definitely stay here again (& make more of an effort to use the pool next time as the whole courtyard / pool area was gorgeous). I really couldn't fault the property, furthermore it was very affordable.

title: Great location, great breakfast but poor front-desk service!
review: When walking to the hotel and seeing the small front door on a street, I was wondering what type of hotel we were in for (we had just come from a dreadful one in Venice). On opening the doors, a beautiful hotel was discovered. The hotel was old style with rooms everywhere.   Our bedroom, for a family of 4, was absolutely delightful. Two rooms and a small table with a sitting area, in addition to two desks, was more than we were expecting. The bathroom was great with a lovely shower, once you got used to the controls.  The staff were great. The front desk staff were warm and friendly and always willing to help. They organised a breakfast box for our tour the day after check-in. The barman was fanastic and had a special wave with my 9-year-old. The staff at breakfast were amazing,…

title: Favorite hotel of entire trip!
review: We stayed for a week in this hotel on a family vacation in Firenze. Hotel is within walking distance from Firenze SMN train station and to main attractions e.g. Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, etc.  Room is clean, although a bit tight for 3 people. We stayed in the prestige room which has its own small courtyard garden space which was lovely. However we find the shower with multicoloured lights uncomfortable.  Breakfast is excellent with choices and breakfast service staff are all efficient. All staff are friendly and helpful. Special mention to Elona who is very friendly, helpful and provides excellent service.  The other friendly staff is the bar person, acknowledging guests as they walk pass to their room. His service is great. Front desk service is extremely cold. There is not once…

title: Great hotel, great location
review: This hotel was wonderful.  It was very close to the train station (easy walking distance) and close to many attractions.  The breakfast was varied and delicious.  Staff was welcoming and helpful.  The room was well sized with a FABULOUS bathroom and wonderful shower.  We were on a multi city trip and this was by far our favorite hotel.

title: Decent hotel
review: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Rivoli. Everything during our stay was great. The room was a bit small but that’s Florence. It was very well cleaned and taken care of. The staff was also very friendly and helpful.   Breakfast was good, a bit small but enough to get you through the morning. The location of the hotel was great. Minutes away from the main train station and many of the tourist attractions. Also surrounded by great restaurants that are not as touristy. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great Bartender, Lovely location and Stunning Hotel
review: I booked this hotel based upon it's unique description of being a converted monastery.  It did not disappoint! There were so many little nooks to just sit and relax.  I booked 2 rooms with the balcony.  It was exactly what I was looking for in a hotel in Florence. It was such a pleasure to just go out on the balcony to enjoy the weather and atmosphere. The room was very quiet, we could not hear any noise outside of our rooms.  Slept comfortably.  The staff was so accommodating when we arrived and throughout our stay.  The amenities in the room were so special.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing Hotel at the Heart of Florence!
review: We stayed at the Rivoli during our stay in Florence, it’s located as advertised in old Florence and it is perfectly situated as it is a walking distance from the train station as well as the shopping districts and many other restaurants. We didn’t use taxis or public transport to go anywhere absolutely everywhere we needed to go was walking distance.   The hotel itself is well furnished and is very elegant from the lobby to the rooms. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful when we needed directions. And provided us with maps and great suggestions.  When we had an early tour and would have missed our breakfast they prepared a breakfast box for us which I think is a great service to the guests. So far on our Europe trip when we have had early tours, although we’ve paid for…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Spent one night there while on holiday (Rome and Florence). Couldn’t have been happier with our hotel choice! Luxurious feel everywhere! The breakfast is one of the very best I have had the chance to try during my travels!

title: Great hotel!
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really glad you reported such a positive experience and appreciated our Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  Our breakfast served in our Benedicta Restaurat is really appreciated for all the local products which have a very high quality.  Hopng to welcome you again in Florence, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Overrated
review: We stayed for three nights and once again very please.  The bedroom and bathroom were quite small. But very well organized and beautifully appointed. Very comfortable and quiet. The breakfast buffet is excellent and the staff there very helpful.  Love the bar, and the living area to relax. Very close to train station, and fairly easy walk to all the sights. Our only problem:  We love the dining room and waited too late one night to make reservations and no tables available!!

title: Hotel Rivoli has become my base in Florence.
review: Staff not helpful, carpets severely worn, mattresses very hollow. Room was very noisy. The interior of the room has not been updated for years. The quality of the breakfast was good. Overall not good value for money.

title: Lovely Location + great service.  Clean Rooms & close to Train Station and Duomo!
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for you review. I'm sorry you did not appreciate completely your stay with us, and what mostly surprise me is your comment on staff not helpful.  As you can see from all reviews on here the staff service is considered on really high standard for helpfulness and welcoming, for this reason I will investigate on who was on duty during your two nights stay and will check what happened. Concerning the room, beeing the Rivoli Boutique Hotel a very particular XIVth century building, all our rooms are different and with different facings, just asking us we could show you different solutions. Hoping to welcome you soon again in order to guarantee a full satisfying stay, best regards.  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Early June 2019
review: This spring I returned to the Hotel Rivoli for the 4th time.  The hotel consistently offers superb service, a delightful restaurant for al fresco dining, and very comfortable accommodations, including good wifi and several amenities.  The staff is excellent, and they communicate well with one another to follow up on a guest's request.  For example, this time Air France seemingly lost my luggage, and Hotel Rivoli made calls on my behalf to the lost luggage department in the Florence airport; made excellent suggestions for shopping to pull together an emergency wardrobe; and, when my luggage finally arrived, tracked me down in the breakfast room to let me know it was there.  On several trips I have taken an early morning flight out, and the hotel provided me with a boxed…

title: Lovely hotel, many small spaces to sit and relax or wait for friends. Nicely decorated in a traditional manner.
review: All the staff is great. The hotel is very nice and quaint. Makes you feel like part of Florence. I highly recommend for kids too mine are 15 and 12. It was nice and quiet at night and it was very   close to the train station and actually all the tourist places. A must stay here if you go to Florence.

title: Decent hotel
review: My room was clean ,well appointed. Fine linen sheets and good bedside lighting. Bathroom had an amazing shower. The new silver and gray decor was handsome. The only disappointment was being on the street side when I had requested a quiet room.

title: Former monestary now home to charming hotel
review: Dear Suzanne,   thanks for giving us your personal feedback, I'm really glad you appreciated your experience in Florence by the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  To skip the inconvenience of a street facing room, it would be better booking a Balcony or a premium room as mostly of those rooms are overlooking the inner courtyard.  Hoping to welcome you again to guarantee  a 100% relaxing stay with us, best regards,   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: We only stayed in this hotel for a night. Booked a balcony room. Room was nice, location was great, staff were great. A lot of noise from cleaners hoovering at 9am, and on walky talkies, our toilet was very noisy and the flush made random noise in the middle of the night that kept waking us up. English channels had bad quality. Breads for breakfast were old and hard. Overall I don’t if all these issues were just in the room we were staying or throughout other rooms. I didn’t feel we got value for what we paid. However they were nice enough to let us park complimentary for the inconvenience.

title: Amazing Hotel! Beautiful and great location!
review: Throughout my stay I found the hotel to be a charming florentine sanctuary in the bustling city- with more than helpful and caring staff who never made a fuss and were always happy to offer advice in near perfect English. The room had an adorable view over the courtyard containing a very enjoyable pool. And it’s in a fantastic location. I will cherish my fond memories of this hotel forever. It was simply a dream that I can’t wait to revisit.

title: Bed bugs!!!
review: I must said is now my FAVORITE hotel, the charm of the city blends with the kindness of the staff, from the front desk to the bar man to the bell man, everyone makes you feel at home! The breakfast crew super happy every morning, the food incredible, i will repeat 1000 times! Good choice!

title: Not for everyone
review: Dear Guest,   wow! great honour beeing your Favorite Hotel!  We try to offer our guest the best experience we can in Florence and it's a great pleasure to read that we have been able to guarantee a good experience with us !  Wait to welcome you again and again by teh Rivoli, best regards and ....Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Nice stay in the heart of Florence
review: Already our first impression of the hotel was not great. Very noisy room (traffic outside, elevator, neighbors), dirty room and bathroom, were things that we did not quite expect because of all of the good reviews and high rating of the hotel. We also got some bite marks during our stay, but there were mosquitoes in the bathroom, so we thought it was them. However, shortly after our return home, we started getting same bite marks, so some unwelcome quests have followed us home from the hotel and we have to deal with them now.  To say that we are disappointed with Rivoli Hotel would be a huge understatement.

title: Great Location. Quaint Hotel
review: If you are arriving into Florence by train you really need to be close to the station. (Walking around Florence with baggage is a bit of a nightmare). This hotel is an easy walk from station and an easy walk to all of the main attractions. And the hotel itself is beautiful. Our room in 3rd floor was spacious and well appointed. Extremely beautiful lounge downstairs, wifi, cosy little terraces. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Mostly fantastic with a few things to be aware of
review: We were only here for the day.  Our flight left at 6:30 a.m. back home.  The rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable.  The hotel staff was extremely helpful.  We had breakfast included in our room charge, but we were leaving at 5:00 am.  The staff put together breakfast boxes we could take with us.  I was really impressed.  The hotel is literally within walking distance of the center of Florence. Great location!   The only two comments I have is that the hair dryers need to be replaced.  For those of us who depend on them, these were a throwback to the 1960s.  The only other thing is they only have shampoo and not conditioner.  Again, only an issue for those of us with frizzy hair issues.  Not a game changer for sure.

title: After 47 Years - 3 Days in Florence
review: The good. The receptionists are fantastic, will help with anything and are very knowledgeable and pleasant . Rooms at the back of the hotel are quiet and if you have a balcony are fantastic . The location next to Santa Maria Novella is fantastic and great if you arrive by train. Easy walking access to all the sights  The not so good,  The coffee at breakfast is an undrinkable black liquid Some of the  hotel, stair carpets, paintwork in passageways and our bedroom was tired and lacking in a little love  It would take very little effort to make this 5 star.  I overheard complaints of noise at the front of the hotel but have no first hand experience

title: Awesome place! Close to train station and many attractions
review: Forty-seven years ago my wife and I visited Florence for a day while on a 10 day bus tour. We loved the city and all it offers and have been dreaming to go back. Well, it took 47 years but we made it. We spent 3 great days as part of our 14 day holiday in Italy. Staying at the Rivoli just added to the trip. It’s close to the train station, the Duomo, museums, great shopping and more!  Staff was great, full free “American breakfast”, lots of amenities, choice of 3 types of pillows, sitting area in the room and lobby areas made for a wonderful stay. The price was right too for so much. Highly recommend the Rivoli.  Five Stars!

title: Great Friendly Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Lovely Hotel with amazing staff
review: I stayed at this hotel afew years ago and gave a great review, I said when back in Florence I would stay again. Well just had 3no nights back in Hotel Rivoli and it was just as good as I remembered it.  Top location, friendly/helpful staff and a great breakfast.

title: Great little hotel
review: Dear Martin,   glad you appreciated again your stay by the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  We try to keep our "standard" on a top level and so glad you find the same as in the past.  I hope you will come back in the next future and, assuring you of our best attention,  best regards  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Location on and hospitality
review: We stayed 5 nights at this Beautiful Boutique Hotel in a very good location, quiet, clean (even with the refurbishment/construction going on) with a very helpful staff, always very pleasant. Not forgetting the Benedicta Restaurant with amazing food and team. We will be back……

title: Business trip
review: Dear Flavia,   I'm really glad you reported such a positive experience, and enjoyed our Benedicta Restaurant.  It's always a graet pleasure for us to read such a good review, this gives us the opportunity to confirm our efforts can be appreciated.  I really hope to welcome you again in Florence and in our Rivoli Boutique Hotel. Best regards,   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Lovely and excellent location
review: This hotel is extremely noisy, lots of door slamming in the early hours. People chattering outside our room at 2 am.  Building work starting at 8 am on a Saturday, and let's not forget the smoke alarm flashing all night. Any one who likes to sleep would be well advised not to stay here.

title: Hotel Rivolli Boutique
review: Dear Mrs Harry,  I'm deeply sorry you did not have a great experience in our hotel, unfortunately in this periodwe have to update our A/c-Heating system in order to be much more eco-green and respect ambience. Building works are allowed to start not before 09:00 and I will investigate about this.  Concerning smoke detector, it's the small (very small led light) flashing that guarantee our guests that the system is working properly.  I hope you will give us a second chance to let you appreciate in full our house. Best regards,  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: The blue hotel
review: Lovely boutique hotel with friendly staff, nice buffet breakfast, large hotel room and spacious bathroom. The location is right next to the train station SMN but very easy walking distance to the historic centre.  The famous 16th century Domenican Profumeria is right across the road and worth a visit.  My only gripe is that the room was far too hot (26.5C) without the ability to moderate the temperature and we found it difficult to sleep until we opened a window. This was in February when the outside night temperature is about 2 degrees.   Otherwise we would highly recommend this lovely hotel for your stay in Florence.

title: Always a pleasure
review: Dear Riti,  I'm glad you appreciated our Rivoli Boutique Hotel and enjoyed your stay with us.  The A/c-Heating system is currently on renovation works that will allow all our guests to choose the temperature they prefere in every season activating directly heating or A/c.  This should guarantee the perfect temperature, so that if you will come back I hope you will have the chance to test it !  Hoping to welcome you soon again in Florence, best regards.  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Enjoyable stay!
review: This hotel is wonderful. What makes it special are the staff as much as the ambiance and decor. We stayed for 2 nights and ate in therestsurant which was very special with a great vibe. The food was exceptional. So many little touches from apples and sweets on reception to a free Christmas display of museum standard.

title: An Oasis in Florence
review: Dear Sandra,   I'm really glad you appreciated your stay by the Rivoli Boutique Hotel, and also spent nice words on our Benedicta Restaurant.  We try every day to meet our guests expectations and it's really great for us to read that we match them!  Hoping to welcome you again, best regards-  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Enjoyed our stay & sevice
review: Within walking distance of the train station, this is a great hotel.  The staff were excellent and very helpful.  Breakfast was good, and everything you needed to start the day.  Our room looked into the courtyard and was very quiet.   The Jacuzzi is great  -  we'd order a wine and enjoy a relaxing soak after a day of walking around Florence.    The hotel is close to everything and we were able to walk to all the main attractions.  There are a couple of great restaurants within a 2 minute walk.  Our favorites were Osteria Pastella for amazing freshly made pasta and Braceria Bisteccheria Ristorante for Florentine steak!  A great place to stay and I would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Very Noisy Rooms
review: I’ve stayed with my daughter in this divine boutique hotel several times, very well located and within easy waking distance of absolutely everything. What I love the most is it’s old world charm and heavenly outdoor spa which is essential after walking around Florence in a sea of tourists all day! I highly recommend this hotel the staff couldn’t have been more helpful, we’ll definitely be back.

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: A smaller older hotel with well preserved historical decor, not luxury or grand. The staff was very friendly. The location was great, less than 5 minutes walk to the Piazza Santa Maria Novella and about 10 minutes to the train station. Close to restaurants, shops and attractions. Our room was nice and clean but quite noisy early in the morning as it was facing the main street. Nice sitting area in the courtyard with a small Jacuzzi pool, and a comfortable lounge right by the bar. The restaurant was small and breakfast was just OK, and the regular coffee was bad.

title: SUPERB Customer Service, Perfect location--just BOOK IT!
review: Stayed 3 nights this week while visiting Florence. The hotel was very nice. The room was comfortable and cleaned each day. The two ladies at the front desk, Paola & Francesca were simply amazing. They were very personable and went out of their way to assist us with a tour booking and provided us a few restaurant recommendations. The complimentary breakfast was very good and the wait staff did a wonderful job. Would definitely recommend this hotel when staying in Florence.

title: Romantic boutique hotel
review: Dear Cheryl,   I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay by the Rivoli Boutique Hotel ! Paola, Francesca and the others are very professional and careful with our guests an I will be honoured to transfer your nice words to them.  Waiting to welcome you again in Florence, best regards and have a great weekend !   Daniele Torrini  residnet Manager

title: Friendly hotel at convenient location
review: The excellent service of this hotel started before we arrived.  A friend recommended this hotel for my parents 50th wedding anniversary because they would be treated like royalty.  Paula received my email informing her that I wanted to ensure that my parents would have a wonderful time because this was a lifetime trip for them.  She graciously replied that they would do be at our disposal when we arrived.    Upon checking in we were greeted by Daniel who was very friendly, readily shared his knowledge about where to eat, shop and what tours to take during our stay.  He went out of his way to be extra helpful and always provided the best service with a smile--very grateful.  The overnight staffer took care to book our day-trip at the last minute and was attentive with every…

title: Good experience at hotel with easy walking in Florence
review: This hotel has an interesting history as a it was a former convent from 11th century.  The common areas in this hotel are very nice.  The room we had was an inside room so there was no view at all.  The bed was also two singles pushed together and I found myself in the crack a couple of times.  The room was clean and the shower was very good.  I would probably look for a hotel closer to city center if I went back but the walk was 15 minutes or so.

title: Wonderful service
review: This is a lovely hotel with excellent gathering places both inside and out.  The restorations kept the historic aura while the modern features (the dining room is one example) are not jarring at all.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  Our room was on the first (US second) floor and faced the street, but we did not find the noise level as disturbing as others seemed to have found it.  The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom had a tub/shower combo. Every morning we had breakfast on the outside patio and especially enjoyed the coffee and hot milk brought to the table.  We came by train and the hotel is a short walk from the station, and a short walk to all of the historic attractions of Florence.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Cute hotel in an amazing location!
review: My husband and stayed there last week and loved the room and the service!! Paula (Pala) was so helpful in every way!! She made us feel more than welcome!! The hotel is situated near San Lorenzo square and the Central Market... so many beautiful sights and delicious food....

title: Beautiful boutique property
review: Dear Guest,   I'm so glad you reported such a positive experience at the Rivoli. We are really proud of our service and attention to the guest.  I hope you will come back again and stay here with us !  Greeting you with a sincere Arrivederci, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Beautiful boutique hotel
review: We arrived on a Saturday from Venice. If the room in Venice was red, our room here was blue. The room was much bigger from our experience in Venice. I would even say that it was a small suite as we had two rooms, one with the beds, closet, a big table, small fridge and the other had one big table where I could open my laptop and connect all my accessories. It also had a kettle for preparing coffee. The breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of choices for either an American or British ones. Located near the train station it is accessible by foot. The hotel is not far away from Piazza della Signora, Uffizzi Gallery and other attractions. Fantastic service and a most amazing desk. Highly recommended. I shall return here for sure!

title: Skip if you don't like cramped quarters.
review: We had a wonderful stay at this boutique hotel.  Friendly, attentive service without being overbearing.  Our room was well appointed, quiet and comfortable.  The pool is in a tranquil courtyard and was welcome in the 34 deg Celcius Florence weather!  The breakfast was delicious and staff very professional.  My husband has celiac disease, and there was absolutely no problem getting delicious gf bread with our breakfast.  We had dinner at the Benedicta restaurant, which I would highly recommend.

title: Fine small hotel
review: Stayed in a double room. This was the smallest double room we stayed in during our trek through Italy. This size room might reflect the fact this used to be a monastery, If you have multiple bags and have large builds,good luck.   Front Desk needs more than one person. Long wait if you need something or have a question. I needed a taxi and was standing for 5 minutes, waiting at the front desk. I asked the bellman where the taxi stand was or how to get a taxi and he said.. "I don't know " and nodded towards the front desk. Not an acceptable customer service response.  There was a problem with the safe. When we called downstairs, the same woman we"ve seen over the last three days handle the front desk by herself, answered our call and said she would be up in 15 mins. We waited 45…

title: Comfortable and convenient
review: Dear Annabelle,   I'm quite surprised about your comment, because if there is a note that every client makes is about good service we offer! We always have 2 person at least by the front desk and often is 3 of them, and the "same woman" you can see maximum late afternoon and morning of the day after, but then you will see her after at least 18 hours because our working time is on that !  If you come down by the reception in rush time it might be possible you wait a little as, like everywhere else there are also other guests tha need our assistance, this could be skipped just coming with the famous 5 minutes in advance.  Seen that I did not change any safe in the last months, the problem with your safe probably has been that you misplaced the code numbers,  Finally, it is written everywhere that the Rivoli Boutique Hotel takes place in a XIVth century convent, if you where expecting a "standrad" hotel, I'm afraid we are not and all our rooms are different in size and facings just telling us you were not happy we would have let you see other solutions.   I hope you will give us a second chance to let you appreciate totally our services and our house, hoping to welcome you again, best regards.  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Nice stay
review: Just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. All booked after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor - so was wondering if this hotel could be as good as all the reviews suggested. YOU WILL NOT be disappointed. This hotel is within easy walking distances of all the sights you would like to see, but fantastically quiet to relax in. The room size in comparison to other European cities is more than big enough, with ample cupboard space. I note some comments saying the rooms are small - they certainly are not. Yes the bathroom may be small but how much time are you going to spend in there! Plus the power strength of the shower more than makes up for the small size of the bathroom. The big plus for UK visitors is that the room has a kettle! VERY unusual for hotels abroad - so enjoy a…

title: Great location for us
review: Stayed here 3 nights.  This hotel has a long and interesting history as a former monastery and convent  The public spaces here are well decorated and very comfortable.  We were greeted warmly on arrival and that friendliness continued.  Our room (313) was very comfortable with a good sized bathroom.  It was pretty much a loft space with stairs leading to the room from the hallway, and a couple of stairs leading to the bath.  There was also a small terrace.  The hotel is located near the train station and is within walking distance of major attractions.  Breakfast was excellent, served in the hotel's restaurant.  There is a bar off the lobby, and available out door seating for relaxing.

title: Excellent stay
review: Dear Tom,   I really appreciate you shared with other travellers your impressions on our Rivoli Boutique Hotel, we try to welcome our guests and assist  at the best we can and it's a real pleasure to know we matched your expectations.  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence, best regards  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Cute hotel in Florence
review: This was our second stay at Rivoli (previously stay was in 2015). The location is perfect for us because it's close to the train station (making arrival/departure to Florence and day trips a snap), as well as within short walking distance to all this beautiful city has to offer. The rooms are clean and include the typical amenities. They are more updated than the staircase, which is a bit worn looking and at first glance may lead someone to think the rooms will be in the same condition. Breakfast is good and the staff was quick to remember our beverage orders every morning during our 5-night stay. We each had a free bottle of water on our nightstands every day. This time our rooms were a tad smaller than before (especially the bathroom), but it is in an old convent and they're…

title: Lovely place
review: The staff here are incredibly friendly and welcoming, especially in the restaurant. The location is great for sightseeing and easy access to the train station (about a 5 minute walk). Rooms are a little dated but well sized and very clean. The pool is more of a spar hot tub as you may expect in a city centre. Great for relaxing muscles after a long days sightseeing. Everywhere you turn in Florence is something to take your breath away - all within easy walking distance.

title: Ideal Hotel for Florence Visit
review: Dear Craig,   thanks for writing us your comment. I'm really glad you appreciated our Rivoli Boutique Hotel and our service.  Beeing the building a XIVth century convent, thats why all rooms have different sizes and facings.  Please, come back and will be more than glad to show you alternatives to small room ! Hoping to welcome you again, best regards,   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Good location
review: Second stay here, and as always treated really well . Restaurant is fab especially the garden one. Just a small walk from the centre of Florence . Rooms very clean and nice size . They will take your car for you and put it safely in a garage near by , so you don’t have to worry about parking

title: Fantastic Florence Gem!
review: Dear Guest,   it's a great honour for me to read that you choose repeating your experience by the Rivoli Boutique Hotel and appreciated one more our Benedicta Restaurant.  We try every day to assist our guests and guarantee the best possible experience and it's a great pleasure when we know that we matched our guests expectations.  Waiting to welcome you again in Florence, have a great day !   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Lovely small hotel in Florence
review: An absolute delight! Called them in advance to ask about a baby cot. No problem whatsoever. Arrived at the hotel and found to our surprise they had upgraded us from a triple to a prestige room. Hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but once inside it's quite charming. The room was excellent. Breakfast is good. We have no complaints, with the tiny note that wifi and cell reception (4g) is slightly less than ideal in the room itself. That means nothing though, when everything else is great. Thanks for a lovely stay. If we return to Firenze we'll be dissapointed if we can't find lodging here again.

title: Room was well appointed, modern and comfortable.
review: Dear Richard,   our "young" guests are always welcome !!  I'm really glad you appreciated the free upgrade we reserved you to guarantee a great experience in Florence. I really hope to welcome you again in Florence, at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  Sincerely best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Perfect Location  with wonderful front desk staff!
review: The hotel is lovely with an outside courtyard to relax in. Room was very nice. Staff are friendly and professional. The hotel is a short walk from the train station and less than 10 minutes to everything else.

title: Recommended
review: Dear Guest,   really glad you reported a positive experience from your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  Since 1964 we try to offer the best of our attentions to our guests to guarantee a positive and relaxing stay in Florence, even thanks to our Jacuzzi in the inside patio !  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Wonderful Modern Room for 3 people, large for Florence
review: Historic building with well done modern renovations.  Close to bus and train stations and short walks to great restaurants, sights, and shopping.  Wonderful hotel staff were very helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable.  The breakfast buffet was fantastic and the courtyard was a great place to relax and unwind.

title: Easily the nicest hotel of our Italian vacation
review: Dear Guest,  what a great pleasure reading your comment!  I'm really glad that the Rivoli Boutique Hotel and the staff, guaranteed you a Great Stay !  I hope you will want to come back to Florence and at the Rivoli, so that we can offer you once again our passion in Hospitality !  Have a great Day,   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Great 4 Star horel
review: I stayed here with my two teenage daughters in June. The hotel is very close to the train station and about a 12-minute walk to the center of Florence's historic area.   The room was called the Triple Prestige Room. It was a nice size room for Florence as rooms tend to run small in Italy. There was one queen sized bed and 1 single bed. The bathroom was quite large. They left candies by our bedside and very nice amenities in the bathroom. They also gave us one coupon for one free drink at the bar and a discount at the hotel restaurant.   The terrace is nice but has no views. The only con of this hotel is the drainage in the shower. The shower has jets on the side and above but the amount of water was too much for the slow pipes. The shower overflowed the first night and they had…

title: The hotel is a gem in Florence
review: Dear Haether,   Grazie ! for the nice comment you left here, we are always so pleased when guests reports a positive experience from the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  I hope to welcome you again in Florence and at the Rivoli, to relax in the garden or by the pool after a day visitng !  Best regards,   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Great Hotel
review: I’ve stayed in 4 hotels across Italy and this one was my favorite. It’s unique and truly special. Amile (sp?) the bartender was great! I really enjoyed talking with him. They have a nice pool and a hot tub that was great to soak your muscles after a long day of walking and touring the museums and palaces. Super convenient location.   Also, this was the only place I actually had a bathtub 😀. Funny what you miss. Great food for breakfast, huge variety. No complaints about this place.

title: Absolutely perfect
review: Dear Guest,   Wow !! Beeing Special for our guests it's really a great honour!  We tru to offer the best of our attentions and passion and it's a real pleasure fopr us to know that we matched your expectations.  I hope to welcome you again in our house and sen you my best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Wonderful Staff - Clean Hotel
review: This hotel was wonderful! The staff was so pleasant and helpful for anything we needed. The lobby/restaurant/garden area is really beautiful. So nice and so convenient.  Good breakfast with lots of choices.  Very comfortable stay.  We would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Quaint, historic hotel
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really glad you appreciated and enjoyed your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  I hope to welcome you again in Florence, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Small, noisy room, otherwise very nice.
review: This hotel is just OK. It feels a little neglected. We had a balcony room that overlooks the inner courtyard.  The room was small and if you opened the bathroom door and the entrance they banged together. There was not enough to room to unpack a second suitcase. Lots of little things were also annoying. The bathroom door wouldn’t stay closed. The hairdryer fell to pieces in my hand,  if you sat in the little bucket chair and leaned forward you fell over. The closed doors wouldn’t slide on the tracks. The bathroom floor got flooded when you had a shower as the screen wasn’t adequate to stop the wate going on the floof. For the price we paid it wasn’t value for money. Breakfast was only OK. Coffee was always cold, bread stale and the worse croissantsI have ever eaten. Location is…

title: Rivoli Boutique
review: Dear Susanne,   I'm sorry you had all those little inconveniences. I reported the maintenance the list of things you wrote and they are working on items tha cam be repaired or changed.  The size of the room unfortunately can not be changed. The Rivoli Boutique Hotel is in a XIVth century building and all our 87 rooms are differet, rooms overlooking the garden are smaller as originally were the bedrooms of the convent, just asking we could try to show you other solutions that would match your expectations. Concerning breakfast I can assure you that all breakfast items are daily and local products.  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence, best regrads.  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: An easy stroll to all the sights of Florence
review: After reading so many good reviews, I was a bit disappointed. Certainly it’s close to the station, and easy to walk to the river and historic area. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the public areas on the main floor were very nice.  I had e-mailed to ask for a quiet room. No reply, and my room was very noisy. It was facing the street with people talking loudly at 3am.  Also, quite noisy inside with guests returning late, and the people in the next room had a loud conference call singing Happy Birthday just as I had fallen asleep! My room was tiny, a single bed against the wall with just enough room on one side. The price was no cheaper (as far as I know) from a double room, but after traveling was too tired to go back down and ask. Having booked in advance, it was…

title: Boutique Hotel, good location
review: Dear Guest,   I'm glad you appreciated our services, and I'm really sorry about your concerns regarding the single room you booked.  As you may read quite everywhere, the Rivoli Boutique Hotel is a XIVth century convent and our single rooms are really single rooms. With a little supplement you could reserve a Double for Single use and the "bedding" would have been much different. Concerning the noise, all our rooms have double windows and mostly of the noise is kept outside, the only think we can not control is guests education that, sometimes is very difficult to keep under control.  I hope you will give us a second chance to let you appreciate the quietness of our inner rooms, for this reason I greet you with a sincere Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Very convenient location
review: i and my wife are so satisfiy that select florence and this hotel for honeymoon.very clean and amazing hotel in the nice location.but in last night we were shoked because the roof of bathroom destroyed and my wife scared by this event.although staffs of hotel apologize tomorrow .

title: Lovely hotel, good location, friendly staff
review: Dear Guest,   I'm so sorry for what happened to the ceiling in your bathroom. We still do not understand what happened to it but, fortunately your didn't report damages for this.  I hope this did not let you any negative impression on your honeymoon ! Hope to welcome you again here at the Rivoli, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Amazing hotel in amazing city
review: Perfect location in the city center, everything is walkable. The train station is at 5 mins walking so it is extremely convenient for those visitors traveling by train. My experience was overall positive, although having a room on a first floor facing a street open to traffic it is not quite relaxing, but I’m sure you can pick a better option with higher floors or rooms facing on the inside court (not sure if they have any). My room was just fine, I would expected something more upscale from a 4 stars hotel though.

title: Delightful
review: Dear Guest,   thank your for your review, this is very important to us ! I'm glad you appreciated your stay at the Rivoli Boutique hotel. We try every day since 1964 to meet our guests expectations and are very glad when we reach this!  Concerning the noise, I would suggest in case you will come back, please ask for a room overlooking the garden, and you will be sure of a totally relaxing night; beeing the Hotel in the city center, one of negatives is that of course you can hear noises from the street. Hoping to welcome you again, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Charming and wonderful breakfast
review: If full grade is 5 points, I would like to give my grading regarding the following aspects: Satisfaction with room: 5 Location of convenience: 3 Cleaning: 5 Service: 5 Breakfast: 4 Swimming pool: 4 Facilities: 5  I had to say that stay in this suite for two nights was an unforgettable experience in my honeymoon trip. As far as I know, the hotel room which located in Firenze is not too roomy, but the suite offered by this hotel is so spacious that you can almost have a party. Not only the roomy space, comfortable bedding, classical furnitures, marble pattern bathroom and decorations and classical style curtains are the characteristic of this suite. It was warm when I saw the blessing note and compliment dessert in my room, especially the honeymoon biscuits gift and handwritten…

title: Good Location
review: What a wonderful hotel! All the staff are so kind and helpful. It’s very charming place. Breakfast was amazing.   Five star for service and charm. Pena (excuse spelling) Our server at breakfast was so kind and remembered what we wanted in the morning. Beautiful cappuccinos. Hotel is clean and friendly

title: Good to stay...nice to come again
review: Hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from Main Train Station. Reception Staff very friendly and welcoming. Room fine, big double bed and large Bathroom. Only fault was we struggled to find plug outlets to charge our 2 phones. 1 had to remove the Trouser Press plug and the other charge of the USB on the tv (which if off doesn’t charge, woke 1 morning to find phone 4% battery and had to wait before going out sightseeing to use google maps) Bar and Breakfast Staff very friendly and Helpful. Lots of seating places to enjoy a Drink. Less than 15 minutes walk to any major landmarks

title: Excellent hotel with good location
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment.  We are converting the electric system to a new concept, in many of our room is already available a USB in each night tablle and three plus over the desk.  Hope to welcome you again for a "recharging" stay at the Rivoli, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Very Nice Hotel!
review: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel. The locations was fabulous, near the train station and minutes by foot to all of the great sites and shopping and places to eat. We came here on vacation and loved the feel of the hotel, the rooms were beautiful. We had a room with a balcony and the room was newly remodeled with grays and blues. The hot tub was awesome after a long day of walking. We sat in the hot tub with the rain gently falling on our heads, even in January it was awesome.

title: Great hotel
review: Dear Guest,  I'm so glad to read your comment, it's always a great plesure to receive feedback on our services, and really happy to see that even in Winter our Jacuzzi in the garden offers our guests a small pleasure after long walks.  I hope you will come back and enjoy your stay again at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel !  Best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: I would stay at the Rivoli again on my next trip
review: We had three rooms here over New Years Eve in Dec 2017. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The bar staff was excellent and friendly. Our rooms were comfortable and clean. Location was perfect- close enough to the Duomo and a block from the train station. I would stay here again if visiting Florence.

title: Unique, but not a 4 star by my standards!
review: Dear Guest,  I'm so happy you appreciated your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel! We work every day since more than 50ys to welcome our guests and let them have a great stay in our house.  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence, best regards.  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Nurturing welcome, restful space, beautiful people.
review: Hotel Rivoli was amazing. Definitely our favorite hotel of our Italy trip (and probably our favorite hotel of all time). It was uniquely decorated, super-comfortable and the staff were exceptional. They went out of their way to help us. For example, the reception staff pretty much guided us via mobile phone to the hotel when we were having extreme trouble navigating Florence's roads and ZTLs during roadworks. The restaurant was very helpful with gluten-intolerance and the Christmas meal was exceptional and reasonably priced. The hotel was our little haven in the ever-busy city of Florence. We would highly recommend.

title: Good Location in Florence Italy
review: Dear Guest,  I'm really honoured about your comment .  I really appreciate you enjoyed your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel, we aleays try to give our guests the best of our attentions and it's a great pleasure to know that we met your expectations.  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence, best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Lovely hotel
review: Arriving jet lagged and stressed to the max, Sani at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel offered me a huge, fragrant, steaming bowl of minestrone that nourished both spirit and body.  After a deep 12-hour sleep on a perfect mattress in a sound-proofed room, and a hot "rain shower", I was ready for 10 days in Tuscany and Umbria.  This is a remarkable hotel in an ancient and storied building, re-created to delight and serve guests.  Meet Johnny the owner if you can.  He will amaze you with his stories!

title: Comfortable charming hotel!
review: Dear Guest,  I'm so glad you had such a good experience with us at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  This is exactely what we try hardly every day to offer our guests, and the first person trying this since over 50 Ys is Gianni, the owner, he is EVERY day here ready to meet guests and welcome them in his house.  Hoping to welcome you again I wish you a very happy 2018  !!  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Lovely Hotel and Charming Design
review: The hotel is very aptly located near the train station. It is a 5 minute walk. The markets are close as well. The interiors of the hotel are amazing. Although the size of the rooms are small, they have all the necessities. The use of lights in the shower make it unique and a nice experience. The breakfast spread was not up to the mark of a hotel of this standard, but was manageable.

title: Central, Quiet and Friendly
review: Dear Guest,   I'm glad you appreciated your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  Concerning the room size, you are right, some of the are a little small but this is the particularity of our building as it is a XIVth century convent and, specially rooms over the garden are smaller as were used to be the Monks bedroom.  Hoping to show you in the future also the bigger rooms, best regards.  Daniele Torrini   Resident Manager

title: Lovely hotel in a good location
review: We were absolutely thrilled by the interior design of the hotel as well as our room.  Ideal located between the train station and the centre of the city, 5 minutes each.  Friendly staff in the reception during my check-in and check-out as well as the staff in the breakfast room (Pina and Eloana did really well in their jobs)  I would like to express that the Internet in our room was not too consisten but I am sure that can be fixed.

title: Romantic and Comfortable Stay
review: Dear Guest,  I'm really glad reading your comment, it's very nice for me to know that you haad a good experience in our house and, I will take your suggestion to let maintenance check the wi-fi line.  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel, best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Good location
review: We spent 5 very comfortable and happy days in Florence, staying at the Rivoli Hotel. We had arrived by train from Rome so it was only a very short walk to this hotel. (small supermarket near station very handy.) The red potted flowers by the entrance also became a welcome sight after a long day of walking. The hotel has very friendly and helpful staff, a very delicious breakfast, and beautiful public rooms and courtyards. We had a elegant room with a balcony on the second floor and it was just beautiful. We often sat out to relax and enjoy the view of the courtyard below. The furnishings were very tasteful and elegant, the king size bed extremely comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with complementary toiletries and even a white rose in a vase. The hotel is walking distance…

title: Right in the heart of Florence
review: Dear Guest,  I'm so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us!  Since 1964, the Rivoli Boutique Hotel hosts it's guests with the top of the attentions, we try to guarantee our guests the best experience and teh best Souvenir they can get from our Florence! I will extend your message to all my collegues and I'm sure they will be more than happy to read it !! Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: 5 days in Florence
review: Our room was clean and comfortable,fortunately it was located at the end of the corridor so it wasn’t noisy, the breakfast was good with variety of cheese and cereals.two kinds of juices and champagne.also there was scrambled eggs and sausage and ham. I liked the atmosphere of hotel, the hotels bar and restaurant was good looking but we didn’t go there. The location of hotel is perfect as it close to most of Florence attractions. The staff was so friendly and all of them were helpful . The drawbacks refers to the room,as our bed supposed to be a king bed and it looks like a king bed but it wasn’t.Actually they make a twin bed like king which was uncomfortable for me and my husband,the other drawback is that there was no heater in the room and the air conditioner’s highest degree…

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
review: Dear Guest,   I'm glad to read your comment. We try to do our best to assist our guests and to offer them the best experience we can. I hope you will come back to try also our restaurant Benedicta, which will complete your experience 100%.  Waiting to welcome you in t he next future, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: I don't want to leave
review: Dear Lee,  thanks for the nice comment and letting us know that you appreciated our services.  We do love our job and love to welcome guests to let them appreciate our beautiful city and have positive experience with us.  Hope to welcome you agaiu at the Rivoli, best regards and Arrivederci.   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Retired
review: The hotel staff is very pleasant.  The location of this hotel is extremely convenient.  It is within walking distance of the train station and I could walk to all the important tourist sights.  The elevator is extremely slow; I found myself walking the stairway to access my room most of the time.

title: Honeymoon adventures
review: Dear Guest,  I'm really glad you reported a nice experience in our house.  Elevators in this kind of building are always something "different" from modern standards as the building as you said is a XIVth century convent.  Hoping to welcome you again please receive our best regards.  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Nice Hotel
review: The exterior of this hotel might fool you. It just doesn't look like very much (but it has a great location---about a seven-minute walk from the train station.) However, the interior court yard, the lovely sitting area, the quaint hot tub/pool, and the little bar are all quite charming and reflect pride of ownership. There is also a Michelin star restaurant on site.  Our room was very large by European standards. The bathroom too was large with a big walk-in shower (that, unfortunately, tended to leak). A king sized bed, with crisp white sheets and sufficient blankets,  ensured a good night's sleep.   The buffet breakfast was delicious with lots of offerings---fresh fruit salad, fresh pastries, eggs, etc. Excellent servers who were most hospitable.  But, perhaps even better, was…

title: Great Place To Stay
review: Dear Guest,   honoured about your comment ! I'm so happy you enjoyed your stay in our house!  The Rivoli Boutique Hotel has place in a XIVth century building, and we mainteined charme and hospitalty from the history. Ourg gardens with the Jacuzzi or the Restaurant Benedicta are really a Peaceful oasis in the city center.  Hope to welcome you soon at the Rivoli, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident MAnager

title: Nice location, not so much the room
review: This hotel had LOVELY Public rooms. I had a room way in the back of the hotel. It was in the older section and you could sure tell it. It was a long walk to my elevator, (Others used an elevator right at reception) Then off the elevator it was a long walk to the very last room. I wasn't happy with the bathroom or my view of some sort of construction going on in the hotel. It just didn't give me the warm and fuzzy emotions that other hotels had done. It was a pain to get to my room and it was small and had a poor view. I guess it was acceptable for the price. We made good use of the beautiful public rooms.

title: Great Location and Restaurant.
review: Dear Beverly,  I thank you for the comment, The Rivoli Boutique Hotel, is located in a XIVth century convent, for this reason we do not have "standard" corridors and all our 87 rooms are different. Just telling us we could change you the room to let you have a completely satisfiing experience with us.  I hope you will give us a second opplortunity, best regards.  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

review: The location was perfect, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff were very helpful. No wonder this hotel is rated 4 stars! Relaxing at the pool with a Bellini is the perfect way to end a day of seeing beautiful Florence.

title: Holiday for Daughters 21st & our 25th Wedding Anniversary
review: Dear Guest,  I'm so glad you had such a good and relaxing experience at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel. Hope the next time you will have tha chance of tast also our Restaurant Benedicta, having dinner in the garden.  Hoping to welcome you again, best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Great Location, Decent Hotel
review: Stayed here with my husband for a week at the end of August, chosen for it's location and the many positive reviews we saw on here. We loved it! Great location, really close to train and bus station, lots of eating places nearby, close to all the beautiful sights of Florence, yet tucked away in a relatively quiet street. All the staff were so friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel itself was beautiful, very individual and so full of character. If you're interested, there is a booklet in the hotel detailing the building's origins and history, with more information about some of the building's features that remain, which we found fascinating. The room was very comfortable, overlooking an inner courtyard. Breakfast was good, plentiful, lots of choices, and we were always…

title: Amazing hotel
review: Dear Ms Lisa,   I'm so glad you had a great experience and the staff and hotel has matched your expectations.  We try to do our best in our job and it is a great pleasure to read that you appreciated it.  Our hotel is here since over 50 years and every day we try to welcome our guests at the best.  Hoping to welcome you again, Arrivederci !  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

Only a short walk from the station we were welcomed by friendly staff on arrival, The hotel is delifghtful and our room was well appointed. Added bonus of an excellent in house restaurant ideal after a long days travelling. Will return when visiting Florence

title: Very good hotel and excellent breakfast
review: Dear Chris,  glad about your review and ....wait to welcome you again when in Florence!  Best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Great location, would come back
review: Second visit to this hotel.  Loved our stay.  Front desk is very helpful.  Close to train station. Jacuzzi pool in the garden area that was great after a day of walking. Nice breakfast buffet with garden seating or inside.

title: Nicer than you would think from outside
review: The location is almost perfect - very close to the railway station, bus station and the historical centre. The staff is very friendly. My room was confortable enough and quiet. The breakfast is delicious and there is a lot to choose from the buffet.

title: Perfect hotel
review: Gorgeous hotel, great position and friendly staff, well priced. Breakfasts are yummy and lots to choose from. Their bar waiter was very responsive. Nice eating out restaurants close by. Would recommend staying here whilst in Florence.

title: All class
review: Dear Guest, honoured beeing recommended by you !  This shows really that we met your expectations and will be a pleasure to welcome your friends and you in the next future !  Best regards and have a great Day  Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Outstanding Hotel in Civitevecchia Center
review: Just one word perfect! It combines modern decorated rooms and comfortable beds with old elements from the past.  The garden offers nice place to relax after full day sightseeing or cool down in the small pool.   The staff is friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was nice with lots to choose from.

title: Lovely Friendly Hotel
review: Dear Guest,  when you say "perfect" ...what should I say ! I can only thank you and be so happy that you enjoyed your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  We try to keep our services on top standrd to offer our clients the best and it is for us a great pleasure when this is appreciated.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and greet you with a sincere Arrivederci !  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Be specific on the room
review: Lovely hotel with aircon, essential during the heatwave Italy has just experienced. We had a family room which was clean and tidy, comfortable beds. The buffet breakfast is excellent with a wide variety of food to choose from. The restaurant staff are excellent, very friendly and cheerful.

title: a rest from heaven
review: Dear Ms Monica,  I'm so glad you gad a nice stay with us at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel. We try every day to offer the best of our attentions, and I'm really happy to read that you appreciated them.  I hope  to welcome you again in our house and for the moment I greet you with a sincere Arrivederci !!  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Great breakfast restaurant staff
review: The hotel is conveniently located. Close to every attraction and transportation points. Nearby there are restaurants to go to after a long day of walking exploring the city. The breakfast was good and the ladies in charge go above and beyond to serve all your needs. Here is where you need to be careful: Our room number was 401. And I want to be very specific on this number. This room is on the first floor. By the restaurant and the pool. Only has one window with smoky glass because it faces an interior corridor which leads to the restaurant. You can imagine the noise in the morning with patrons going for breakfast and also at nights for dinner and even after wards with the crew cleaning. The room per se is dated the walls patched, the carpet worn. The closet door got stuck. They…

title: Central Location
review: Dear Maria,   thanks for your nice comment.  I'm sorry you didn't appreciate our room 401, a standard triple room with the sitting room. For us is very difficult to match all our clients expectations as, beeing the building a XIVth century convent, we do not have "standard" rooms, as we are not a standard hotel. On top of this, all our 87 rooms are different and when you tell us you don't like your room we always offer the chance of changing it.  I hope you will give us in the future a second chance, and hoping to welcome you again, best regards,   Daniele Torrini  resident Manager

title: Great service and atmosphere
review: The Rivoli is just steps from the train station.  It is a spectacular hotel.  The newly designed bedrooms are beautiful and have a really powerful multi sensory shower.  The staff are very helpful and the hotel's garden has its own orange and lemon trees.  Highly Recommended!

title: A Lovely Hotel Convenient To Everything
review: Dear Guest !   honoured to be suggested form you as a "Must" !  We try to do our best for our guests and I'm really glad reading that our efforts have been appreciated.  Waiting for your next visit in our house, Have a Great Day !!   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Home away from home
review: Booked this hotel with miles and then reached out to see about upgrading the room since it was a special occasion. They responded super quick, were able to upgrade and also handled our airport transportation, gave us a room with a balcony, had champagne in the room and a birthday cake. The breakfast restaurant has an amazing patio and a nice buffet which can be included. The entire hotel is super clean, rooms are huge and everyone super friendly. Walking distance to every site. We haven't taken a taxi yet and it's 5 min from train station, 25 from airport.

title: Stay away from ugly Americans
review: Dear Guest,   it has been a pleasure working on your "birthday". I'm glad you did appreciate it and had such a lovely experience !  It is always a very nice sensation for us to know that clients appreciated our job and efforts to guarantee  you a memorable stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  Hoping to welcome you again in the next future, again our Best wishes for the Birthday !!   Best regards,   Daniele Torrini  Resident Manager

title: Will visit again.
review: We stayed at the Hotel Rivoli in Florence from 7/2/17--7/5/17.  We had 2 lovely rooms, right next to each other, each with a small balcony which we enjoyed, particularly at night!  The small pool was clean and refreshing.  The daily breakfast was delicious, and we enjoyed it sitting outside each day at a garden table, which was lovely!  The front desk staff was very helpful, recommending restaurants for dinners and helping with travel arrangements.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: Dear Deb,   thans for the nice comment, I'm really glad you had a good experience with the Rivoli and it is always a great satisfaction for us to know that we met our guest expectations.  It's a great pleasure to read such nice words on our house and service.  Hoping to welcome you again, best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Perfect location,  lovely staff, and great breakfasts!
review: Excellent location, very attractively laid out and furnished, comfortable and well-equipped room. Had an unfortunate accident early on - broken bones & damaged ankle - which led to several hospital visits and the ruin of our holiday. The hotel staff were, without exception, very kind and extremely helpful.... so when we return to Florence to resume our exploration of this wonderful city we shall undoubtedly stay at this excellent hotel.

title: One night stay
review: Dear Mr John,   I'm so happy your experience at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel has been positive. Can't wait to welcome you again, hoping that the entire Holiday will be fine.  Hope now is going better with bones and ankle, all the best from all of us!   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager
