title: Beautiful hotel
review: This hotel is in a brilliant location, walking distance to the train station and only short walking distance to most of Florence's attractions. It is much more than this though. The building has real character and charm, and a spectacular history. One of few hotels that has two internal garden courtyards - one is part of the bar and the other is part of the Michelin rated restaurant. Seni, who runs the bar, made our stay extremely enjoyable with friendly service - always making sure guests were well looked after. I would unreservedly recommend the hotel, it was delightful.

title: Hotel Rivoli
review: Stayed two nights earlier this week and loved it. Great location, restaurant and lovely air conditioned rooms. Staff friendly and helpful and made us very welcome. There is a lovely extended reception area where we sat for coffee and drinks on several occasions. It is very tastefully decorated and I highly recommend it. Thank you.

title: Great location and a Pillow Menu!!!
review: Wonder hotel and the staff could not have  been nicer!  Very close to all the site seeing and restaurants.  They help provide travel accommodations and were very friendly.  Nest time in Florence we will definitely stay at The Hotel Rivoli!  They also helped setting up reservation at the Accedemia and Ufizzi.

title: Accomodating Staff, Great Location
review: My companion and I spent three nights in this conveniently located hotel.  We had a quiet room (2 room suite) overlooking the courtyard.    What I loved about this property: 1) The location was wonderful and we could walk to everything. 2) The staff was very friendly and helpful. 3) The pillow menu!  We stayed in 5 different properties across Italy on our last trip and I really did not like the pillows in any of them...until I saw the pillow menu here and could select what type of pillow suited me best.  Every hotel should take up this clever service. 4) The breakfast was good and plentiful and I ordered 2 cappuccinos every morning!  5) The treats by my bedside and the lovely welcome by the owner for our group! 6) A clean, well kept room. 7) We had a lovely wild boar pasta in…

title: Lovely Hotel Close To The Train!
review: This charming family run hotel, close to the train and the city centre is worth a visit. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has its own restaurant, which I recommend, the hotel manager also recommends other places to eat that the tourist would never find. Comfortable and clean rooms.

title: Great location and great staff!
review: Lovely hotel that's a 5 minute walk from the train station. Friendly, helpful staff and the property is very clean, quaint, and unique with a small pool, private court yard, and patios for some rooms. Very happy we chose this hotel.

title: A Gem!
review: Dear Ms Jessica,   I thank you for sharing your impressions with other travellers.  It is our whish to offer our guests the best experience in our house and it is always a great pleasure to read that we did it for you !  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli amd assuring you of our best attention, regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Quaint history hotel with modern services
review: Stayed here with my mother for 3 nights. Hotel room was clean and comfortable with good shower. The hotel itself is very charming, with a pretty and peaceful courtyard to enjoy drinks before dinner. Breakfast is good and plentiful. The location is excellent, within walking distance to the Duomo. And big shout out to the staff, especially Claudia on front desk who organised an eco tour of the city and skip the line for the Uffizi. Also the bartender, super friendly and makes great Aperol Spritz! Would stay here again.

title: The most beautiful city on earth!
review: Loved our stay at this hotel. Top notch customer service, charming courtyard and such rich history. Location couldn't be better either, a quick walk to train station and equally convenient to all the must-see sights. Thanks for helping to make our trip even more memorable!

title: Character and convenience
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really glad we satisfyied your expectations !  Hope t welcome you again at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Quaint Hotel
review: This beautiful centrally located hotel in the most beautiful city on earth was a pleasure to stay in! Delicious breakfast and friendly service! Amazing miniature Christmas exhibition for charity! Close to station and walking distance to the great Il Duomo! Tuscan Soup is delicious! Would love to revisit soon!

title: In heart of Florence
review: We stayed at the Rivoli Hotel for one night as a stopover between Zermatt and Rome. What a delightful hotel. Friendly, professional staff, wonderful ambience and a lovely room in a fascinating old building.  Great value for money and would definitely stay again.

title: Great hotel location

title: Fantastic place and staff
review: The Rivoli Hotel has a neat history behind it as it was previously a convent. It is beautifully decorated and has several places that you can go and just sit in quiet and enjoy.  One of which is the outside terrace. Although we had cool temperatures in the a.m. the afternoon was nice for a glass of wine.  It is minutes away from the train station and steps away to the oldest perfumery in Italy!  So many restaurants and attractions, including the Duomo, all within walking distance.  The complimentary breakfast buffet will fill you up until lunch and the staff is friendly and accommodating. Our room located on the 3rd floor overlooked the street and you can open the windows and people watch while sitting in a small area drinking a glass of wine.  The bed was comfortable with soft…

title: Great location, nice little hotel
review: Dear Mrs Lisa,  Thanks for sharing your impressions with other travellers.  I'm really glad you enjoyed your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel, since 1960 we try to offer our guests the best attentions we can and it's always a great homour to read that we matched your expectations.  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Good clean hotel centrally located
review: Everyone there was really nice and helpful, the breakfast buffet was good and more extensive than expected, and the location was perfect! We were unsure about the room and they showed us another one and let us choose between the two, most places wouldn't do that. I would definitely go back there again!

title: theft
review: Found ourselves unexpectedly without a place to stay so had to book very last minute. Very helpful staff got us a lovely balcony room. Lots of nice touches like the little bag of toiletries in the bathroom - sometimes small things really do create a positive impression.  The location is excellent - very close to the train station, and easy walking distance to the main tourist attractions. Some very nice and reasonably priced restaurants in the area which are worth checking out.

title: Some rooms are in need to a modern refurbishment.

title: Great Service
review: The best part of Rivoli Boutique Hotel is the garden and the terrace of selected room and the close vicinity to Firenze SMN Station. Reception area is average. Some areas of the hotel are a bit "worn-out":  the stairs with old carpet, old furniture, creaking bed springs, mattress with indentation in certain areas. It would have been a delight if they had opened the gardens also for breakfast. The quality of the breakfast is average. The waiters speak English and are very cheerful in the morning which always helps ease down the tension in a crowded breakfast room.  Eur 188 for a double.  Average rating for this quality and price, because there is nothing exceptional.

title: Fantastic place
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for your appreciated comment, this gives me the opportunity to inform you and other guests that we are working on renovation the building and in the next future also the rooms will be refurbished.  In those days it has been quite difficult opening the gardens for breakfast as in the early morning temperatures are not so comfortable.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel to appreciate our services. Whish you a great day !  Best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Beautiful place to stay
review: My baggage were delayed when I arrived in Rome and I didn't have it till 3 days later.  The hotel staff especially Paola was very helpful.  They offered everything they have like slippers, tooth brush and tooth paste.  When they learned that the delivery date would be the day I was leaving, they reached out to me as well as Air Canada to arrange delivery to my Rome hotel.  It was hard to arrange the new delivery with only a voice mail and no live person.  After left 4-5 messages, Paola found other numbers on the web and called Air Canada and got another number which she was finally able to talk to a real person and confirmed the baggage delivery to my Rome hotel 1 hour before I left Florence.  This hotel has great service, responsible staff and great breakfast.  I like the rooms…

title: Good hotel
review: I loved it. Great food, my room was very comfortable and quiet. Staff are so kind and pleasant. Location is very good as I was few minutes from train station. Many restaurants at walking distance.  If I visit again I would stay there again.  .......................

title: AS THE ITALIANS SAY 'FANTASTICO'
review: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location.  We especially loved the grand breakfast buffet.  The room was very very clean and efficient.  The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer.  Super friendly and gave us lots of good advice.  We loved it.

title: One Night Stay
review: We, a party of 4 friends, stayed at The Rivoli for 4 nights and we all could have stayed forever. Never have we felt so at home and comfortable in our surroundings. If you are going to run a hotel then this is the way to do it. In our opinion it has the highest accolade of Faultless.

title: Nice Hotel in the Center of Florence
review: What can I say?  We were here last year and came back.  Staff is friendly and accommodating.  Comfortable beds, our room was large enough for all three of us.  The buffet breakfast is filling with a good variety of foods.

title: Great hotel in a great location
review: I've been in this hotel just one night but I've found nice people and clean and big room. Wonderful breakfast and the hotel position is strategic and just in front the main station Santa Maria Novella. Very good

title: A real gem of Florence !
review: Stayed at this hotel during our city break to Florence last weekend. It is a lovely little hotel and the staff were extremely helpful and polite. The hotel is well located and within walking distance of all the main attractions. The staff are more than willing to help you find your way with maps of Florence being given or directions should you want them. Our room was excellent. A large double bed that was very comfortable and plenty of room to move about. There was a little lounge/sitting area as well which was handy, and the bathroom was good with a very powerful shower. Breakfast was a mix of continental and hot food and there was a plentiful supply of everything, and the quality was good. The hotel is very calm and cool-it has some delightful features which are successfully…

title: Perfect location for exploring Florence
review: I stayed in several Best Western branded small hotels in Italy and this one is superb! I booked several months ahead and got myself an incredible deal  but boy was even more pleasantly surprised when I got there. Excellent staff, concierge got us all the tickets we needed last minute for no extra charge, but room was actually the best part. It was actually a suite ( 3-4 people )  where you have a separate master bedroom with central garden view and separate room. Both with their TVs, beautiful marble bathroom and luxury linens. Even if we paid full pop, this would have been awesome. Real 4 star luxury in walking distance of everything in Florence.   I booked directly via italian Best Western website and emailed hotel staff with all my questions since I was getting the deal by…

title: What I would expect for a Boutique Hotel
review: Dear Guest,   I'm so glad you had such a good experience at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel ! We are no longer part of Best Western since January 2015... but we maintended and improved our quaity and services.   Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli in the next future, I assure you the best of our attentions !   Best regards,  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Charming small hotel
review: We've just returned from 3 nights at this delightful boutique hotel in a great location for exploring this beautiful city as well as being only a 5 minute walk from the main train station. Nothing was too much trouble - the staff were very attentive and helpful without being intrusive or pushy. Special mention to the service enjoyed from Paola at breakfast - a great start to our day - with enough choice for anyone. Our room (119) was small but modern and had been tastefully refurbished offering a shower with features not often seen in new build hotels - all this from a former convent building. Tea & coffee requested in room - delivered promptly and replenished throughout our stay. Fresh fruit and a smile everyday!  10 minute walk to Il Duomo and other key attractions - lots of…

title: Just perfect
review: Lovely hotel close to city centre (10 mins walk) and Duomo and museums. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and our room was comfortable and made spotless every day. The courtyard gardens looked beautiful even in early Spring. The restaurant that served breakfast looked and smelled appetising and the breakfast staff (especially Paola) were extremely attentive with fresh coffee/tea whenever we asked. The breakfast buffet was extensive and beautifully arranged with a hot option for those who wished and fresh fruits and meats and four different types of croissants. The public rooms were quiet, comfortable and furnished with interesting pieces. Special thanks for the help yourself bowl of apples in the foyer. Best hotel we have stayed in for a long time.

title: Homely Feeling
review: Just got back from four nights here - room 213  It's not often I refer to a hotel as " perfect" but for my tastes this was! A hotel located in what I feel is an ideal location, very very close to all the main attractions of Florence but not so close that you feel stifled, Best of all (for me) was the fact that I got brilliant nights sleep here due to the fact that the beds/pillows/spacious /ultra quiet room suited my needs.  And wow wow wow this hotel is so pretty! A converted ancient convent, renovated tastefully and respectfully still maintaining many of the original features...a joy to experience.  I could say so much more but I'll let you find out for yourself and leave with a final couple of comments .. THE BREAFAST - scrummy yummy with a superb array of choices and…

title: Fantastic Hotel with great rooms and service
review: This was the second stop on our 3 major city tour.  The city was nice and the hotel was located in the right place for us. Close to the train station and town center.  All the nice eating place are close by too. The room was nice and clean.  The room was on the first floor. The room was huge.  Their were 3 of us in the room and we were able to move around without any problems. The staff were friendly and the hotel is beautiful.  Lots of rooms with amazing views.

title: Quaint hotel in central Florence
review: I stayed for 5 nights at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel from 8th January to 13th January.  To get to hotel from train station was very easy and took about 5 minutes. The hotel was in a very convenient location within walking distance to everything.  The hotel itself was excellent.  I chose to upgrade my room to a room with a balcony and was very pleased I did.  The room was lovely and spacious and as I had a balcony it was lovely to sit outside . Breakfast was excellent and there was plenty of choice.The staff at the hotel were some of the best I have ever come across.  I had an incident where I left something in my previous hotel in Milan.  The hotel in Milan were unwilling to send it on to me.  However the reception staff at Rivoli couldn't do enough to help me.  They went to post…

title: Great Location
review: Cozy hotel close to the train terminal making it convenient for travel in country.  Easy walking distance to popular sites and restaurants in Florence.  High quality breakfast was included in our booking.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Rooms are being updated and we had a newly furnished room which was well appointed.  Would not hesitate to book again.

title: Great place
review: Dear Brad,   thanks for the nice comment, this means that you enjoyed the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  It is always a very positive sensation to read taht we match our client's expectations, and for thi reason I hope to welcome you again in the next future in order to taste also our Restaurant Benedicta and our Relaxing Jacuzzi in the garden.  Best regards   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Great room and lovely staff
review: We stayed in one of the new rooms which was wonderfully bright and airy with very modern grey and white decor. Fantastic bathroom/shower and a view over the pretty courtyard garden.  Loved the fact that the modern bedroom was complemented by the older features of the downstairs rooms ... hope it stays this way as the public areas (of which there are several) are wonderful with traditional furniture/decor that provide a great atmosphere.  Staff were excellent; welcoming and friendly with always time for acknowledgement and available to help.  Breakfast is served in the adjacent Benedicta restaurant and the choice is great and continually topped up so there is as much choice for latecomers as early risers.  The hotel is within a 15/20 minute walk of all of the major tourist…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Dear Lotus98,   I'really glad reading our hotel satisfyed your expectations.  We always try to offer the best experience to our guests at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel and it's a pleasure for us to have confirmation of this.  The new Prestige rooms have been studied to offer with their colours anfd lighting the best relaxing comfort. I hope you will come again at taste the Benedicta Restaurant in the next future and the other surprises for the next coming season.  Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Great location -
review: Spent two days in Florence with my husband. Hotel Rivoli couldn't have been in a better location, just a short walk to all of the main tourist sites. We were lucky as the 1st Sunday of the month is free entry to some of the museums & galleries. The hotel was absolutely spotless, probably the best housekeeping we've had, unfortunately our room was next to a road so was very noisy on the Saturday night! The continental breakfast was very good with plenty of espresso available. We didn't have an evening meal as there was a lovely little restaurant close by ( Grotta di Leo ) All of the staff were efficient, helpful & friendly

title: Excellent service
review: It was my second stay. Unexpectedly I've got a bigger room - it was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was good. At night it was pretty noisy outside - I had to close my windows.  The only and big disappointment - the hot tub was under maintenance, and no one cared to notify clients before they have booked the hotel. For me, the hot tub was one of the main reason to choose Rivoli, in other case I could have booked another hotel, less pricey. All I have got - excuses from a receptionist while check-in.  So, if you plan to use the hot tub while staying in the Rivoli - I strongly recommend you to ask beforehand.

title: Great location - poor experience
review: Dear Mrs Stephanie,   Thank you for your nice words on us, it is always a pleasure for us to red that.  I'm sorry for the Jacuzzy, but due to extreme urgent maintenance we had to stop it for while. I hope you will come back soon to have a relaxing bath in our garden.  Thanks again and Arrivederci !!  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: 3 night stay in Florence
review: Service melt my heart. Since there is no esculator, and we have bulky luggages -  we need to call hotel staff to pick up our luggage and climb up the stairs while check-in, and bring it down while check-out. LOT of works.  Room is ok. A bit aged but still in good condition.  Bathroom is very spacious. Room is clean.  Location is fantastic. Very close to train station. 3-min walk only. And walking distance to many city attractions.  Breakfast is normal. Boring. But you don't eat much at breakfast anyway. Chocolate drink is awesome,  So far not bad, really.

title: Nice and place!
review: My wife and I spent 10 nights in Rivoli in January 2017; we are in our late 60s; we loved Rivoli - and we loved Florence too; staff at the hotel were pleasant and helpful; breakfasts were excellent; Rivoli is within walking distance of many major attractions - we like churches, galleries, museums - and we walked *everywhere* for our 10 days in Florence; you can get to the hotel easily and cheaply from the airport; shuttle bus to railway station and then short walk to Rivoli; we travel light so I would not know about this walk between the station and the hotel if you had lots of luggage; our visit was during January and it was cold but really if you spend most of your time indoors at galleries etcetera, then you don't spend much time wandering around in the cold; there are many…

title: Centrally located and great service!!
review: Dear Guest,   it is a real pleasure for me to read tha you had a nice stay in our house.  Really glad that you appreciated our attentive service and our breakfast.  The Rivoli Boutique Hotel offers it's services from over 50 years and during this long period we have improved our services in order to satisfy and guarantee the best for our guests.  Relaxing quiet room overlooking the garden, the Outdoor Jacuzzi and the very good restaurant Benedicta makes the difference ! I hope to welcome you again in our Rivoli, for the moment I just thank you for choosing to spend your holiday with us and sen all our best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Pleasant, but bathrooms have problems in winter
review: Stayed here in a last minute trip to Italy!  Staff was very helpful- my sister needed a doctor and they were able to contact one who came to the hotel!  The room was a nice size - the beds were twin but very comfortable!  Breakfast was also nice with a good selection. The hotel is walking distance from the train station and close to the major sights!  Very clean also.

title: Very nice hotel in Florence
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really glad you reported a very good experience at tha Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  We are always very happy to help our guest and try to let them have all the assistance needed. Our Housekeeping staff then, takes very good care of the rooms and offers the best in cleaning and comfort in all the rooms.  Breakfast, with a great choice of local items guarantee the best way to start a very good day ! Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: An island of class in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice hotel in an old convent
review: Value for money right at the centre of Florence. Very cosy and very comfortable hotel. Nice people at the reception and everywhere. Also the breakfast is excellent with a variety of choices. Definitely a right place to have as base in Florence.

title: Lovely hotel and  staff
review: This is a quaint hotel with a good location. The rooms are relatively large and very clean. The staff are friendly and helpful with touristy stuff, like booking advance museum tickets. The complimentary breakfast is sufficient. There are tons of restaurants and shops within a short walk and we only needed to use a cab a couple times while we were staying at the hotel. There is a nice, large living room area downstairs, as well as a small bar, and a dinner restaurant.

title: A mix of the sublime and the quotidian
review: As this trip was to celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary I'd 'phoned to let them know. Whether this meant that we'd received preferential treatment I don't know. Our room was one of some that had recently been refurbished and was very nice with it's own little patio area.  The entire hotel was charming and the staff both friendly and helpful. We stayed on a bed and breakfast deal and thought the dinner menu a little expensive so can't comment on food anything other than the breakfasts. These were nice with a reasonable choice and if you asked, could get cappuccinos, espressos etc. rather than just pots of coffee. My tip here (as I like strong coffee) is to order an espresso at the same time as your cappuccinis and use it to top up the strength.  The hotel is ideally situated…

title: Perfect for what we needed
review: Dear Ms Terry,   I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay at the Boutique Rivoli. It has been a pleasure to upgrade you to one of our most romantic, quiet and comfortable Balcony room. Choosing the Rivoli for your celebration has been a grat honour for our House.  Thanks for all the nice words spen t on us and for writing here all those useful suggestions, I hope the next time you will come you will give also our restaurant Benedicta the chance of welcoming you, so you can appreciate the quality and services of our restaurant.  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, Happy New Year from all of us.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Great hotel
review: This was a really lovely place to stay!  Convenient to everything, including the train and bus station.  Lots of great shops near by!  Everything was great in this beautiful hotel including the nice selection for breakfast.  I had wifi problems which made my evenings frustrating, especially since it was winter, and no tv for me since I don't speak Italian.  That was my only issue!

title: Stayed here twice
review: Dear Guest,   I thank you for leaving here your experince impressions for other guests, and I'm really glad you appreciated our little Boutique Rivoli.  I'm going to check which was the problem in your room with the wi-fi, as we got in the last month a very strong and high performing connection throughout the building and this should not happen.  Concerning the TV, many foreign channels are set as English, American, French, Spanish, German, Chinese, Russian etc.  I hope the next time you will visit us you will have a fully positive experience.  Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Beautiful Family Friendly hotel
review: Great hotel, we stayed in a family room which was very comfortable for 2adults and two tall teenagers.  Hotel facilities were excellent as was the breakfasts.  Location was perfect close to train and centre of town.  Good value for money.

title: Very classic hotel
review: Dear Michemmy,   so nice to read your comment! I'm really glad you enjoyed your stay at the Rivoli Boutique Hotel.  Our family rooms are very comfortable also for two Tall teenagers !! HOpe to welcome you again here with us !  Whishing you all the best for the next coming 2017 and a very Merry Christmas, best regards  Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Excellent hotel near train station and restaurants!
review: We had a wonderful three day stay in Florence. The experience was hugely helped by the staff at the Hotel Rivoli. They are friendly, informed and extremely helpful. We decided to try and upgrade our room - they helped us. Both rooms were great, but the willingness to change a booking quickly was really impressive. The breakfast could be better but the staff made this a special weekend.

title: Surprise birthday holiday weekend
review: Dear Mr Owen,   I'm really glaad you had such a good weekend with us!  We try to guarantee our guests the best experience we can at the Rivoli and I'm always happy to read that this happened with you.  Hope to welcome you at the Rivoli soon, from all of us, our best regards.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Very nice hotel
review: Hotel Rivoli was chosen for us as one of our hotels by Tripmasters and what a lovely surprise it was! It is located at about an 8 minute walk from the train station and near restaurants and shops. The check in process was easy and the staff was courteous and spoke English. The highlight of this hotel for me was the breakfast. It is served in the hotel's main restaurant and it was one of the best breakfasts I've had at a hotel, complete with scrambled eggs, toast, different types of ham and cheeses, fruits, desserts, and even Prosecco to mix with the orange juice. We had 2 rooms, one triple and a double and both rooms were the recently remodeled ones. They were spacious and very clean. The hotel has a bar, but we did not get to check it out, but it is lovely. It also has a hot…

title: Nice Lodging Experience
review: Was a surprise birthday present from my boyfriend. Hotel was easy to locate from airport just a short bus ride . Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Accommodation was clean and to a high standard 4*

title: The Jewel in Florence's Crown
review: This hotel is fabulous and already I can't wait to come back! Its location near to main train station is excellent and only a short walk to/from everything that Florence has to offer. The hotel interior is elegant and tasteful and so was the room we stayed in. The room facilities were great and our bed was really comfortable. The staff were lovely and very attentive. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay very special and we look forward to returning.

title: excellent hotel - Loved it :-)
review: Dear Guest,   I'm so glad you had such a positive experience in our hotel.  We try every day to offer our guests a memorable stay in our beautifoul Florence and it is such a great pleasure to read that someone appreciated it ! Waiting to welcome you at the Rivoli, best regards from all of us.   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: well situated
review: The Hotel Rivoli is an absolute treasure, its location is perfect for visiting the sights that the city has to offer. The rooms are very comfortable, peaceful and well appointed, the staff are all very friendly, helpful and obliging. The hotel is kept spotlessly clean and fresh. Breakfast choices are varied and of a high standard and replenished frequently. A glass of Prosecco always goes down well at breakfast. Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful break.

title: Fantastic
review: Dear Guest !  so honoured to be "a jewel" and really glòad to read that you had such a good tine with us !  I hope to welcome you again and offer a glass of Prosecco by the Jacuzzi in our garden.   Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Resident Manager

title: Excellent Hotel, BUT...
review: My wife and I stayed at the Rivoli a few days ago for a short city break in Florence. We didn't want to break the bank on this occasion, and were looking for a good solid 3 star hotel that was within walking distance of the major attractions. I would say that this hotel was just about perfect for what we wanted to pay. It is clean and attractive with attentive staff, and provided a very reasonable free breakfast  which set us up for the day ahead each morning. We asked for a quiet room and were given an attic room on the third floor which faced away from the road and which had a very nice little balcony. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom a good size with a full size bath and shower. No noise at night from the street whatsoever. The hotel is perhaps a 6-7 minute stroll…

title: Terrible - don't stay here if you want to sleep
review: This is a very good hotel.  Good location, professional and efficient staff and nicely appointed rooms with a very good breakfast buffet, restaurant cuisine and wine.  But, although there is a thermostat in your room, they simply turn off the system when THEY have determined that you no longer need it and tell you to open the windows.    Like the rest of Italy, Florence is a noisy place and has mosquitoes, not to mention often being uncomfortably warm, even in October.  I do not expect to have to deal with all of this and wear earplugs to sleep in a four star hotel.  NOT OK (caps intended to represent frustrated shout).  Another slight ding for having no safe in our room.  Called the front desk and was told it is out for repair.  Really?  How difficult can it be to simply put in…

title: A Wonderful Base for A Stay in Florence
review: We expected a pleasant stay from reading the reviews. Also the people we were travelling with had stayed here 3 years prior with a positive experience. All appeared well, our initial room was lovely and modern over looking the street, very comfortable bed and the hotel is in an excellent location. However the air conditioning was not working in our room so there was no ventilation, it went from being either hot or cold (they had to give us a bar heater!). We discussed this with the hotel on the 1st day of our 6 day stay and they said the service was broken and would contact us when it was fixed. They never did. We worked out the fan was broken and kept explaining this to them (my husband is an Architect). The whole stay then became a battle. They had lied about the air…

title: Great Hotel - Close to Train
review: I stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for a week in October 2016 and it was just what I had hoped for.  The facilities were very pleasant - with historical significance - and the staff were extremely helpful.  For example, I asked to borrow an iron and was provided with one instantly.  On the day I checked out, I had to make an early morning flight, and the staff provided me with a generous boxed breakfast, because I was leaving before the breakfast room opened.  The rooms were comfortable and the maid service very good. The prices struck me as reasonable for Florence, and good value for the money.  The Santa Maria Novella section of Florence is a busy part of the city, and Hotel Rivoli provides an oasis.  I will be returning in the winter and intend to book another stay at the Rivoli.

title: Very responsive staff.
review: First the pros - the staff are fantastic as is the location, and the rooms large and some with balcony Con's - the price is very expensive for what you get, and the 'queen/double' bed is two beds pushed together making it very uncomfortable and disappointing for the room price.  What I stay here again - yes for the location but only if I got a good deal on one of the website booking sites.

title: Be warned of master controlled room temperature
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really glad you appreciated our service and our hotel.   Concerning the Beds, we are forced to have the main part of them with the two beds pushed as we have to be ready to split them in two separate.  We also have some of them with a large king size bed, please remember us the next time and we will provide for you one of those rooms.  Hoping to welcome you again in the next future, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent hotel, ideally situated
review: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a tour group and paid extra for a suite, #137.  Overall the hotel is in very good condition with one or two odd exceptions like the worn and frayed sofa in our sitting area.  The lighting was not so great in the bathroom.  The bedroom had a large window which made the room bright during the day.  The staff was exceptionally helpful and responsive.  The hotel is near the train station, so it's a bit of a walk to the popular attractions.

title: the stairs lean to the left!
review: Dear Mr Steve,   thanks for the nice comment!  I'm really glad you enjoyed your stay at the Rivoli.  We will do some changements also this winter and I will for sure forward your suggestions with the property. I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and for the moment I greet you with a sincere Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Florence holiday
review: Although not the hotel we had originally booked we could not fault the Hotel Rivoli and would definitely return. The location is ideal for all the city sights, near a very pretty square The Santa Maria Novella (the church here is a must see for the frescos). Also a short walk to the bus station (pick up for trips), and the train station.  The staff were very welcoming and helpful which added to the relaxed atmosphere. The buffet breakfast was always fresh with plenty of choice, although the restaurant menu looked very nice we did not get the chance to eat here. There are so many local trattorias which were nice to try and I would recommend the Marione for lunch and the Trattoria al Trebbio in the evening.  I would like to thank the Hotel Rivoli for a wonderful 4 night stay…

title: A perfect stay in Florence
review: Dear Guest,   I really appreciate your comment on us  ! It has been a real pleasure welcoming you for your stay in our house.  To try our restaurant Benedicta, you will be "forced" to come back to Florence, and I will suggest a hotter season so you can appreciate dining in our garden.  Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regrads.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Good hotel at a great location
review: Having decided to base ourselves in Firenze (Florence) for a weeks break we wanted a centrally based hotel. The proximity of the Hotel Rivoli to the Santa Maria Novella station and the centre of the city were excellent. A two minute walk to the station one way and the same time to the centre of this remarkable city! The hotel is styled in a typical old fashioned Italian format but the bedrooms were more modern and well presented. The staff on reception, in the restaurant and bar were always courteous and helpful.

title: An oasis of calm
review: Dear Guest,   I'm so glad you choose the Rivoli for your Holiday in  Florence, and that it has been a positive experience for you.   Together with the entire staff, we try to let our guest feel like comfortable and welcome and we are aprticulary happy when this is appreciated.   I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and send you our sincere Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: A great place to stay
review: This hotel is quite quaint.Would have been great in it's day but It's a little tired now. Still it was clean and comfortable and in a great location within walking distance to major attractions in Florence. Reception and breakfast staff weren't very friendly. Adelle who looked after the bar area was the exception. She was really nice but had a huge area to service. Breakfast was very ordinary. The worst we had on our trip. The only low light to what was a nice time in Italy.

title: Hotel Rivoli Florence
review: Hotel is comfy and clean, front rooms can be noisy from road but we still had a good nights sleep, staff on front desk welcoming and helpful. Breakfast is typically continental and plenty of choice, restaurant was also good nice food all of the staff put themselves out to help you. Hotel is great location for city walks also for trains and buses,front desk also helped us with timetables,they also recommended some nice restaurants. Would recommend to others a nice place to stay.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel, Great Location
review: Hotel Rivoli is perfectly situated 5 minutes from Firenze Santa Maria Novella train station and within walking distance of everything. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast had a good variety of items.  We loved dining outside in the morning!  Bed was the perfect firmness, very important!  We would definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent hotel.
review: We stayed at Rivoli for two nights and really enjoyed our stay. The lobby area is nicely decorated with a lot of vintage furniture and paintings. The rooms are very spacious (we had a Deluxe Queen room). We didn't use the restaurant but seemed like a popular restaurant. The included breakfast was great as well with a lot of high quality options. But mostly the location was perfect. Close to train station and tourist attractions.

title: Boutique style hotel in area close to train station and main tourist attractions
review: This hotel is in a great location, close to Santa Maria Novella train station and piazza. The hotel is lovely and the rooms are large and comfortable. We had an early morning train to catch and they prepared a breakfast box for us as we wouldn't be able to have breakfast before we left. We also had an issue with our safe and they called in a staff member early to fix it so we wouldn't miss our train.  A huge thank you to Alexander for going above and beyond to help us and also to the lovely lady that came into work early to fix the problem (I'm so sorry I didn't get your name)

title: Unfortunately only 2 nights stay
review: Dear Natalie,  Paola, Alexander and I , thank you for the nice words left here on our service. We try always to offer the best of our attentions and it's a great satisfaction when this is appreciated from our guests.  Waiting to welcome you at the Rivoli, best regards and thanks again.   Paola, Alex Daniele Torrini - Ass. Manager

title: Fantastic hotel Rivoli - see you soon again!
review: This hotel offers a convenient location, helpful staff, comfortable rooms and an included breakfast buffet for a reasonable price. The front desk staff was very helpful and the breakfast buffet staff efficient and friendly. We would stay here again.

title: wonderful service
review: We (2 adults and teen) stayed in this beautiful hotel 2 nights from 8/26-8/28 and had been very happy with our choice. Service from all staff was exellent, breakfast was very good (scrumble eggs, hard eggs, becon, cold cuts, cheese, pastry, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea and some fruits, do not remember which exactly). Our room was not huge but charming and comfortable with vew on the garden and pool. And our teen had real comfortable bed. After whole day of walking, glass of vine in their garden or relax in the pool are really rewarding. One evening we dine in their restaurant. Food was very good (vine was good beyond believe) service was exellent. Plase see attached menu. Location of the hotel can not be better. If you are coming to florence by train from firenze s.m.n. even with…

title: Florence Magic
review: Hotel Rivoli is AMAZING! From the moment we arrived we felt welcome , Francesco checked us in, And  the porter Ioan  ushered us to our room. When we entered the room, the AC was malfunctioning so Ioan called the front desk immediately. Francesco had another room ready for us right away. My husband and I were so tired, and grateful for a nice, clean plush room with a great quality bed! Hotel Rivoli is beautiful! I wondered around and snapped pictures of everything, I especially loved the courtyard and the lemon trees growing up trellises. Wonder if that will work in Texas?  I think even the most Picky of hotel frequenter would be pleased with The Hotel Rivoli! I hope to someday return!

title: 2 night stay
review: Dear Kristal,   thanks for the very nice review left here and for appreciating the great professionality of Francesca and Ioan.  We are really proud of the entire staff of the Rivoli, all of us try to do the best to guarantee a very pleasant stay in our house, and create good memeories too.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and let you have another great stay with us.  best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Wonderful hotel in a superb location
review: The courtesy and service from all staff was excellent. My husband mislaid our room key, was very upset, the receptionist kindly produced a new one and invalidated the old one in minutes. The old one turned up and we handed it in to reception. Bedroom was spotless, clean towels daily, ,toiletries restocked, bed linen changed, hot water at all times. Working safe,  mini bar and good aircon. Breakfast was a good start to the day with choice of hot and cold dishes and pastries served in dining room or courtyard. There is a garden bar which leads to a large Jacuzzi, very welcome after becoming footsore. A porter brings pool towels. It is not a swimming pool more of a hot tub. The location was perfect for the popular sites. Make bookings to avoid queues at e.g. David and Uffizi…

title: Italian adventure in Florence
review: Dear Mrs Barbara,   I'm so glad you had a great experience in our hotel ! This is a great satisfaction for all of us. We try to give every day the best of our service and I'm really glad when this meets our guests expectations.   Thanks again for staying at the Rivoli and, waiting to welcome you again here I send you our best regards and a sincere Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Beautiful hotel in a perfect location
review: Great hotel to unwind relax. Pool, restaurant, comfortable rooms. Very nice stay. Full buffet meals. Close to some great restaurants, walking distance to everything. Old monastery with classic charm but modern amenities. Whirlpool fitness center.

title: Perfect-location, food, friendly, clean
review: We stayed for two nights in this wonderful hotel.  The location is perfect. Walking distance to the train station, just a 5 minute walk one street over.  It is a 5 minute walk to the Duomo, and all other major sights are within 15 minutes. The street was safe during the day and night with corner stores and restaurants around.The room was modern, clean, large and beautiful. The bed was comfortable and inviting. The bathroom was spacious, with a large shower with multiple shower heads. The staff was always helpful. Breakfast was typical Italian, meats, cheeses, etc, perfect to start the day.  Would stay here again.

title: Bellissimo! Beautiful and convenient.
review: Dear Diane,   I'm so glad you ejoyed your stay at the Rivoli.  We always try to do our best to "welcome" our guests, and it is very important for me to have feedback on this in order to improve it.  Hope to welcome you again in Florence, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: The best hotel nearby to Train Station
review: We really loved this hotel. It is an old monastery done up as a beautiful hotel. Very clean, very helpful staff. The air conditioning was a saviour! We found the location great. Going left from the hotel there were supermarkets and the train station and shopping centre, then right was a short walk away from the beautiful Duomo with lots of restaurants and shops. It was so handy to be near the train station. Lovely choice of breakfast. Every day the room and bathroom room were cleaned. Beautiful garden and jacuzzi. I would really recommend this hotel-we were there 5 days in Florence and were sad to leave this beautiful city and atmospheric hotel.

title: Clean and comfortable stay

title: Perfect for a city break
review: Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were large and always very clean. The location isn't the best - we named it 'Hotel Street' and you do spend time dodging other tourists dawdling on the sidewalk. But is still within walking distance to all Firenze attractions and close to the train station.   Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for Ferragosto/Assumption break when we visited, otherwise we would have loved to have tried it.

title: 50th birthday
review: Dear Guest,   I'm glad to read you had a very good experience in our house, we try every day to do our best to give guests the best of our attentions and is a gret pleasure for us to know when we match your expectations.  Waiting to welcome you for your next visit in Florence, best rgards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Lovely hotel with amazing staff
review: In August my wife and I visited Hotel Rivoli for a city break. The city of Florence is a wealth of art and history, and Hotel Rivoli was the perfect place to investigate from, as it is a 10 -15 minute walk from most of the major attractions.  As we visited in August it was hot, and so after a day walking, we loved a swim and a cocktail!  The staff were all helpful and considerate.

title: A good hotel
review: Dear Mr Jon-Paul,   Grazie ! I'm glad to read that our hotel encountered your approval and satisfied your expectations.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli in the next future and for the moment I just greet you witha sincere Arrivederci !  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Such a friendly place.
review: Just returned from a trip to Italy which included 3 days in Florence.  I loved the Hotel Rivoli!  It was located within easy walking distance to the train station, but it never felt unsafe. The staff was so friendly and helpful.  They were quick to change our room when I asked for a more quiet room because my husband hadn't been sleeping well.  We had a gorgeous little balcony and the room was beautiful!  Everything was Very clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable! The breakfast wasn't fancy, but it was adequate and served us well as we would go off each morning. The hotel has a small pool and a resteraunt which we didn't try, but it looked nice!  We did sit outside and have a grappa and dessert one evening and the service was exceptional.  They went out of their way to…

title: Super service.but needs finishing touches
review: Dear Guest,   thank you so much for let us know your experience and positive impressions. It is so exciting for us to know that our daily efforts to welcome guests in our house have been appreciated, I really hope that the memory of this trip to Florence will be with you for a long long time and, when this will seem to end....just come back to the Rivoli and we will be more then happy to "refresh" your experience with us.  Waiting to welcome you again, best regrads,   Daniele Torrini  Ass. Manager

title: Ideal location
review: A beautiful hotel made even more special by the staff who work there. Friendly, attentive and very helpful.   We stayed three nights in two rooms and was the best hotel we stayed in over the two weeks.   Parking is simple, 23€ per day concierge service arranged by the hotel.  Can highly recommend it to others.

title: Lovely hotel, great value
review: Dear Malcom,  thanks for writing here your impressions on our hotel and service.  I'm really honoured to work with a staff that welcomes guests and try to assist in any question or need requiered, it is very important for us to guarantee an "experience" to all the guests that comes to the Rivoli for visiting our beautiful city.  I hope to welcome you again and welcome also your friends that will chose the Rivoli as  home in Florence.  Best regards   Danieel Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great stay in Florence
review: We booked the hotel because of its proximity to the S. Maria Novella Train station. The stay was very good. The room was clean with a large bathroom. We were booked on the first floor overlooking Via La Scala which unfortunately was quite noisy. The hotel staff were fantastic, the breakfast was abundant and good the garden area with pool is very nice for a relaxing late day/evening dip or drink to cool off from the day's activities. The hotel is very close to S. Maria Novella church and you can walk to all the attractions this fantastic city has to offer. Our only disappointment was the wifi which was not as reliable as we would have liked. I would recommend and stay at this hotel again.

title: Excellent location and very clean
review: We stayed in july 2016 with friends (2 rooms) and really enjoyed the hotel. The breakfast is extensive and good, staff are professional, attentive and quick to respond to questions. Everyone speaks good English and there were many US-guests in the hotel, as a result.  The large jacuzi/swimming pool in the courtyard is fun, and you can sit there nicely with a drink in the evening.  Do visit the restaurant, which is quite good, creative and not too expensive.

title: One of our new faves!
review: We stayed at Hotel Rivoli in June 2016 for two nights. We booked it for its proximity to the train station and were happy to find that it was also very close to the Maria Novella Square, many restaurants, shops and walking distance to all of the main attractions.  Our check-in was quite smooth and quick. We were amazed to see the size of our room. We had a sitting area and a large bedroom area. It was the largest room we had during our entire three week trip.  The bathroom was quite large as well, and we were happy to see that the shower was actually big enough for one person!  The bed was very comfortable and there were plenty of extra pillows. There was a TV and mini bar in the room. We didn't eat/drink from the mini bar, but there was a variety of beverages in there for an…

title: Nice hotel and Great location
review: Fabulous room and service! Delicious breakfast on outdoor patio. Great bar and bartender, Adele. Walking distance to train station and all Florence attractions. And the restaurant for dinner was luxurious and reasonable. Perfect place to stay in beautiful Florence.

title: Great place to stay in Florence!!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: A nice hotel
review: Our daughter was doing a study abroad in Florence and we stayed at Hotel Rivoli for 11 nights while visiting her and traveling through Northern Italy.  Hotel Rivoli is in a great location...very close to the Train Station and close to our daughter's apartment near The Duomo.  The room was lovely, clean and reasonably priced, including a very nice breakfast buffet.  The hotel employees were all so kind, cheerful and helpful and made us feel very comfortable and welcome.  We looked at many hotels on line and took a chance on Hotel Rivoli based on the reviews we read and we are so glad we did!!  Highly recommend!!

title: Top hotel and top service
review: This hotel was nice but not up to the standard of the others we stayed in.  It was centrally located so we could walk to the major sights.  The staff were very nice and helpful.  The breakfast here was awesome.

title: One of the best hotels in Florence!
review: Coming to central Florence in July during a hot day is quite a feat for a foreigner : a lot of roads were closed so it took quite a long time to arrive to the hotel .... we were tired, hot and in advance ofr the room. The staff took everything in charge : car (to a nearby private paying parking), luggage (everything marked in our name) and registration. We were told to come back a while later for the room (normal). When we came back the room was ready : a very nice family room in the back (503). The room was very big for 4 two adults and two teenager, with excellent AC, desk, closet, bathroom and in old Florence style ! Everything was clean and ready for us. The pool is very nice after a hot day marching around Florence, and its niched inside the hotel : quite original. On the…

title: Central  location
review: This was our fifth time staying at the Rivoli and it did not disappoint! We feel like we are home every time we stay here! The hotel itself is simply beautiful and is near the train station in Santa Maria Novella. The rooms and area are spotless and beautiful! The breakfast in the morning is served in a beautiful garden room or inside. The staff is always warm and welcoming and always remember us. The bar area is beautiful and a wonderful place to relax before dinner. They also bring you little nibbles! Daniele and Francesca and the wonderful people in the restaurant are fabulous! We look forward to going back year after year! The Hotel Rivoli is truly one of the gems of Florence!

title: Fabulous hotel but bring earplugs
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Well appointed, wonderful staff
review: I really want to rate the Rivoli with 5 stars; it's such a lovely hotel with great staff, fantastic location and an amazing breakfast. But the fact that you can hear everything from neighbouring rooms and the hallway takes the review down to 4/5. The WiFi is also not super reliable but it's a minor detail on holiday while quality of sleep is not. Earplugs definitely needed! Otherwise as said, the location is superb with walking distance basically anywhere. The staff is friendly, helpful and especially the breakfast staff probably the nicest I've ever come across. Free apples, complimentary water bottles when you arrive, the jacuzzi in the garden and the balcony in our room...Loved it. Please fix the sound problem and I'll definitely come back!

title: Not Quite a Pool, but Nice Nonetheless!
review: Our stay at the Hotel Rivoli was one of the best experiences in all my travelling. It is within walking distance of so many attractions. The interior was well kept and beautifully designed and furnished. Our room was very comfortable and overlooked a wonderful courtyard.. The restaurant's food was excellent. I feel the staff is world class.very courteous and attentive.  They were very helpful and kind when my wife's purse was stolen at another outdoor location.The scale below doesn't do them justice. We will come back for another stay at the Rivoli the next time we visit Florence,

title: Must Stay & Eat at htl restaurant
review: We stayed in a small corner room with sloped ceilings, but it was cozy, and quiet as it was far above the street.  The location of the hotel is great, as it is close to the train station, as well as near to most of the main sites.  The reception staff were very helpful with making dinner reservations as well.    The "pool" is actually a largeish jacuzzi, which was pleasant to lie in for a bit after a day of walking.

title: Wonderful week stay
review: We are from Australia visit Italy >> Rome , Florence & Venice. In Florence we stay at Rivoli hotel near Florence Train Station. The hotel is one of the best. As you come in ( at summer time ) , you will feel the hotel AC ( almost every where ). The Restaurant food and service are best. The staff both hotel and restaurant very polite , prompted , help full. This is one of the best so far on our trips. We will stay here again next to Florence. YOUR HOLIDAY IN FLORENCE WILL NOT COMPLETE WITHOUT EAT IN THE RIVOLI HOTEL RESTAURANT.

title: LOVELY HOTEL AND ROOM IN FLORENCE
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Ideal location in a quiet area
review: We stayed here in July for 4 nights. The room and lobby and hotel itself was very pretty. Location is about 10 min walk from station for taking trains around Italy. The restaurant for dinner is very good with service and food being excellent. Breakfast however not good at all. Was included in price so just went there but quality of food is poor and choice poor. The location with respect to other major sights is average about 20 min walk or so to Piazza de Giovanni and the Main shopping area.  Other street side restaurants around this hotel average. The bathroom is big and tub is good. Towels plentiful and there is a safe and nice closet to change and leave bags in. There is a desk with outlets in a separate area. The kids beds separated from adult beds by a little wall . If…

title: Beautiful hotel!
review: Staff extremely helpful with train times and always friendly and polite. The hotel was comfortable and room service changing sheets and towels daily and keeping room clean was faultless. Restaurant Benedicta for breakfast. Good selection of fresh fruit salad or a bowl of fruit, cereals, yoghurts, fruit juices. Bread to toast, rolls and pastries as well as a cooked meat and scrambled egg, cold meat and cheese platter and salad bar. Coffee or tea provided by the waiteress. Personal choice we would have liked a kettle in the room to make tea or coffee.

title: Great atmosphere and services
review: Dear Yvonne,   I'm so happy you had a positive experience in our house. The Rivoli welcomes it's guests since 1964 and we try to improve our services every day to give our guest the best we can.  Concernig the coffee or tea facilities, it is possible to ask for it as it is a free service on request .  I hope you will come back to the Rivoli in the next future and, thanking you for the nice words, please receiove from all of us a sincere Arrivederci.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Classic property with the delight of a pool
review: This is a wonderful property, which maintains Tuscany region's essence in everything from decor, food to service. We loved our room. Garden and outdoor restaurant areas were beautiful. Staff was very friendly. Hotel is in a very convenient location. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel! Food in restaurant was very good as well, and I think restaurant was priced modestly, too. Bravo to managers and staff. Wifi was really bad, so don't count on it.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location

title: Probably the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in.
review: I was looking for a hotel near the S.M.N. train station and was fortunate to find this gem.  My room was compact, but impeccably clean, and with such lovely common areas, I found that I spent very little time in my room.  The hotel staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was excellent with good variety. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again if my travels ever take me back to Florence.

title: Luxory Old World Charm
review: We have just  spent a fantastic 3 nights at the Hotel Rivoli and would definitely stay there again. The interiors are beautifully decorated and our room (221) was very clean, quiet and cool, Florence was very hot this week and the air con handled it perfectly. Our private little terrace was great for sitting out in the evening as the sun went down. It overlooked the courtyard but we didn't feel that we were overlooked by the other guests. Breakfast was great, a better than average continental breakfast with a great choice and they served until 10.30am which is just right for us late risers. The staff were very pleasant, polite and unobtrusive, they reserved a table at a lovely restaurant close by for our first night. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay…

title: Lovely hotel right near the train station.
review: Love this hotel! Very Charming, not too small, not too big. Stayed in room 134. Traveling with my husband and two daughters. Large suite with traditional decor but nice marble bathroom, bedroom with tv and pocket doors. Suite area with sofa/bed conversions. Apparently they were very uncomfortable for my girls....but our bed was firm and comfortable. Street noise late night and early morning was a big issue unfortunately but not really sure what hotel could have done about it. I used earplugs the second night and I was fine. Courtyard rooms are probably much quieter. Beautiful courtyard with large jacuzzi pool thing. Could dine outside or inside for breakfast. Very pretty common areas. Bar, large fancy sitting room, wifi free, minifridge in our room, coffee/tea service was set up…

title: Historic monastery turned hotel
review: Very pleased with the location and amenities.  Our room was very spacious and we truly enjoyed the hot tub in the beautiful courtyard.  Our breakfast was very good and the restaurant lovely.  Can not say enough good things about the staff very pleasant and very helpful.

title: Great stay in Florence
review: The  location here is great; near to all the 'must see' places in Florence. Rivoli has a brilliant court yard space in the middle of the hotel so you can collapse and have a drink during or at the end of the day. Our room was newly refurbished and beautifully clean. Only problem is the lack of soundproofing between rooms. Breakfast is good if not great.

title: Great location and very nice staff
review: Dear Helen,   I'm really glad you appreciated your stay in our house. Our gardens are really relaxing and happy you had the chance of tasting our bar in the garden and "collapse" here with us.  Concerning the soundproof, we try t o do our best but, the building is dated XIVth century and is quite  difficult .... Hoping to welcome you agaain at the Rivoli,  best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Good location and friendly staff
review: Had a great stay at the Hotel Rivoli. Centrally located near the Piazza Santa Maria Novella. Nice rooms. Only downfall was the WIFI. Signal in the room was terrible. That was the only issue. Very cordial staff. Great place!

title: Highly recommended!
review: This was my first  tour of Florence but the third visit to Italy, and we booked a family room  at Hotel Rivoli  for two nights. That room has two separate areas  to accommodate a family of 4 but  one bathroom.  It can  accommodate  a family with ease and it is overlooking a quiet courtyard with birds and nice plants.    the hotel is a  small, boutique property  and a beautifully restored monastery, with lovely public rooms and individually designed guest rooms. Each room has modern bath fixtures and enough room, Flat screen tv, hair dryers but no coffee maker. Of course coffee is a "ceremony" in Italy and you can get an espresso for 2 euros  at the bar so it is not a big deal. it fits the criteria for 5 stars but only has small Jacuzzi and no gym. The service is definitely 5…

title: An outstanding hotel in a great location
review: The Hotel Rivoli is lovely and has a beautiful courtyard.  The Benedicta restaurant is amazing and was great for breakfast and one of the best dinners that we had in Florence.  Our room was very large, but faced the street and was very noisy at night.  There were loud voices of people leaving bars, arguing, etc all night into the wee hours of the morning.  I would definitely ask for a room NOT facing the street next time!

title: highly recommend
review: I led a large group on a tour to Florence, and we rented a large number of rooms in two hotels. Hotel Rivoli accommodated our group with ease while seeming like a small, boutique property.   It is a beautifully restored monastery, with lovely public rooms and individually designed guest rooms. Each room has modern bath fixtures and enough room for two people and luggage. Flat screen tvs and hair dryers are included in each room. I was aware of members of my group who made special requests such as irons or different bath linens, and all their requests were accommodated cheerfully.  A generous breakfast is included, and the staff in the breakfast room works very hard serving a large crowd cheerfully. We had a special occasion to celebrate late one night, and the bar staff went out…

title: Great hotel
review: location is perfect, walking distance to every important historic point. we had the room at the top with a balcony and a nice view at the roofs. hotel itself, has the 'historic' vibe and we really enjoyed staying there.

title: Spacious, clean rooms in good location
review: We just stayed at this hotel for 4 days and we were very happy with our accomodations.  The hotel was beautiful.  We had a superior room with a balcony.  We were extremely pleased with the staff and the room.  It was so comfortable and located close to the train station.  The little pool was very refreshing after our 13 hour trip to Cinque Terre.  The breakfast was great.  I would definitely stay here again if I come back to Florence.  I highly recommend this hotel.  It was a short walk to a couple squares with plenty of restaurants.

title: Gorgeous

title: Very pretty hotel in a convenient location
review: We stayed for 3 nights in this cute establishment. The room was well lit and we had a small terrace attached to the apartment. It had a Lovely courtyard and the lounge area was nice too.   Buffet breakfast was amazing with tasty croissants, fruit, yogurt, eggs, bacon, sausages, toast, ham, cheese. Everything you can think of, there were also Jams and Nutella were available. The staff were quick to help you with anything you needed in the restaurant as well as in the hotel. We didn't get tea and coffee facilities in our room but one day we saw the staff carrying some with robes etc. so I'm not sure if that costs extra. It seems small but in reality there are lots of rooms.  Wifi was ok - slow at times and kept dropping out.  Good location not far from the train station- easy…

title: last minute booking
review: Travelled here after a week in Nice and stayed 5 nights. Our clean, quiet room was at the back of the hotel, and overlooked the pretty flower filled courtyard with its jacuzzi. Excellent service all round, breakfast was tasty and efficiently run. Bar was not expensive for drinks, which we took in the evenings in the courtyard, while watching the swifts swooping.  Large bed, safe, bathroom with wet area, and hairdryer. Tea and coffee making facilities would have been an added bonus. Very attractive decor throughout the hotel, antiques,and artwork. A lovely ambience.

title: Fabulous Location
review: Loved the hotel. So charming. a hidden jem. I booked my stay incorrectly, and the Hotel accommodated my mistake and helped me fix it. It's close to everything, especially the train station. I will be going back for sure. Fun fact. the hotel used to be a convent, so no one room is alike

title: Calm amongst Firenze Frenzy
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really glad you loved our house and our services, reading here that you had such a good experience makes us feel so proud of our job.   Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, my sincere regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Good location, cute terrace area

title: Just what I want in a hotel
review: This hotel is very conveniently located near the train station (just a 10-minute walk from the Duomo). The staff was friendly and accommodating, the room and hotel were clean and quiet, and free breakfast was a huge plus. The wifi was pretty terrible, which was disappointing, but otherwise the hotel was great.

title: Good location near station
review: My most important criteria?....nice clean quiet room and helpful staff- this hotel excelled at both those. Room 215 is modern, clean decor, with a terrace. Staff were excellent both at reception and in the restaurant (which has a really good quality menu), made you feel very welcome. Within easy walking distances of all the major attractions that Florence has to offer, this hotel is definitely on my list of places that I would gladly stay in again

title: Great location
review: We stayed 3 nights recently. We had a great room overlooking the back of the hotel and Florence rooftops. The balcony was nice for relaxing on after a day walking around the city. The wifi needed re entering each time which was pretty annoying.  Breakfast was uninspiring but plentiful. I don't understand why hotel coffee isn't near as good as coffee that can be had in any bar/cafe 100m along the street for €1. A good convenient hotel. I recommend it for a few days in Florence.

title: Very comfortable and well worth the price
review: I had stayed here 5 years ago in a large room on 1st floor so was surprised to be shown to the tiniest room I have ever stayed in with single (king) bed.  However it had all the amenities of the larger room.  The staff had changed but all gave good helpful service, house keeping annoying always wanted to clean room during siesta.  Breakfast remains good.  It was unseasonably cold in Florence and there was no heating so first 2 nights were cold.  Really no complaints but I did feel a little cheated on the space for the price.

title: Enjoyed my stay at Hotel Rivoli
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: A lovely authentic hotel
review: Hotel Rivoli is conveniently located near the train station. The concierge greeted us with a couple of group tour brochures and a map of Florence. I really liked our hotel room (as well as the decor of the reception and sitting room) and the Wi-Fi worked well (which was not the case at hotels in other cities we visited on this trip). The only thing I found a little disappointing was the breakfast, which was mostly continental style (our hotel in Venice had more options including hot foods).  The dinner menu looked fairly good the one time I noticed on the way to breakfast but we are all our dinners while out and about Florence.  I would definitely consider returning to this hotel if I chance upon a return visit.

title: A lovely hotel!
review: Dear Belinda,   I'm really glad you were satisfied with your stay at the Rivoli and that everything worked well. We always try to offer our best service and assistance to our guests and it's always a pleasure to know when we match expectations.  I'm sorry you didn't appreciate totally our breakfast, but we also have hot food as, sausages, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs and bacon.  I hope during the necìxt stay with us you will have the chance to appreciate also the breakfast, and waiting for you again at the Rivoli, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: An Excellent Stay
review: Spent 3 nights here on a recent visit to Florence and were pleased with the choice. Hotel is close to the rail station (handy as we travelled in by train from Pisa airport), though far enough away from the main tourist areas to be quieter but still within easy walking distance of the main sights. Room was of a good size and spotlessly clean and staff were friendly and efficient. Breakfast was of a good standard with different choices to please most palates and the bar and lounge areas were very pleasant. The courtyard also offers an alternative seating area. All in all a most enjoyable stay. A couple of tips: if travelling by train, it is worth getting your ticket in advance as there are long queues at the ticket counters (you have to get a numbered ticket from a stand and then…

title: Comfortable stay
review: Dear Guest,   I'm so happy you found that the quietness of our gardens and house pleased you and let you have a memorable stay in Florence.  The central location of the building makes it very comfortable for visiting Florence or having all the main sites within a short walk.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and together with the staff I send you our sincere Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Hotel Rivoli
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Lovely hotel
review: This is a quiet hotel with a wonderful patio where you can have a late cocktail. Also has a hot tub. Breakfast more than you could ever want to eat and delicious. Helpful staff and 2 blocks from the train station. You can see the Santa Maria Novella church and make sure you go inside

title: Great location
review: Dear Chris,   thank you for the nice comment you left here for other travellers, I'm glad you had a good experience in our hotel and we match your expectations.  Our gardens are a real gem in the city center where you can relax aftyer a full day visit for the highlights of Florence.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and, together with the staff I send you our best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent hotel, super location, great breakfast, extremely nice staff
review: This hotel is small and charming. Well located near the train station (for those arriving by train, it is three minutes away) and close to the Piazza Santa Maria Novella. An easy walk to the Duomo and other Florence attractions. The rooms were bright, the staff could not have been nicer and our three nights there were great. Very much recommended.

title: Clean and Comfortable
review: Don't be put off by the look of the hotel when you stand on the street.  Inside this historic building lies a labyrinth of rooms and beautiful reception areas. Staff are very friendly and trained to the highest standard.  A good choice of breakfast foods, but unless the large dining room is open, you are sat along a galley and it is quite cramped.  However the location is fabulous and nearby all the great landmarks of Florence.

title: Gorgeous room!
