title: Great boutique florentine hotel that needs band width!
review: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Rivoli. The room was brand new, well-designed, clean and comfortable. We were particularly wowed by the fancy shower with beautiful tile work, changing lights, and four different water options. Would definitely recommend and would stay again!

title: Nice hotel and good location
review: For those of us who live on business by computer will not enjoy this hotel at all unless you shut down the computer and the phone. Love the hotel for the price with clean rooms and elaborate labyrinth of lobby and meeting rooms to socialize. The restaurant is nice the well trained staff was wonderful but the Wi-Fi was just awful as usual as you find in Europe. I hope the hotel sees this review and really upgrades it's 1990s bandwidth thats the same whether in lobby or room.  Solid bandwidth is essential to business travelers nowadays and even semi-vacationers. Once they do this I will stay here every time I'm in Florence which is at least six times a year and of course I would tell friends and colleagues that I do business with because everything is very nice clean and friendly.…

title: Favorite hotel on our trip
review: Dear Eric,   I'm so glad you had a good experience in our hotel and you find it comfortable for you.  Concerning the Wi-Fi, I can confirm you that within the next 15 days the service will be improved with a high speed line and very performant bandwidth.  Please, come back and test it !  Waiting to welcome you at the Rivoli again and thanking you for the notice on this, have a great day !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Perfect Location
review: The hotel is clean and comfortable. The location is good (near to the main historical places), however it is very difficult to find where to park your vehicle. The staff is kind and the overall atmpsphere of the hotel is pleasant

title: Hidden Gem inside.
review: We were traveling as three women and the staff brought in an extra mattress to make sofa bed more comfortable.  When we mentioned the flickering light in bathroom, handyman was there quickly.  Staff went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating!  Morning buffet was delicious and our lattes came with a cinnamon heart!!

title: Near everything
review: Dear Diane,   I'm really happy you got a very good experience staying at the Rivoli, I try every day together with the entire staff to give our guests this.  I know that this kind of building can not be perfect every day, seen the age of the hotel, but believe me that we work on this and I'm glad you appreciated our promptness in solving the litte problems you found.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli with the other two ladies or with other friends.  Wishing you a very pleasant Week end, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: great location but in need of touch ups
review: You cannot tell from the outside but once inside, you will definitely enjoy the fineries of this hotel. From the warm welcome by reception to Adele taking care of our evening drinks to the staff serving breakfast in the morning, all were top notch. Although it rained for the 3 days we were there, we still enjoyed the beautiful gardens and atmosphere of a 14th century monastery which it was once . The rooms were clean and comfortable and you can order your choice of pillow for a better sleep. Nice little touch.The restaurant where we have our breakfast is also the 3 Michelin star Benedicta in the evening which I will review separately but worth a visit. Hotel is close to the train station and all the attractions and shopping in Florence. Highly recommended

title: Godt hotel med god beliggenhed
review: Dear Fay,   I'm really glad your experince at the Rivoli was totally positive.  I hope you will keep positive memory on this trip also thanks to your stay in our house and in the future you will come back here.  Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, all the best and have a nice day.   Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Needs updating
review: Stayed here during our stay in Florence in April 2016.  It was the best hotel during our stay in various parts of Europe.  Though it looks innocuous from the outside entrance, inside it is a warm, beautiful haven of welcome, cleanliness and peace. Extremely good layout with abundance of flora all around. The reception staff are very amiable, courteous and helpful.  The rooms had a personal touch and had every knick knack imaginable.  Very well maintained and clean rooms.  Breakfast too was fine. There is also free wifi.  The hotel also has a very convenient location.  It is just 4-5 minutes walk from Santa Maria Novella Station and 8-10 minutes walk to the Duomo. We were very pleased during our stay at Hotel Rivoli.

title: Great location, friendly staff, comfortable and reasonable
review: Dear Mrs Geeta,   I'm really glad reading your comment, reading that you had a pleasant stay at the Rivoli is for me a great satisfaction, as I work, together with the entire staff for this.  The Rivoli is a real gem in the city center and, the atmosphere we try to offer is exactely the  one you felt. We love to keep our house and gardens relaxig and welcoming for our guests, to let you find the garden clean anr comfortable for a nice drink or a relaxing bath in the Jacuzzi.  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, I wish you a very great day.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great base for city exploration
review: I was expecting a lot more when I booked the Rivoli hotel. First, I told them that it was our honeymoon in my inquiry to them. The room was average and not at all a honeymoon suite. I guess I should have emphasized that when we saw the room. The bed was not comfortable--it was basically two twin beds that felt like they were pushed together. I was excited about the hot tub, but it was only open until 9pm and it was not very warm at all. The windows were also very thin and the room was noisy because we were on the side of the alley. Overall, not very impressed.

title: Beautiful Clean Room
review: Dear Mrs Kerri,   I'm really sorry to read that we did not match your expectations. We upgraded your reservation from Standard double room to a Junior Suite as a little "present" from our side. JS 132 is a large junior suite facing not the main street but the little street adjoning the building and the bed is like mostly of the hotels, with two twin beds. The jacuzzi opening hours are studied to guarantee quietness also to the rooms facing the garden, for this reason we stop it at 09:00 pm.  Whishing you all the best for your new life, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Oasis
review: The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from the railway station. Reception staff are friendly and attentive, happy to resolve any queries.  Breakfast is fine and staff are very welcoming. Our room was away from the road and had a balcony overlooking the inner courtyard. It was a quiet haven. Rooms are clean and well cared for with everything we needed. The over the bath shower is a little tight for space but not a problem for us. The young lady behind the bar in the evenings was great and even managed to provide all that was required for a great cup of English tea. A rarely in our experience. Well done

title: Fantastic Stay!
review: I was in Florence for four days in business and stayed in a room with a little balcony and overlook into an inner courtyard. It was an oasis in the city and the business. The hotel is filled with blooming courtyards, beautiful public areas where you can curl up with a book or mobile device and feel right at home and a cozy bar. Extremely helpful staff. Best breakfast I had in Italy. Extremely convenient the river, the piazzas, the train station on a quiet side street. The only possible con is that, if you want to stay in a location where you step out the door into pulsing street life, you'll be a few blocks short. On the other hand, you'll be in an oasis. It didn't hurt that the rate was extremely favorable, about 130 EU/night while I was there, including the ample breakfast…

title: Very nice hotel in a good location
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really glad you appreciated the real Essence of our house. This is really what we intent to do every day, to give our clients a realxing and peaceful stay in the city center of Florence. Our inner gardens are a real jem ready to welcome you and protect from the "noise", reading a book or having a cocktail from our bar.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli. Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Fantastico!
review: We totally loved this hotel from the time we entered the doors. Our  room was very spacious and quite comfortable. We were on the first floor and it was quiet during the evening. The breakfast (which is included) is excellent and the staff inside the restaurant was fantastic. Front desk was very helpful. They assisted with booking a tour of Tuscany and also helped with a cab when we departed to the airport. Very close to the Santa Maria Novella train station and within walking distance to all the major sights and tourists spots to see. Highly recommend and we will definitely stay here the next time we visit Firenze!

title: Perfect stay in fantastic city!
review: Wonderful location just a few metres from Santa Maria Novella piazza and the train station. Junior suite room perfect for our family as gave lots of room. Decor is nice but not wow. Hotel very clean.  Our two year old loved the small heated pool in hotel courtyard after long day of sightseeing - very peaceful to have garden area in centre of city. Nice touches like help with luggage to rooms and robes and slippers issued for pool area. Breakfast was fine with a good selection.  We had a hire car as were travelling around a bit - definitely tricky driving in centre of Florence to get to hotel with narrow streets and one way systems but we often drive abroad and managed ok. Paid valet parking was really handy.

title: Wonderful hotel and staff
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for sharing with TA readers your comment and your impressions on our house.  The Rivoli, beeing a XIVth century convent kept it's originals internal gardens as peaceful asn they have been for centuries, and I'm really homounred to offer a relaxing area for our clients in the city center.  I hope you will stay again at the Rivoli during your next visit to Florence, for this, I greet you with a sincere Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Recent stay
review: I LOVED everything about this place!  The hotel is an oasis in a beautiful city.  The management is proud and caring of their property.  The public spaces are beautifully decorated and gives you the opportunity to experience period Florentine elegance.  For me the location was absolutely perfect.  It is just around the corner from the train station so was effortless for me to get there.  It took only 10 minutes or so to get to almost all of the major sites.  The breakfast was very complete with a lot of choices.  The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet.  There was an outside jacuzzi but I did not have time to use it.  I highly recommend this place for all.  I hope to return as soon as I can!! The street it is located on was not elegant, but completely safe at all times…

title: Awesome staff and stay
review: Dear Susan,   it was a real pleasure to welcome you and your daughter in our house. I'm really "proud" we met your expectations and had a pleasant holiday in Florence, fo all of us this is the most important feedback we might receive.  I hope to welcome you again in the next future, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Loved our stay!
review: Our stay was last August-September, so I am late in writing this.  The hotel was recommended by a neighbor (who is Italian), and we found it charming with a lot of great personality.  The fact that it is a former monastery has been mentioned by others, and gives you the feeling that you are truly staying in a historic place.    The rooms are indeed unique--we needed to switch to find one with a comfortable bed, but were ultimately very pleased with how accommodating the staff were at addressing our needs.  They were also most helpful in booking tours and getting information on the "hop-on, hop-off bus."  Sitting in one of the many lobby rooms with a drink before or after dinner was also a treat, as was the very nice courtyard.  My chief complaint was with the lavatory.  Even…

title: Use to be a 13 the Century Monastery
review: Dear Sue,   if after 6 months you have been able to give us such a good comment.... I can only thanks for this and say that I'm really glad you had a nice experience at the Rivoli.  We are renovating the rooms so, when you will come back you will see the difference and the new Hair dryers !! All the best and see you at the Rivoli.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent!
review: We spent a lovely 5 days at Hotel Rivoli! All of the reviews I read were spot on. The location was perfect for walking tours of Florence (8 minutes to Duomo) and very close to the train station -but no loud noise!  Large comfortable room which opened onto the courtyard.  Comfy beds and pillows.  Very, very clean. The breakfast one of the best I've had in Europe! Large buffet with everything you could want and cappuccino to order. Front desk staff was amazing. Let them help you with reservations to see David and the Uffizi. For a small fee we were able to avoid the 3rd hour wait lines! They also had great advice for restaurants. We will definitely be back, Hotel Rivoli!

title: Prefect Hotel Prefect Location
review: Dear Guest,   I have printed out your comment and passed it to the staff !! It's always a pleasure to read that our job has been appreciated. I'm really glad you had a great experience in Florence staying in our hotel. It will be a pleasure to have you here again during your next stay.  So, Arrivederci at the Rivoli and have a good day from all of us.  Daniele Torrini  Ass Manager

title: Pretty nice hotel
review: Stayed for 4 nights. The room we stayed in had just been renovated (they are currently on a plan to update all their rooms). Could not fault this hotel. Very clean. Warm. Great buffet breakfast.  5min walk from the main station,  so perfect location.  If you want to eat out,  there is a great Ristorante across the street called Tira..baralla. Amazing food and great prices too.  A perfect hotel for a city break.

title: cozy hotel in a great location
review: Dear Robimp,   It's a great pleasure to read your comment.  We are really glad you appreciated our renovated rooms, we are going on renovating a great part of the hotel.  I hope the next time you will be here you will also try the Bendicta (our restaurant) and will suggest to readers as it is a very good quality one. Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Amazing Italian Interior with great location.....
review: A business trip here was quite nice. The hotel doesn't have a gym but free passes to a local health club were offered and it was a decent place for a workout. Dinner and breakfast was of good quality and with a lot of choice. Some nice public areas too were available for an apero. The location is very central and ideal for tourist attractions while still being quiet. If I am to be ultra critical the rooms were a little dated but were very clean and not unpleasant.

title: Authentically Italian
review: Dear Guest,   Grazie !!! Your comment is really appreciated !! I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli to improve our new 22 rooms  completely remodeled!!!   Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

review: my husdand and i have just had 4 nights at this very comfortable hotel, the room was excelent, comfy and very very clean, the staff are very nice too. breakfast was very varied and plentyful , i recommend this lovely hotel and the wonderful historic florance      june and philip camp

title: Good location and friendly staff
review: Dear Mrs June,   thanks for the nice words on us ! I'm really glad you spent a nice holiday in our house.  We try to be attentive on our guests expectation and we love when we have such a good feedback.  Hoping  to welcome you again at the Rivoli, all the best from all of us !   Daniele Torrini Ass Manager

title: Ticks some good boxes, but not all
review: I have spent two nights there with my daughter from Jan 19-21.  As reviewed by others, hotel is in a good location about 5 minutes away from central station.  Bus terminal where you can take bus to outlet, The Mall, is only 2 minutes walk from hotel.  Hotel is actually on the quiet side of a busy street.  It's a building with history but restored with nice bathrooms.  However, the hotel management has room for improvement.  It is a long story.  I have requested for early check in and a quiet room with two beds.  Hotel has confirmed okay with this before our arrival.  However, we could only leave our bags there on arrival but this is actually not a problem.  When we returned in the evening we were given a room with two beds on the 1st floor facing the main road.  The room was…

title: Warm hospitality and centrally located
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment. I'm sorry for your first night problems, we try to do the best to give clients the best accommodation, but probably the room you booked was a standard room and the rooms overlooking the garden can be "balcony" or "superior". This can help you in the future if you will come back to us.  The Rivoli is in a XIVth century building and room size changes in almost all the 87 rooms, we do not have two rooms which might be the "same" asa they are all different.  I hope you will give us a chance and when confirming the next stay here, please let us know and we will do our best to give you the best available room!  Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Won't be another stay.
review: We found the hotel very comfortable.  Had a family room. Breakfast and dinner was great with professional staff  We would definitively recommend and go back in future. Great display of various nativity screens

title: wonderful and clean hotel
review: Dear Guest,   Grazie for your nice comment here on TA.  I'm really glad you had a nice experience in our hotel and in our Restaurant Benedicta ! I hope to welcome you again in our house, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: a very beautiful hotel but a very bad staff at the reception
review: The hotel was clean and has a bit of B&B feel and the staff were professional. That's about all the compliments I have. I only had single room but the bed was not comfortable and the room was on a side street that was very noisy. In addition, the locks on the room doors give a loud buzzing sound when its unlocked so that went on periodically in the night. What a silly system to install in a hotel. The hotel is tired and is in need of some TLC if not a complete overhaul. Also there are better locations that I would stay next time in Florence.

title: Hotel Rivoli:Convenient and comfortable hotel in Central Florence
review: Dear Guest,   I'm sorry your experience in our hotel was not so "good".  You were given a single room as this was what your agent booked in our hotel for you, and we respected what was requested.  Regarding the other things as the bed or the room facing this could be easily resolved by informing us and we could change you the room as we have 87 different rooms size and facing in different areas.  I assure we would have done the best to give you a great experience in Florence as we always try to, I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli to try to let you change your opinion on us.  Best regards,   Danieel Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Short visit in November
review: Clean rooms, nice breakfast, debonair personnel ! This hotel can satisfy your needs. We stayed two nights in Hotel Rivoli and everything was great, especially, the room they gave us has a nice balcony. Take the advantage of being in the centre of Florence and stay in Rivoli!!

title: Nice hotel, good location
review: Gentile Ospite,   grazie per la recensione lasciata a disposizione di altri viaggiatori.  Sono contento che il nostro albergo le sia piaciuto e che si sia trovato bene da noi.  La aspettiamo volentieri per il prossimo soggiorno.  Cordiali saluti,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Fun location
review: Very comfortable hotel near the train station.  Walking distance to everything.  Good value for the price.  Very clean and comfortable.  Room was larger that other European hotels that I have stayed in.  Courtyard area and living room give it a b&b feel.   Only negative it did get a little noisy at night....not sure how that would be in the summer....

title: Cozy hotel in good location
review: Dear GUest,   thank you for the nice comment !  To know how it could be in summer.... Just come back and experience our Hotel during the summer with an excellent dinner served in our inner garden !!  HOpe to welcome you  in summer, best regards from all of us and ... Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great hotel and location
review: Attractive lobby areas but room was small, bathroom was teeny tiny. Rugs looked worn and dirty, very narrow hallways. Breakfast was nice. This ,hotel seemed to be in a poorer section of Florence. Th bed was very low, not real comfortable and the pillows were absolutely flat. We requested new pillows and they brought thick foam ones.

title: Very nice Hotel
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for spending your time writing here your impressions on our hotel.  I'm sorry you found your oom small, but just asking we could offer something else as, seen that the building dates XIVth century, and is not a "standard" hotel,  we have 87 different rooms and I imagine we could find something that could be better for your expectations.  I do not understand what you mean when you say Bed was very low, as we have all regular size beds and concerning pillows, we have a menu on the bed side table with a selection of pillows that can be asked with no extra charge.  I hope you will give us a second chance to let you appreciate in the best way our Hotel Rivoli.   Best regards Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Another hidden treasure in Florence
review: We stayed here one night so I could revisit my memory of a past visit to Florence. The room was well appointed and the bed comfortable. The shower was unique!  The staff was outstanding. They were very attentive even loaning my husband one of their personal phone chargers. The breakfast was also delicious with quick service. Loved our brief stay here and would definitely recommend it!

title: family trip to Florence
review: Dear Guest,   many thanks for your nice comments on us. It was a pleasure for us to welcome you in our House.  We try hardly to assure our guests a pleasant stay and this let us really appreciate the compliments.  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Hotel for the sightseer
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Palazzo in FIrenze
review: Hotel Rivoli is conveniently located nearby Santa Maria Novella, a sight to see. From the hotel there is also a short walking distance to many sights, palazzos and museums of Florence.   I travelled with my parents, who loved the hotel and the city. From the hotel we walked also to the Boboli Gardens, which are located across the river and behind the Pitti palace.   We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The breakfast was delicious, and we liked especially the coffee and the various pastries. The staff at the reception and at the breakfast was most friendly and helpful.  Book the tickets to most popular museums - the Uffizi Gallery and the Accademia Gallery - in advance with the help of the reception, if you want to skip the lines.   Our 3 person room and the bathroom were spacious…

title: First Time in Florence
review: If you looking to stay in Firenze be it for business, for shopping or for visiting, the Hotel Rivoli is probably the best choice as it is a romantic palazzo three minutes from Firenze Santa Maria Novella train station and five minutes from the Arno and the shopping areas.   In the train station Firenze S.M.M., there is a local train every ten minutes to Rifredi and the university, and Frecce stop here for Roma, Napoli, Milano, Torino and Venezia.

title: Excellent Hotel - Can't wait to return
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for your comment and pointing out to all  TA readers how convenient is our location. In fact the train station is Just a few steps from us anf even all the best attractions in town can be visited with a few minuts walk.   Hoping you will choose again the Rivoli for your next visit in Florence,  Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Florence on your doorstep
review: We arrived from Rome  it was raining heavily and  we were really keen to check in and dry off . Unfortunately our travel agent , in Australia , had booked us into the Rivoli for the right dates but wrong month - we had no booking and were advised that the hotel was fully booked and Florence was at 98% capacity . After some quick internet searching for accomodation in Florence , surprisingly , my husband secured a reservation into the 'fully booked at capacity'  Rivoli  hotel. The staff were surprised that this could have been achieved as they were fully booked. Anyway , to cut a long story short, they honoured the online booking and managed to find us a room for the five days. The rooms are clean and pleasant , the breakfasts were good and  most staff were friendly and helpful. …

title: Comfortable
review: This hotel is located in a very good location, withing walking distance to Santa Maria Novella station, and most attractions.   The staff is extremely polite, friendly, and helpful.  The decor is very traditional with lots of beautiful antiques which give it an old world feel and a welcoming atmosphere.  There is a charming outdoor patio, courtyard, a cozy bar, and lots of quiet siting areas to enjoy a drink. We upgraded to a larger room and it was spacious, clean, and comfortable.  The bed was large and comfortable.  Bathroom had his and hers towels, good water pressure, and it was very clean.  Our bedroom overlooked the pretty courtyard and it was very quiet. We purchase the B&B package.  Breakfast was served buffet style with basic breakfast offerings such as scrambled eggs,…

title: An amazing weekend
review: Dear Guest,   WOW...! thank your for your nice comment. We are very proud of our little inner gardens and relaxing atmosphere we offer to our clients.  I'm really glad you appreciated. Hope to see you soon at the Rivoli for a nice aperitif in the garden.   Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Italian Gem
review: This is a nice hotel within easy walking distance from the train station and to the center of Florence.  The room was clean, large and had an updated very nice bathroom.  There is a small bar where the bar tender makes fabulous Lemon Drop martinis.   The staff were helpful and courteous.  There is a safe and mini bar in the rooms and the beds were comfortable.  The breakfast was adequate.  We were very happy with our stay here and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: nice place, great location
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for let other readers of  TA have your impression on our Hotel, and thanks also for the compliments on th Staff performance. It is important for us to know this !!  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, Best regards  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Overall
review: This hotel is lovely, clean, and historically significant, but what makes it special is the staff: unfailingly polite, helpful, accommodating, and professional! The breakfast buffet was lovely. The floor plan, as is common in hotels of this type and age, had a winding floor plan upstairs, but that added to the charm. The location is within walking distance of main attractions without being in the middle of chaos. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a personal experience with attention to detail.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for leaving here your impressions on our Hotel.  We "work" every day to assist our clients and try to give them a memorable stay in Florence and I'm glad to read that we met your expectations.   Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, all the best from the staff of the Rivoli and me.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Lovely Florence Hotel
review: The Rivoli hotel has a great location. It will take you only 10 minutes walk to get the famous Santa Maria's Cathedral. The service in the hotel is excellent, you will deal with  smiling and hospitable reception and staff. I have good memories about Florence and Rivoli is a part of it.

title: Will stay again)
review: The Rivole is perfectly located for tourists. It is in walking distance of most major points of interest. The hotel has an old world charm which we loved. Our room was not large but certainly more than adequate for a couple. There are small courtyard for sitting quietly and relaxing after a busy day. Breakfast was substantial. There was a selection of meats and cheeses, cold cereals, eggs, fruit, yoghurt, breads and pastries, juice, coffee and tea.  We throughly enjoyed dinner in the outside courtyard twice. The menu was varied and reasonably price. The also accommodated my husbands need for a glutten free diet. They went as far as preparing a dish we shared both with and without glutten. The staff was both gracious and accommodating.

title: Short family stay in Florence
review: The hotel was close to the railway station. The stuff where friendly and helpful. Our room was nice and the breakfast was of good quality and quantity. Would recommend this hotel for a stay or transit through Florence .

title: Great hotel in a great location
review: Dear Guest,   we all do really appreciate your comment here on Tripadivsor.  We do work for this, try to offer our guests a good experience on their visit in Florence.  The Rivoli, beeing very central is perfect for city sightseeing and, what is better then starting a new day with a good Breakfast?? We serve many local products just to give our guests the chance of tasting the very good things we have in our culture.    Thaks for your comment again and hope to welcome you agin at the Rivoli,   Best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: A city break to remember
review: We booked this hotel because of its close proximity to SMN station, as we were arriving with children and luggage. The hotel was in a good location for the SMN cathedral and only a short (5min) walk to the centre of Florence, the Duomo and Baptistry. A 15 min walk from the hotel was the Accademia, and the Uffizi and Ponte Vecchio were within 15-20 mins. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful and our room was spacious.  The hotel was deceptively large - it took a few minutes to find the breakfast room! The food at breakfast was very good - replenished frequently and fresh. We enjoyed cocktails at the bar, with a very friendly barman and the children enjoyed the outdoor spa pool, even though a couple of the 'bubble jets' weren't working.  We did request an extra pillow…

title: Great Hotel, close to station and 10 minutes from centre of town
review: We arrived by plane and took the bus shuttle to the railway station. Hotel Rivoli was only 5 minutes walk away, which was great because it was nearly 40 degrees! We were very warmly greeted by the concierge and the porter took our luggage to the room for us. We had requested a room overlooking the courtyard and we were delighted to see that we even had a small balcony to sit out on. Worth asking for! The shower in the bathroom was great, this was much apprenticed as we had had a long journey. Breakfast was included in the price and it was of good quality with plenty of fresh food and choice. I used the jacuzzi a couple of times and it was very refreshing! The hotel is in a great location for exploring Florence, it's just far enough away from the crowds. There are a couple of…

title: Excellent stay
review: Our second stay here. We can confirm all the good things written about the Rivoli in previous reviews. Helpful staff (especially Francesca at the reception desk), convenient location near the station (but not noisy) and close to the main sights. Breakfast was good, and the restaurant was excellent. Our room on the second floor was fine, just not as large as we could have hoped for. Overall, though, the Rivoli offers very good value, and we would recommend it to anyone.

title: Fantastic value, central location.
review: Me and my wife recently stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for just one night. The Hotel is perfectly located and you are within walking distance from everywhere so no need for public transportation. If you come by train you hit the jackpot since the Santa Maria Novella's station is only a short walk away. The Hotel is very nice and quite, the Staff is very courteous and extremely professional. Rooms are beautiful and very clean and the continental breakfast is excellent (loved the red orange juice and the Nutella croissants!). I would highly recommend this place and we will stay again when visiting Florence!

title: Hotel Rivoli is Average
review: Great location, between train station and central downtown. 5 min walk to both of these. The lobby and shared places are luxurious with a heritage feel. The rooms are nice and the breakfast downstairs is a great way to start tech day. Staff were very polite and helpful. Would highly recommend

title: Honeymoon
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the very nice words on our house, I'm really glad you ejoyed your stay with us.  We try to do our best to let our guest experience Florence hospitality in the best way.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards and Arrivederci !!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great hotel in Florence-close to so many things
review: We have stayed here twice and the hotel is a beautiful historic building so close to everything in Florence!! Our room was spotlessly clean and our room faced the street but was very quiet! The staff was charming and so helpful. The dining room was lovely and the breakfast was sumptuous!! So many choices!! We could walk to the train station and all other attractions. Loved it and would highly recommend it to all.

title: Fantastic Location, Great Value!
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment on our Hotel and service. The location of the Rivoli as yousay is very convenient to every place in town and our restaurant Benedicta is really appreciated, specially when you have the chance of having dinner in our peaceful garden.  All the staff thanks also for your nice words on our service. As we try to give our best to satisfy our guest expectations, we are very glad to hear also when we match them.  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli we send a sincere Arrivederci.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: A wonderful hotel
review: My Husband & I stayed at Rivoli, and love the room we stayed in.  Very comfortable bed, A/C was great, the room was big with a sitting room and lovely bathroom. We loved that we could walk the city and not have to take a cab. The Staff at the hotel were very helpful, always available for questions and simply a kind "hello".

title: About as good as it gets
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for sharing your impressions with other guests and let us know that you appreciated our service.   The Rivoli, probably is not a "perfect" hotel, but ...we are humans e we try every day to give our guests the best of our attentions.   I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli, for this reaseon from all of us, best regards and a sincere Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent location, comfortable rooms, good service
review: My husband and I have just returned from our fourth visit to Florence. This was also our fourth time staying at the Rivoli. The staff have become more and more like family every time we go. Daniele, Francesca and Ermelinda and all the rest of the staff are not only wonderful, friendly, helpful and accommodating but also treat us like family. We love this hotel for many reasons including its fabulous location, it's cleanliness and it's staff.i feel like I am home. We also love the beautiful breakfast garden and also enjoy the complimentary breakfast that is included. This is truly one of Florence's hidden gem! Can't wait until next year!

title: Outstanding
review: GRAZIE !!!  thanks for choosing again the Rivoli as your "home away from home".  It's always a pleasure for us too to welcome you and have a few words with you. I'm really gald you appreciate our hospitality...!  Waiting to welcome you again,  from all of us  a great Thank you and see you next year !! Arrivederci!!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent hotel in a great location..
review: We recently spent 2 nights at the Hotel Rivoli as part of a package purchased through Expedia. We were very satisfied with our stay. The room was spacious, the hotel was within walking distance of the center of Florence and the sights we were interested in, the staff was helpful and pleasant, the small pool/spa was a welcome relief from the heat, the breakfast offerings were varied and tasty, and the price was very reasonable. Our family of 4 (including 2 teenagers) would definitely recommend the Hotel Rivoli. One note:  our quadruple room had a separate bedroom with 2 twin beds for our teenagers. It smelled just a little stale. Other than that, we had no complaints about the room. If you do decide to stay here, we would recommend visiting the Santa Maria Novella Pharmacia,…

review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment !! I'm really glad you enjoyed your stay in our house !! Manager

title: wonderful visit
review: Just returned from 2 night stay in Florence with my husband. Rivoli was of a very good standard, lovely decor, central location, charming courtyards and very friendly, efficient staff. Air con was excellent and VERY necessary in July! Food in hotel very good - plenty of choice for breakfast and good value evening menu. Bathroom too small - maybe remove the bidet!!

title: Bar Service within Hotel - Gianfranco
review: we had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Rivoli and would be back in a heartbeat. It is well located near the main station and car rental offices, but once inside you are swept back into Renaissance splendour in a former convent dating back centuries. The internal courtyard and breakfast area is lovely, the American Bar and adjoining drawing room cool & welcoming after the searing heat of Florence.  Our room was spacious and comfortable - there was even a pillow menu.

title: Excellent hotel, very close to attractions
review: Once you've settled we highly recommend you enjoy a drink and snack at the bar. You will be welcomed by a friendly well spoken gentleman by the name of GIANFRANCO. He is always eager to ask how your day has been whether spent sightseeing or just a stroll through Florence...Thank you Gianfranco for making our experience in Florence more enjoyable! Look forward to seeing you next time we are in town. Lina and Vince

title: Too many little issues to give better review
review: We stay one night only in one of the suites,  nice spacious suite with two bedrooms. walking distance to the train station( Santa Maria Novella), The staff was very friendly and useful. We were a little bit concerned for some of the reviews about the location( pickpocketing apparently is more frequently seen around the train station), but I have to say that we felt pretty safe all the time. They also have a small and nice little pool that my kids enjoy.  We didn't try the restaurant only for the breakfast that was included and it was very good.

title: A Very Nice Hotel
review: A convent converted into a Hotel ....attention to detail in all the common areas and hotels rooms . The common areas give the impression of of a home  i.e. the lounge with  antique furniture, dishes , paintings ,etc. Rooms are well-apointed ,clean and contain all the amenities . Noise or disrespect ( from other guests ) is not tolerated. Good breakfast with many choices .Staff are professional and efficient . Very nice garden and small pool which was good for us because we had our grandchildren with us.Hotel is central to most sites . great restaurant in the hotel , very nice bar area . Staff recommended  a great pizza place , as well as an authentic osteria which  made the pasta on site.We would most certainly stay here again.

title: Clean and safe place
review: We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights here.  A very clean and luxurious  feeling hotel in a great location 2 minutes walk from the train station.  Very modern rooms with spa like showers, and comfortable beds.  There is a very small pool that you could sit in to cool off in a beautiful garden setting.  Very nice breakfast options. The staff were very professional and helpful. We didn't eat at the restaurant as it had a bit of stuffy high end feel to it, but to be fair we didn't,t try it as there were so many great restaurants in Florence on our list.

title: Very good value, convenient location and high quality service
review: This hotel is a 4.5* property when we visited. It is located within 5 minutes walk from the train station. Being in the historical center, it's an easy walk to most attraction in less than 10 minutes. If you are planning a day trip say to the Mall, or Pisa, this hotel is perfectly located so that you have easy access to the buses while keeping you feel safe enough.   The rooms are big compared with other Florence hotels. The street is usually busy but does not seem to disrupt our sleep.  The breakfast is good although the breakfast lounge cannot hold all guest at most times. There are other restaurants on site, but not open for breakfast.

title: A wonderful vacation!
review: We were very pleased with our four nights at the Rivoli.  It is an easy walk from the train station and to almost all of the key sites in Florence. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and well maintained.  There were no problems or issues whatsoever and the price was a real bargain.  I will go there again without hesitation on my next trip to Florence.

review: My family and I traveled Italy this year. We loved this hotel and there staff. There was a bit of a hang up with the wifi but these things happen. The breakfast is excellent and we enjoyed the restaurant that had a Michelin three fork rating.👍👍

title: Big comfy room
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for appreciating our service ! I think is much more imporant than forniture or location.  Our focus is try to give our guests the best experience they can have in Florence and with your compliments you just confirm that our efforts are appreciated.  Hoping to welcome you again in the next future from all of us thamks again and Arrivederci.   Daniele Torrini Ass. MAnager

title: Average stay
review: Staying at the Hotel Rivoli while travelling through Italy.  Great location - close to train station, shops, restaurants, museums and of course the Ponte Vecchio.  Great breakfast included with the room.

title: Amazing service! Perfect location!
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment, I'm really glad you ejoied your stay the Rivoli.  I hope this experince will let you choose our house for the next stay in Florence.   Best regards and Arrivederci !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Ideal location
review: A group of us stayed here for 4 nights while in Italy in May-June. We had a lovely room in the corridor off the restaurant area. It had a charming little terrace that was partioned off from the outdoor seating of the restaurant by plants. Nice and quiet when the restaurant was closed. The hotel was very clean, the staff accommodating to a fault and the breakfast first rate.  It is in a very central location with a fairly easy ealk to the markets and squares. There are lots of restaurants and bars on the street, where we sampled the fare. There is a store that sells beer by the bottle on the corner, very convenient! Almost right across the street is the building where the first farmacia was located, at least I think that was it. They sell lovely lotions and creams there now and…

title: Charming Hotel in the Heart of Firenze
review: We chose this hotel for its close proximity to train station and the its central location to the heart of the city.  We were not disappointed with this hotel's decor and ambiance.  It has an excellent restaurant, very good service and is reasonably priced. A lovely continental breakfast is included.  We were very satisfied with the cleanliness, efficiency, price and location.  It also has a small gym and pool.  Within walking distance to shops, restaurants. Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: I loved this hotel in Florence!
review: Dear Guest,   thanks so much for the comment. Tha hotel is located in a very central location, near to all main attractions and services.  Cleanliness ....we are really proud of our staff !! they are very attentive and clever.  Hoping to welcome you at the Rivoli, best thanks from all of us and regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent, exquisite Hotel in Firenze
review: I recently stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for 9 nights as part of a music festival.  There were 24 people in our group. In comparison to other hotels of his level in Florence, I believe we struck the jackpot.  Originally built in the 1300's as a Franciscan Convent, the building has been modernized while retaining many charming features including central courtyards and a small but lovely swimming pool. The staff were wonderful and the restaurant is excellent for both breakfast and dinner.  They easily catered to dietary requirements (Gluten Free & Nut Free). We had a problem with theft of a computer from one room - a shocking situation to be sure. Management accompanied the person concerned to the police and the hotel will make the claim and subsequently forward the funds to us. We…

title: Brilliant Hotel where nothing is too much trouble
review: Such a lovely place to call home! We stayed there as part of a choral group last week, and the staff and facilities were wonderful! The large contingent of Americans for this choral week stayed in several hotels in the area...however, I think ours was the best because it felt uniquely Tuscan. When I come to a country, I want something that's typical of the area, not a fancy place at all. Rivoli is near all the must-sees in the city and has a lovely courtyard within the building, too. If I'm ever back in Florence (I rubbed the boar's nose, so it's likely!!!), I will stay here.

title: Choir Trip
review: Dear Guest,   it was a real pleasure to welcome your Choir in our House!!! The Boar's nose works !!! so...... we wait for your next visit at the Rivoli!!  best regrads,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Very Pleasant Hotel Friendly Staff
review: We stayed at the hotel for 10 days and from the moment we arrived we were made to feel at home. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable.  The breakfast buffet was excellent and we would recommend the hotel restaurant for dinner. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean and  had a beautiful balcony over looking the garden.  The location is great with all the main Florence attractions within 10-15 minutes by foot.  We will definitely return to this hotel.

title: Staff helpfulness
review: This hotel was absolutely exquisite. The bartender, Gianfranco, made us feel like we were old friends he had known for years and the staff waited on us hand and foot. Worth every penny. It really felt like a home away from home. There's no other way to go than this hotel.

title: Great place to stay in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Just Average, Showing its age
review: This hotel has an ideal location -- close to the train station and key landmarks. The hotel was beautiful, and the staff was efficient.   I could hear the noise from surrounding areas, though this is not uncommon in European hotels.   I enjoyed it here and would stay here again.

title: Very nice little hotel
review: We selected the Hotel Rivoli primarily because of its location near the train station. I guess, for European hotels, it is about average. The front desk staff were cordial, but not overtly friendly--very business like and proper. We got off to a bit of a rocky start when we had trouble with controlling the room temperature because the AC would only run for 3-4 minutes at a time before cutting off. The front desk had to do some system override to allow us to cool the room to a comfortable temp. We had difficulty with the wireless service. We had to ask for a kettle for in-room coffee although it was in our room description. The room was very clean but very small. The bathroom had an old hair dryer that blew hot air in no one direction-useless for styling. The housekeeping…

title: Very central location at all attractions
review: Small hotel very close to the train station and central Florence. It was only a short walk to the hotel and we passed it the first time so keep a sharp eye out! Very nice bar within 2 doors and excellent restaurants within 2 blocks. Would definately recommend.

title: Well done!
review: This is a nice hotel - room was small but bathroom great! People at reception were a tad arrogant and that was a shame as we hadn't really encountered too much of the spoken about Italian arrogance until we stayed here. Having said that the ladies in the breakfast room very lovely and the porter was very helpful (just not friendly!!).

title: Lovely, but first you have to find it!
review: Hotel Rivoli is a small hotel in an excellent location for walking/sightseeing.  The lobby lounge is comfortable altho not big but there is another small sitting area and a lovely "living room" type room which is very quiet and attractive.  The hotel staff are friendly and helpful altho their English ability varies.  The buffet breakfast is plentiful and the dining room appealing.  There are two patios-one for the bar and one for the dining room.  But guests may go out on the patios without being bar or dining room customers.  The room for a double had two single beds and was small but with a table and two upholstered chairs in the entry way of the room.  The bathroom was fine with a shower in the tub.  The whole hotel was clean and attractively decorated.

title: hotel in good location
review: Dear Mrs Nina,   thaks for the nice comment posted and shared with other guests. I'really glad you apprecioated our House.  The Rivoli is not a standard hotel, for this reason we pay much attention on service and attentionto clients. I hope in the next visit you will have the chance and have a dinner in our garden...which at night is really magic.  Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards from all of us   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Location Close to Rail Station
review: Of the hotels I've stayed at in Italy, this is my favorite. It's an easy walk to the railroad station and central Florence. The desk staff was helpful and the ground floor offered a very nice common area -- well, several actually -- with an excellent restaurant. My room had a walk-in closet with some sort of pant-pressing thingamabob, plus a safe and a bench. It also had a nice desk, and of course a clean bath. (I have yet to figure out why a bidet would be needed in every hotel bath in Italy, but I guess it is. And -- don't answer this -- how would a female use the thing?) But the the crazy thing about this hotel is that you almost have to know it's there to spot it. The signage is minimal. So map it out before you start pushing your suitcase from the railway station, otherwise…

title: Very nice hotel
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment. I'm really glad you appreciated our services. I agree with you when you say the Benedicta is really an excellent restaurant and breakfast lounge.  Concerning your question about Bidet... I confirm that this "thing" is totally part of the Italian culture and probably you will find it in all Italian Hotels and private houses. I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and promise I will be more than glad to have a drink by the Jacuzzi with you. Best regards and Arrivederci !!   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Kid-friendly, great location, medium bed.

title: Everything perfect
review: I was a little skeptical when coming down the street to the hotel, but that changed when we checked in.  First, they were happy to upgrade our room at no cost and also gave us a tour of other available rooms.  They then greeted our toddler with an awesome gift bag for kids.  The room and bath were clean, spacious and comfortable.  The breakfast was just right.  The garden and little sitting areas were charming. And the pool was the perfect touch when your child needs a little break from the city.  On top of that, the staff was exceptionally friendly and made all of our dinner reservations.  Lastly, if you are coming by train then the location is perfect.  A short walk from the station, and then no more than a 10-20 minute walk from all the major sites on this side of the river. …

title: Great place to stay
review: In the hearth of Florence an elegant place that can be easily called "temporary home". The staff is very kind and professional and always ready to help! Thank you all! We specially loved the two gardens and the jacuzzi: so much green in the hearth of the city! Our room was spacious and quiet and had a big balcony with a great view. It offers everything what you need to enjoy your holidays better! Wifi is free and works all around. The breakfast in the second garden was delicious.

title: Family room in Florence
review: Gentilissima Cristina,   WOW !! grazie infinite !!!!! sono felicissimo per il suo commento.... spero di accoglierla nuovamente al Rivoli, per cui la saluto con un cordiale e sincero Arrivederci !!   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Good location and large room with great common areas.
review: I would stay here again.  The room was a good size and comfortable.  We had a balcony that overlooked the hot tub so the room was quiet and had great natural light. The staff was terrific.  We enjoyed dinner at the hotel restaurant and the food and service were excellent.  Breakfast had a good variety of foods.   Just down the street in front of Santa Maria Novella everyday there was a little market with food and drinks.

title: Beautiful little place
review: I spent only 1 night (Superior Double Room) due to a packed schedule.  Ermalinda checked me in a few minutes early, politely, and efficiently.  The room was quite large and very clean.  Breakfast was good.  Wifi was excellent.  Proximity to train station was also excellent.  Would gladly stay here again.

title: Thoroughly enjoyable
review: Perfect location approx 5-10mins walking distance from railway station Breakfast was always good Staff very very helpful Rooms were very small Very centrally located to everything - walking distance to most things

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: All in all this hotel is wonderful.  I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. It is perfectly located near the Santa Maria Novella church and all the other sites seemed within a 10 minute walk.  Reception is welcoming and very helpful. Every staff member I met was friendly and helpful. The one drawback was that I was visiting during the time the heating/cooling system was switching between heating to cooling.  As a result the room was very hot at night and sleeping with the windows open was not an option,due to street noise.  Fortunately, I wasn't in the room alot, because of all the things to do in Florence!

title: Modern Hotel in Historic City
review: We were on an 8 day vacation in Italy with 2 days in Venice, 3 days in Florence and 3 days in Rome.   While in Florence,our plan called for us to stay at the Hotel Rivoli.  As we travelled between cities by rail, we arranged our hotels to be booked close to the rail stations.  Upon our approach to the hotel, I grew very skeptical.  The outside was under stated and the hotels neighboring doorways made us wonder what we booked!  However, upon entering the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. Hotel Rivoli was modern and new in appearance.  The staff was wonderful and the rooms exceeded our expectations.  The breakfast was more than adequate and the attendants were very nice.   The hotel also had a small courtyard and bar.  Its location was convenient and perfect for our navigation…

title: Terrific hotel very convenient to main sights

title: Good hotel and helpful staff
review: We agree with most of the comments made about this hotel.  We found our room very comfortable, the ambience pleasant, the breakfast buffet terrific, and the staff most helpful.  Being so close to the river, it's easy to orient oneself to the town and main sights.  Staff had great recommendations for local restaurants.  Wifi was fine.

title: Charming property
review: Location near the historic city. Easy to walk and very near the railway station if you travel by train.  Our room was spacious, there was sofa from which you can make extra bed for third person. Bathroom was in great shape too. Modern amneties.  We didn't like breakfast so much because there was no vegetables. Lot's of sweet danish etc. and tinned fruits. Cold cuts were not good for our taste.  Staff was very friendly and polite.

title: Disappointing
review: Dear Marjories,   thanks for your comment. I'm really glad you enjoyed your stay at the Rivoli.  Concerning vegetables on the Buffet that we prepare for breakfast, we usually have mixed salad, tomatoes, cucumber. If you would like something else just asking we could provide it, and and it would have been a pleasure...  Hoping to welcome you again in our house, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Nice
review: We chose this hotel because it is close to the bus and rail stations. Turns out, there is a charming neighborhood with wonderful restaurants nearby.   We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel's  hidden charm.  The property was a former convent and the space has been refitted into a lovely hotel.  Our room was amazing.  It was  a private cottage off of a private patio/garden area.  It had 2 floors and 1 and 1/2 bathrooms.  Very unusual, charming and unique. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Ermelinda who was at the desk a number of times when I had questions.  The breakfast was very good.  We would definitely stay at this hotel when we return to Florence.

title: Enjoyable Stay!
review: Stayed at this wonderful little hotel in Florence for two nights in early March. It is literally a 5 minute walk from SM Novello station, very easy even dragging luggage. We had a great newly renovated room on the first floor overlooking a small courtyard. Several small eateries and shops near the hotel and while we didn't try it, the in house ristorante looked excellent! Hot & cold breakfast buffet was simple but plentiful, delicious and served with friendly efficiency. Great value and I would definitely stay again and the late checkout (for a small fee) was nice to freshen up before boarding a late afternoon train for Rome!

title: Former convent in Florence is a nice and unique stay
review: Dear Dan,  I'm really glad you had a good time at the Rivoli.  We try to do our best for our guests and give them all the comfort.ò  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Well located hotel in Florence
review: We stayed here for one night when we visited Florence from Rome. The hotel is about 4-5 minutes walk from the main station. We had a triple room on the top floor. WiFi was fast and free. Our room had a little balcony as well. The bed was comfortable and provided for a good nights rest. The bathroom is average sized but has all the essentials. The breakfast was quite delicious with good selection. We got a map of Florence from the Front Desk which helped ease the navigation. We used luggage hold on the second day while we explored the city a little more. So an enjoyable stay!

title: Comfortable Hotel in a Great Location
review: Good location, near the train station and one of the leather markets.  It's also a 1/2 block from one of the cathedral piazzas.  As befitting a former convent, rooms were not too big, but generally nice.

title: Courteous staff, Great rooms, Great location

title: Great Hotel & excellent location
review: The hotel is a 2 mins walk from the rail station so the location is perfect. Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and enjoyed it. The rooms are nice and bright, Our room looked at the centre courtyard which gave a warm view and ample daylight. A journal kept in the room lets you know of all the amenities available in the room and on request. The bathroom is a little crammed but otherwise very clean and well kept. Attention has been given to small details like tower warmer, trouser press, toiletries, etc.The hotel lobby is spacious and a comfortable place to plan your day. The hotel also offers a bar for late drink. The breakfast spread is good made better by the warm and courteous staff.

title: Great Location!
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment and hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli,  best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Fully satisfied
review: Stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for 2 nights at the end of Feb 2015. Location was very close to the main railway station and the same to the main sites in Florence. All the staff were very friendly, the hotel had a great little bar and the free breakfast had lots of choice. Will stay again when I visit Florence in the summer.

title: Just Right!
review: Dear Mr Martin,   tks for your nice comment here.  I'm really glad you enjoied your stay in our House. I take yor words, that you will come back, as a promise  Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, Arrivederci !!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Really nearby to Firenze SMN Station.
review: good central location and easy walk to all city attraction. It's no longer affiliated with Best Wester but quality of hotel verses price paid is very good. Ask for double or larger room in advance. A single room can be very small. Staff if friendly and attentive.

title: Fantastic stay
review: Took us only 6 mins to walk with our huge luggage from Firenze Santa Maria Novella Station to Hotel Rivoli. We absolutely love the location as it was about 5 mins walk to the bus station that goes to The Mall -Florence Outlet.  Room was huge but we couldn’t seem to find the heater so it was quite cold for us (coming from a tropical country). We had to pay for 24-hourly wifi and was only available at the dining table area in the room. We lose connection once we tucked into bed.  There’s free wifi at the breakfast room if im not mistaken. Cosy little outdoor area for coffee and a beautiful little Italian concept room if its too cold outside. Not much choice for breakfast but ok if you're not fussy. You could walk around Florence town from this hotel.  We wouldn’t mind coming back…

title: Hotel Rivoli- very good value
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice words on our service. We are proud of this and really happy to see that has been appreciated.  I'm sorry you didn't have a good match with our heating system... usually clients say that is too hot in our hotel ...the next time I will provide personally to show you how to have a good temperature in your room.  Just the last info for your next time here, now we have FREE wi-fi in the hotel.  Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards.  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent location
review: We stayed at the hotel over Xmas.  Had a great time.  Helpful and fluent in English at the front desk.  Everything was within walking distance.  The rooms were very clean.  Restaurants were close by.  Thank you again to the staff for all the help on sights to see.  You were great.

title: Not Impressed
review: We loved this hotel and our entire stay. A great small hotel right in the center of Florence.  The room was perfect and the stay was the best of our entire trip. This a Boutique Hotel that I would hardily recommend as one of the best places to stay in Florence and the best Hotel I have ever stayed in all my travels throughout Europe. You are within easy walking distance to all of the familiar landmarks and restaurants. Just a great choice for couples of any age.

title: A  New Year week to remember
review: I'll start by saying there was nothing, necessarily, wrong with our stay. There was also nothing terribly fantastic about it, either. I was incredibly frustrated with the wifi situation- I'd read a manager comment on TA that wifi would be complimentary "in the new year" but that was not the case. The front desk staff at the time were very respectful in the issue, but I'd suggest management make sure what they post and their actual policy match up in the future! Pros: -clean rooms -courteous, helpful front desk staff -nice breakfast selection  Cons: -incredibly old (very steep stairs, worn carpet, tiny bathrooms) -small rooms -wifi issue -incredibly thin walls and doors! You could whisper in your room and be part of a conversation in the hall way.

title: Excellent
review: Dear Guest,   thaks for writing here your comment.  I'm sorry you were not impressed from our hotel... probably we were not the right Hotel for you.  Now I can confirm you that our WIFI if available and free of charge after changing the provider.  Whishing you all the best in  the future, best regards.   Daniele  Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Christmas in Florence
review: This hotel is top-notch.  Beautiful rooms, grounds, restaurant and wonderful staff.  We spent the week after Christmas through new years there, and they really know how to throw a new years dinner party.  Also, the hotel has an interesting history--or histories, look it up--plus the manager came in to greet us all personally.  Wonderful experience--

title: Best in all stay? Bennedicta!
review: I am a travel agent that frequently works with Italian trips. My husband and I recently returned from this hotel, and while I wouldn't give it 5*, we also didn't expect that. Regardless, the hotel exceeded our expectations!   Our stay was delayed due to an air strike, and the front desk was kind enough to hold our room until our arrival. The hotel is priced very well for the location and service and amenities it offers. Most Italian hotel rooms are smaller than Americans are used to, but our room had a lovely balcony and a view of the inner courtyard. The room was a bit noisy; we could hear water running from other rooms, but they are located in an old building and we found it as part of the charm!   The staff here was exceptional. They were all very kind, especially Sonny at…

title: Good hotel
review: Great hotel and very well located, just a step from Santa Maria Novela Station and close to the center! It was perfect for my family and especially with a baby in a trolley.  The down point...the heating! The heating wasn't working well and our room was to hot! Every day we had to leave the window open to cool down the room, and believe me it was cold outside! This made the mosquitos enter the room and our baby was all biten! So take repelent even in the winter!  The best thing...Bennedicta restaurant! Some of the staff didn´t speak english, but they were great, especially with our little one! I have to mention Andrea at dinner! Nothing was to much trouble for him, and he was always very attencious with us, even with my dad that was really sick and needed to have a soup at his…

title: Very small room
review: Good location 10 mins walk from Duomo. 5mins walk from the train station and bus arrival from the airport. We had a lovely room only one complaint it was too hot we could not adjust the heat. Solution we opened the window which seemed a waste of energy however I am aware they cannot please everyone and I prefer to be warm rather than cold. We were disappointed there were no English TV channels so nothing to watch however I expect that is how the Italians feel when they come to the UK as I don't suppose we accommodate them either in that way. I think there should be free WIfi as i was not paying €5 a day for that when it does not cost the hotel anything. You can get free Wifi at breakfast in the restaurant.  I would not have booked that hotel had I noticed that at the time of…

title: Easy access!
review: Dear Mrs Shirley,   thanks for the nice comment and the suggestions you wrote here. We always try to improve our services by "using" our guests suggestions, and so we will do with yours.  I just wanted to point out that, concerning English TV Channels, we have a few of them set on our satellite, just asking at the reception we would have been more than happy to show how to set them:  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, to show you our improvements, from all of us I just want to send all the Best Wishes  for the next Holidays !! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Good location, value for money
review: This was a great hotel, close to station and very central to everything. The room was great, we had a suite, so very spacious.  Only downside was that the room was too hot and we were not able to cool down very much. Hotel staff helpful and friendly.   Wi-fi was an additional cost, and went down while we were there. Breakfast was good too.

title: a ceiling fan would've been perfect!
review: Dear Guest,  thakns for the nice comment. I'm really glad we match your expectations.  Concerning the WIFI, I'm really  happy that starting the new year  the charge will be off.  HOping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: sorry...
review: 10 mins walk from Florence central station. 10 mins walk to central market and Duomo. Room are big and clean. Bathroom are almost half the size of the bedroom. BUT the screen shower of the bathtub is near to none because it's useless, the floor will get wet after a shower. The room only have one power outlet. If you have a lot of device to charge, please bring yourself a multiple plug which thankfully I did ... The hotel breakfast is not very appealing to us compare to the one we had in Rome. So if you are going to stay a few days here, please find yourself a better breakfast place. Service from the staffs are good. They are friendly and ready to help. Sound proofs of the room are not very good as we can hear people stomping from above level and door closing next to our room.…

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: We LOVED  this hotel!! The Rivoli is a beautifully appointed hotel located within walking distance of so many of the sights of Florence. There are large and inviting common areas including a bar/lounge complete with a very pleasant server who offers snacks with your evening cocktails.The outdoor courtyard and gardens are lovely and very inviting after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast each morning was one of the best at any hotel we have ever stayed at. Food was varied, fresh, plentiful and served by very pleasant friendly servers. The on site restaurant Ristorante Bendicta for an evening meal is highly recommended. Food, selection, wine, staff, are all  of exceptional quality. It was one of the best meals we had in Italy....don't miss it! Our room on the second floor was…

title: Terrible Hotel
review: Charming hotel with great location near the city center and trainstation.Very friendly and helpfull staff. Big clean room with comfortabel beds.  Nice breakfast but we would have liked to have juice for free.  We think wifi should have been included in the price!!!

title: Wonderful Hotel, and rooms
review: Just stayed at the Hotel Rivoli a few weeks ago for 4 days.  We arrived in the late afternoon/early evening of the first day in Florence.  The room was dark and dreary.  At first glance it seems to be relatively clean. Then, after being in the room for an hour or so, we noticed there were flying gnats.  We notified the front desk and they offered to spray while we were out to dinner that first night.  When we returned, the gnats were still there.  They stayed with us all through the remaining 3 days we stayed at the hotel.  In the morning, I would wake to a good dozen or so dead gnats in the bed where I slept.  I guess I killed them when rolling over in my sleep - disgusting!  I mentioned it again to the desk, but they didn't seem to really care.  They gave me the impression I…

title: A comfortable  retreat in the heart of the city
review: Dear Guest,   sorry about your Terrible Experience, probably our hotel was not good enough for your expectations.  I hope for the next time in Florence you will find something better "for you" .  With regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Trip
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Topped Our Positive Expectations..
review: We stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for 2 nights after a cruise.  The location in Florence was perfect.  Easy walk from the train station and to all the sights.  We had a lovely room with a balcony on the 3rd floor over looking the garden. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble.  Breakfast was varied and tasty and the Italian coffee plentiful and delicious. We would definitely stay there again.

title: Wonderful Place to Stay
review: A fine fine property in the Santa Maria Novella area of the city; almost a neighborhood in itself with excellent restaurants, easy walk to the Duomo & city center.  A room with an interior terrace was excellent.  Most attentive staff.  A breakfast so good (try their famous hot chocolate) that non guests come there for the start of the day.

title: Wonderful!
review: Where do I start. The outstanding friendly, helpful hotel staff.  The excellent restaurant with great Florentine cuisine.  The garden patio at the restaurant.  The wonderful Breakfast.  The excellent, friendly, professional  restaurant service staff.  The garden patio area at the hot tub, where wine and spirits are served.  The exquisite modern rooms.  It was all luxurious.

title: Wonderful place to stay!
review: My wife and I trained to Florence and thoroughly enjoyed our stay/experience at Hotel Rivoli. The staff were friendly and purposefully helpful, the room spotless and breakfast was wonderful!  Also, in walking distance of train station and many restaurants/cafe.  Will stay again when in Florence!

title: Great Value and service
review: A great base for exploring Florence. The hotel is close to the station, with many restaurants and cafés close by. It is within walking distance of the major sights of the city.  The interior is beautifully decorated, and there is a lovely lounge for relaxing in. The bar is good with a wide range of drinks to tempt you. Breakfast is available in the hotel's restaurant, and includes the usual range of dishes you would expect to find.  The rooms are not huge, but well equipped, and the bed in our room was nicely firm.

title: Florence Hotel
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for spending here those nice words on our house. The origin of this hotel in fact is a XIVth century convent and we try to keep the "original" relaxing charme of the building.  I'm really glad you appreciated it.  We all hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli, and we greet you with our sincere Arrivederci !  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: Good location easy walking to train station, and easy walk to the old town, shops, markets and museums.  Very good buffet breakfast and friendly staff. My room was good, no problems at all, I would stay there again

title: Goof value and service....
review: Excellent hotel that could be a five star . I can find no fault with this establishment. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh. Service was great. Room was spotless and cleaned every day. Very quiet. My best recommendation.

review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace.
