title: Good location
review: I was very skeptical about staying at a Best Western in Florence, Italy. Boy! Was I surprised. This hotel is wonderful! It is a very short walk from the train station. On a great street with good restaurants. The staff, Silvano, Daniele and bartender, Sani were wonderful! The rooms was very clean and quiet. The only thing took getting use to was having the key operate the electric in the room. The breakfast offered was perfect. A little of everything and you get a pot of coffee. Not just a little cup.  Across the street is the Officina Profumo Farmaceutica di Santa Maria Novella S. P. A.  It is an amazing place to get specializes soaps, scents and you can actually smell the place when you walk by. On the same side of the street as the hotel is a small gourmet food shop that is…

title: 3 night break
review: Near to main rail station, walking distance to main sites.  Hotel rooms are all different sizes, this is a 'sprawling hotel with many corridors, some rooms are bring updated.  Carpets in corridors a little too worn for a four star hotel.  Hotel generally good, was disappointed there was no free wifi and a charge was made for 24 hours of use. Breakfast was good and usual European items.  Reception staff helpful.  Good hotel for a couple of nights stay.

title: A Florence Experience
review: Well situated, close walking distance to all city centre tourist spots and train/bus station. Situated on not too busy back street that had several restaurants/bars. Room comfortable (didn't spend too much time in there anyway), staff were always friendly and available for advice, assistance, etc. The jacuzzi in the court yard was a nice touch, ideal place to wind down after walking around the city all day. Would choose this hotel again.

title: Great position. Loved our stay here
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment. We always try to give our best attention to let our clients have a memorable stay at the Rivoli.  I hope to welcome you again soon, from the entire staff and me our sincere Arriverderci at the Rivoli.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Good, not great. Location is key
review: I have enjoyed Florence for many years but the hustle & bustle can be overwhelming. Escaping to the little paradise of Hotel Rivoli gives me the moments to relax so I can get out and explore more of this beautiful city. It is within walking distance of everything you would want to see/do. The staff speak fluent english & I am sure every other language. Helpful in every way. Beautiful garden, dining area, large spa.  It is my first choice.

title: Perfect stay - Excellent location
review: The location of the Rivoli is one of it's greatest assets. Close to everything but not so close that it's too hectic.  The hotel is a charming hodgepodge of buildings (including an old convent) that surround a nice courtyard.  We stayed twice within a couple weeks and were pleased with the cleanliness and the helpfullness of the staff.  One downside is that while some rooms are great (balcony looking out on the courtyard, modern, renovated showers, etc.) other room are both cramped, dark and have bathrooms that make it rather challenging to take a shower.  With a nice room, you'll have a pleasant stay.  With a smaller, less modern room, it won't be as much fun.  One minor annoyance: to use wi-fi, you have to buy a little card at the front desk and punch in a username and…

title: Florence, Italy
review: Dear Guest,  I'm sorry we didn't match completely your expectations, but believe me when I tell you that "things might change". In the next days we are improving our internet service so that our clients will not need to "come down to the reception for the towels before the shower".  I hope you will give us the chance of showing you our improvals.  Waiting to have a glass of prosecco in our garden by the pool with you, best regards from all of us !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Typical Best Western
review: The location is just next to the main train station, between the historical city center and the peaceful park delle cascine. The hotel is also just a few meters away from the restaurant Osteria Pastella where you can enjoy fresh made pasta. The double room was quiet, with a kind size bed, a sofa and a large bathroom. Furthermore, as we were travelling with out 3 months old son, a babycoat as well as a small bath were available in the room for free.

title: Disappointment!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: No Wi-Fi
review: I recently stayed at the Hotel Rivoli and was very disappointed! Unfortunately, this hotel was chosen by the tour company that we used. To start with rooms are very small. Beds are very worn to the point that springs can be felt, and it is very unclean. The carpeting up the staircase looks as if it was installed in the 16th century and is very worn and dirty. We had a very small shower that the floor looked like it had never been cleaned, and when showering the first morning the shower did not drain. I ended up standing in 4 inches of dirty water which overflowed onto the bathroom floor, and down the drain in the bathroom. They also charge 5 euro for Wi-Fi for 1 device. I was very dissatisfied with the Hotel Rivoli.

title: Great location, great staff, very accommodating :)
review: Dear Guest,   I'm really sorry we didn't match your expectations. We try to do our best to let our guest have the most enjoyable stay in our house.  Concerning the stairs carpeting you are right, they are old now and we have already order and during this winter we will replace it. Cleaning is done every day on the stairs as well as in the rooms and  bathroom, as you can see in other comments this is one of our best reported attention.  I hope you will give us  the chance of giving you a better stay in the next future, and assuring you of our best attention, best regards from all of us.  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: They still gouge for internet.
review: Wi-Fi does not work in this hotel. No car parking facility. No tea making facilities. Location is great. staff are friendly and hotel is very old but clean. reasonable price for location. I would not stay there on my next visit. for international traveller on business trip, car park and internet are very important.

title: Big comfy rooms
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for giving us your opinion even if not totally positive, this will help us in improving our offer.  You are right when you say the hotel is very old, as this is a XIVth century building in the historical center of Florence. Concerning the garage, we don't have it "fisically" in the hotel (as it is written everywhere) but we have a very good agreement with a private garage that, with a reasonable price, also offer valet service included upon check in and check out.  Regardin then the cofee and tea facilities, we offer them for free and upon request (as written in the guide at clients disposal in each room) .  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli inorder to give you a better experience and send my best rgards and thanks again for spending your time leaving here a comment on us.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Good location.
review: We stayed here for 4 nights. Staff were friendly and pleasant. We had breakfast here, I can say it was interesting but not bad. The room was clean, neat and tidy. It was not quite 4 star but overall enjoyed Florence. Did not spend much time in hotel. The location was brilliant we walked everywhere all within 20 mins of hotel.

title: Excellent location
review: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel Rivoli for 4 nights in a Classic Double Room with breakfast included. Originally we were booked in to stay at another hotel in the same street, but re-booked on booking.com when this hotels reduced its prices. The room & bathroom was clean, but looked dated and tired. (We felt not 4 star "Superior" quality.) Reception and breakfast staff were most friendly. Location of the hotel is SUPERB with less than 8 minute walk to The Basilica di Santa Maria del Fiore. Car rental agencies multistory car park, train station, tour agencies and bus station all a very short walk away. The breakfast however was not as good as the breakfasts we had at the other Italian hotels we stayed at in Italy. Bacon was very fatty and coffee bitter. We did not eat a main…

title: Good
review: The hotel is placed in an excellent location, very close to main places to visit in Firenze. The room was great and with all the needs to stay while travelling. Breakfast very good and attention from staff excellent.

title: Great place to stay!
review: We stayed 2 nights in Florence, Italy and stayed at Hotel Rivoli.  They had a continental breakfast which was very good.  They called it americano, but it was far from American.  Still pretty good food though.  We didn't spend much time in the hotel due to going out and just trying to experience Florence itself.  Only bad thing is I was charged for a bottle of water that I never used!! Other than that it was a good time

title: Great find, lovely hotel.

title: worst western
review: Ok the street is not the most salubrious of Florentine streets but the hotel is great, had my doubts when walking the five minutes from the station but inside it was great. The staff were fantastic and very helpful too, we were having trouble booking a tour and the reception found another tour company and even arranged pick up at the hotel for us too.. We had room 116 and it came with a little patio which was lovely to sit and have a beer after a good days site seeing. The prices were about average for Florence and although not cheap were pretty good. Didn't dine there apart from breakfast so can't comment on the evening meals. The hotel is pretty close to everything, 5 mins from Ponte de vechio, the Duomo etc so well situated for site seeing.  Would definitely stay there again…

title: Great Florence Hotel
review: Pretty seedy area of town, lots of bums. hotel has wear and tear. they didnt get our room request right, two doubles for my kids, and they acted like it was putting them out to correct it. They charged for WiFI that never worked at all while we were there, and they had no insight as to when it would be working. I had to go to McDonald's for access. Also i noted anti american bias in seating at the restaurant. I was not allowed one of the open tables in the garden and was seated near the bathroom, despite request. "not possible"

title: A pleasant Surprise
review: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here. Location was excellent (near the Florence Train Station and Piazza Santa Maria Novella), room was clean and fairly big, breakfast was really good and service was friendly, efficient and professional.  The bathroom/shower was big compared to other places we stayed in Italy. Our room had the shower with just a guard instead of a door or curtains so the bathroom gets wet. I don't understand the use of that vs. something more effective such as a shower door, but I'm not European.  One item I wish we had in the room are a few more electrical outlets. We had one in the bathroom and one semi-available one in the bedroom. I had to leave the light on in the bathroom to charge items, and unplug a lamp to get an outlet in the bedroom area.

title: Few quirks, but great location and service
review: From the outside we were dubious.  Once we entered we were so pleased with the charm and history of this old monastery turned hotel. Our room was facing the beautiful inner court and I believe these rooms are the best. They are well equipped, well laid out and very comfortable. The breakfast was much more than the standard meat and cheese frequently offered in Europe. The history of the hotel and glimpses of the original building make it a museum as well as a place to rest up for an art lovers tour of Florence. The service was friendly and quick. It is very close to the train station and bus tours. Thank you to our travel agent for this find.

title: Older style in good area.
review: Convenient location near train station and walking distance to historic sites, restaurants and shopping. Restored convent with old-world feel, rooms were clean and spacious, very good service with buffet breakfast and lovely garden courtyard. Wonderful place to stay!

title: Nice Classic Hotel !
review: This hotel is in a good spot as not only is it walking distance from the train station and bus depot, but walking distance to main tourist area. Efficient check-in, older style reception area which in front of extends to a bar area and lounge area.The lift will only take two people plus suitcases, and don't worry about the creaks as it works fine!We were in room 215 which included a balcony which had a round table and 2 chairs and overlooked a lovely courtyard area.Walk into room and to the left is a small table and two sofa chairs, to the right is room for suitcases and cupboard space to hang clothes and also drawers, there is also a safe here to put your valuables.There is then a step down to the bedroom with the bed (2 singles joined together) to the left, and directly in…

title: Brilliant Restaurant
review: Room was spacious, breakfast was so nice with friendly staff. The room was viewing Via della Scala which takes you to most of Firenze attractions :). We really enjoyed the stay. The whole hotel was very well scented :). Overall we have enjoyed our stay in Hotel Rivoli & will be back again one day.  Note: We have been checked in 1st in room (312) which was a shocking moment as it was really hot & very compact. So please by aware not to be checked in room 312.

title: Nice Rooms and Great Breakfast
review: We have just returned from 3 nights in this lovely hotel.  The staff were very friendly and the room was well furnished and very clean.  We ate in the restaurant on the second night.  The food was fabulous and excellent value for money.  Unfortunately it was closed on Sunday evening or we would have eaten there again.

title: THIS WAS A "BAIT AND SWITCH"!
review: We spent a 2-night stay at this hotel in mid-July with my husband. Our booking was made directly with the hotel's official website, it was an early bird offer for a classic room. However, we were given a 2-storey accommodation at the backyard, it looked like a makeshift place attached to the hotel. Everything inside the room looks extremely old and never been renovated for some 30 years, the sofa in the lower storey was already sagged when we first entered the room.  The passage outside the accommodation to the hotel building was not covered, it was rainy, and we got wet despite purely trying to go to the hotel's restaurant for breakfast.  We also had to passed through the entrance of a glazed partitioned function room and met strangers every morning (who were waiting outside…

title: Great Hotel, Better Location
review: I arrived to check in, they said it was a mistake and that hotel was booked, but they could get me in another one close by. The "other" hotel was sufficient,  but not as nice as the original, yet they charged me the original price! I read the same thing happened to another traveler. The room and the bathroom were very tiny, but it was comfortable enough & clean. When I return to the states I will contact the corporate office to report the problem.

title: They did amazing.
review: Location was key.  About a 10 minute walk to the Duomo and 5 minutes to Santa Maria Novella Train Station.  Nice sized rooms, clean, helpful staff.  They have a great breakfast and staff.  Good choice when in Florence.

title: Value for money
review: Dear Guest,   many thanks for your nice comment ! it's always a pleasure to read that our clients had a nice stay in our houe.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli, and I send you from all of us a sincere Arrrivederci at the Rivoli.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent location, stylish hotel
review: I admit when I saw Best Western attached to the name Hotel Rivoli I thought it would be sub par.  I was so wrong.  The staff was great, helpful and accommodating. The hotel was charming and the pictures previously reviewed didn't  do it justice. The restaurant for dinner was fantastic and the free hotel breakfast was to die for....the pastries were so good!  The courtyard setting was peaceful. The rooms were simple but of good size and clean.  I would stay there again and again. Good location too. If I were to critique anything it would be that the wifi should be included in the room rate. Thanks Hotel Rivoli for making our first trip to Italy so wonderful.

title: Great Location and Service
review: Dear Mrs Diana,   thanks for the nice comment posted, I'm so glad you decided to stay at the Rivoli during your stay in Florence.  We try to do our best and it's always a pleasure to read that our efforts have been appreciated from our guests.  I hope to welcome you again in our House, from all of us. thanks again an best regards.  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Location!
review: I really enjoyed to be at this hotel, which has an excellent location, very close to the train station and interesting sites to visit. I could easily go for walk to the shopping areas, and historic sites. We were there just for one night, but In general was a good stay, the room was spacious and clean. For me was a wonderful place to stay.

title: Excellent location and setting
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for the nice comment!  I hope you will have the chance to come back to the Rivoli and spend a little longer time in our house, so to discover and appreciate all our best services.  Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards.  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: NOT SO GREAT
review: A small, unassuming entrance from the street belies what is a reasonable sized hotel.  It is a very old building, so has a maze of corridors.  Room was clean and a reasonable size. Breakfast buffet offered a reasonable cold selection.  The main benefit of the hotel is it's great location - 5 minutes from the train station and an easy stroll to the river, sites and shops.

title: June 2014 stay
review: Good location, close to main train and bus station.  Room is nice. The room that we booked is close to the street and you can hear the noises in late and early hours, that will awake you.  The AC in the room is freezing and there's no way to control it other than calling the front desk to turn it off.  Wifi access is additional expense and so horrible you can't even get a decent connection. Customer service is terrible, we checked out and not even a word and smile from the front desk.  I will stay away from this hotel.

title: Great location, comfortable room, somewhat noisy
review: Dear Guest,   I'm deeply sorry about your dissatisfaction about your stay in our hotel.  The Rivoli is a hotel situated in the city center, and even if our rooms have double window a little noise can be heard; a good choice is asking a room on the ineer garden when booking the hotel so that we can guarantee the total silence.  The wifi system is going to be changed, but as I can read probably you will not give us a chance to let you change your opinion on us.  Whishing you all the best, regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Not a great start but improved dramatically
review: Lovely hotel, good location, close to main train and bus stations, and the centre of town. Rooms were lovely, ours overlooked the courtyard garden and the hot tub. We loved the hot tub and sitting in the courtyard for a drink after a long day sightseeing. Breakfast outside in a lovely courtyard too. Very helpful, friendly people, very good service throughout our stay.

title: Attractive Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Cute hotel, great location
review: We spent 4 nights at this hotel upon our arrival to Florence, Italy. It was tastefully decorated and the rooms were large. The bathroom was long and clean, but much warmer than the separated bedroom. We were close to the pool and courtyard and enjoyed both. Breakfast was included and served in the garden or restaurant and a good way to start the day. The receptionist was helpful and provided us with maps to nearby restaurants, attractions, and bus routes. This hotel is situated near the Santa Maria Novella square and a good start to walking to attractions. We would return to this hotel because of the many advantages provided.

title: Great Location but noisy room
review: BW Hotel Rivoli was conveniently located near the Florence train station and all of the top attractions were between a 5-20 minute walk. The hotel lobby had an old-world feel and the rooms were very nice. We loved the beautiful, romantic balcony and large bathroom. We did not have any issues with noise like many reviews mentioned but we were disappointed that there was not free wi-fi. The breakfast was good and had a variety to choose from.

title: An average hotel with convenient location and helpful staff
review: As we arrived by train from Milan the location just  few minutes from the train station was great. Also all the historical views are 10-15 minutes away and we could walk everywhere. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good, not the best of the world but also nothing wrong with it ( it was included in the rate.  Internet was really slow and we got disconnected all the time. The room size was ok  a little outdated but that's more a question of taste. It was very clean and the bathroom was ok too. The reason that I rate the hotel only average is that is was very noisy du to the staff. Our room was overlooking the courtyard and on top a a "storage" room closed with a heave metallic door, till very late in the evening and from very early in the morning the…

title: I Want to Return to Florence Tomorrow!!!!!
review: I spent 3 nights at this hotel after a cruise. It's a convenient hotel with helpful and friendly staff. However, the room was smelly (something like sewage) on the first night. Luckily, it subsided on the next two days. Room is a bit small and over-priced. It is also noisy as you can hear people talking in the corridor and lift going up.  Other good points of this hotel were internet access at reasonable price and the spacious lobby which I spent hours waiting the train on the last day after checked out.

title: Great service, needs more noise insulation
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice, but lacking
review: My husband was attending a conference at the Congress in Florence in May, and we stayed at the Rivoli for 5 nights.  The location was very convenient, close to his meeting and to the train station, as well as for visiting the city sights.  There is a good restaurant across the street, as well as a laundromat, which we made use of.  Our room was lovely and large, with a modern, well-equpped bathroom.  The service was excellent, as was the buffet breakfast and dinner at their restaurant.  Would have been perfect, except for 2 things.  The windows provide no noise insulation, and every night until well after midnight there were groups of people talking loudly in the alley outside our room (like trying to fall asleep in a college dorm with a party going on outside your door, even…

title: Great location - noisy - very slow and costly internet.
review: Dear Mrs Kathy,   thanks for the very appreciated suggestions, I will pass the to the owner and see if windows can be changed shortly.  Concerning the AC system, can be controlled by the room directly UNLESS the previous client asked to stop it directly from the central at the reception.  I'm very happy you appreciated our service, we try very hard to let our guests feel like at home and it's always a pleasure to read when this is appreciated.  I hope  to welcome you again at the Rivoli and I' glad to say, from all of us a very warm Arrivederci !  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Pleasant Hotel close to centre
review: After doing extensive research to find a hotel in Florence that was centrally located and not too expensive we chose Hotel Rivoli for our stay in Florence with my husband and two adult children.  The hotel is located right near the Piazza di Santa Maria Novella and the train station.  The lobby area is nice - should know since my family slept on the couches because our rooms were not ready and we were exhausted from our overnight flight.  We had two small rooms but clean and modern on the first floor near the garden area.  We had a wonderful breakfast each morning tho the hotel should invest in a new toaster that doesn't take 20 mins. just to warm bread and one night we had a delicious dinner in the restaurant.  The issues were the desk staff were not friendly as other reviewers…

title: Nice Hotel, very comfortable
review: Dear Mrs Patricia,  thaks for the poits you did. I'm sorry you had to wait for your rooms, but having the check out at 12 and check in at 2 pm, we try to assign rooms as soon as possible but, in this periood the hotel is really fully booked and it's difficult to have rooms ready in the early morning.Concerning internet , we are working to change the actual provider for WIFI, after this we will have it for free. Unfortunately we have been one of the first places in Florence with WIFI connection, and while this has been good for a certain time now, the charge for the service if actually difficult to explain, but this is due to the old contract with the provider which is now expiring.  Concerning the Staff coldness.... this seems to me a little strange as we all try to give all the best to our clients and it's one of our best skills seen from all the comments. I hope you will give us a second chance to give you a warmer stay in our hotel and show you that we took care of youur suggestions.  Best regards from all of us and Arrivederci !! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: A good stay
review: The hotel is centrally located, about 10mins walk from railway station and 5 mins from the restaurants and attractions. Breakfast was enhanced by the friendliest and most helpful staff we have come across for a while - wow! The rooms were clean, decent size and without a lot of street noise, even though we were facing the street on the first floor. They offer options regarding pillow preferences which is always a treat given that some hotels provide terrible pillows. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would certainly consider staying there again if and when we return to Florence.

title: 3 nights in Florence
review: This hotel is located within a 10 minute walk from the train station which was very convenient since we did a lot of day trips. The center was within walking distance as well, so no complaints about the location. The room was of a good size and there was not much street noise to interfere with our sleep during any of the for nights we spent there. A few minor details -  the pant press seemed to be broken, the blow dryer stopped working after a few minutes of use (though another one was immediately provided by the reception), and when I went to the reception to ask for a bottle opener (there was none in the room), I was directed to ask at the bar, and when I went there - I was asked to bring the bottle down as the bartender only had one wine opener. A little weird. In any case…

title: Immaculate hotel, well located for the train station and sightr
review: Spent 3 nights here. Convenient to the train station. The rooms were clean and modern. Breakfast was good. Staff was very helpful. WIFI is spotty through out the property.   Easy walk to most sights. Restaurant's are close by.

title: Excellent hotel great location
review: We stayed for 3 nights in a standard room which was a good size, comfortable and well decorated. It looked out onto the courtyard which gave us a peaceful nights sleep. The air conditioning worked well and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Alllthough advertised as having tea and coffee making facilities there were none in the room but on asking at reception they were brought to our room very quickly. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the train station and all the tourists sights are within walking distance. If you intend to visit the uffizi or academia museums we recommend pre booking tickets on line to beat the queues, which are long. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance to suit all price ranges.

title: A lovely retreat
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Four night stay Hotel Rivoli
review: If we visit Florence again we would stay here. We so enjoyed returning to our room with it's pretty balcony overlooking the garden, after a busy day sightseeing.  It was very relaxing. Although I have to agree with previous traveller who would prefer that the tiny bathroom was not overpowered by a bidet.  There just was not room for it & it made using the bathroom an ordeal instead of a pleasure. I wonder if the management would consider removing them from smaller bathrooms.  It was also not pleasant using a toilet that was just 2 feet away from the top end of the bed!  Another small gripe was that coffee making facilities were not available for our superior room when we arrived at 8pm as housekeeping had finished for the day.  And I often wonder why hotels rarely provide hooks…

title: Great place 5 min walk from centre
review: Dear Guest,  thanks from all the staff for the nice comment you posted, it's always a pleasure for us to see that our job has been appreciated and made the difference on your stay.  Concerning the coffee facilities, I'm really sorry to see that has not been sent to you at 8pm, as housekeeping is on duty until 11:30pm in full service and from 11:30pm to 6am on reduced staff, but always available. I will investigate upon what happened if you will have the chance to send to our mail your room number and day of arrival.  Concerning the Bidet, I agree with you that sometimes could be seen as "invading" the bathroom, but believe when I say that this "piece" is a big part of our culture and can't be taken off.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and give you a new totally positive experience. Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Agreeable hotel in beautiful Firenze!
review: Would have marked hotel as excellent but for a couple of issues.  We had confirmed via a email for a superior room with a bath tub but this was not set aside for us on arrival. We were moved to a suitable room for our remaining nights. This had a nice balcony and we could sit out and enjoy the sun. To compound our first night's problem the toilet cistern broke and water stayed running all night - not so much of a problem for us as we could close doors in our room to block out most of the noise but a bit of an issue for our friends who were in the room adjacent to us and they thought they were next to a waterfall.   Internet was not working when we arrived and it patchy throughout our stay. It depended on which room you were - not great for a service you are expected to pay extra…

title: Lovely hotel and staff close to the Duomo and other attractions
review: We stayed with whole family of 5 persons in two acceding rooms with inside door. great situated just outside centre but with lots of cafe and restaurants around. Big Classic decorated rooms with lots of space, Very nice inside garden were coffee or breakfast is served. Real value for money.

title: We lucked out
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Beautiful hotel, great restaurant
review: Due to a SNAFU we were moved from the Best Western down the road to a suite here. WOW. What a lovely experience. The location was a little off the main streets but within 3 decent blocks of the main church; this meant very quiet nights with windows open). VERY friendly and accommodating staff (speak English but do practice your italian), nice amenities (soaps, shampoos, tvs, linens), terrific breakfast included, could go on and on. Work the deals early for your room, worth the upgrade to a suite if you can get decent pricing; I cannot remember the exact amounts but Best Western is a customer service dynamo. Typical room on the street side would be noisy, and I can see summer time here being hot to sleep if the AC 'isn't working'. We had a great experience and would come back.

title: If this is a four star hotel
review: Dear Guest,   wow! thanks for the nice comment posted !! we really appreciate to read that we met your expectations. I totally agree with you when you say that rooms on the garden are very quiet respect to the front ones, even if double windowed they are always a litte bit noisy!  I hope in a next visit to florence you will also have the chance to try our restaurant in the garden or the hot Jacuzzi outside so that you can post another very nioce comment like this!  Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, from all of us Best regards and Arrivederci !!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for two nights.  It is a beautiful hotel with clean, comfortable rooms, cozy seating arrangements and a nice courtyard, which unfortunately we were not able to take advantage of because it was raining.  It is within walking distance to just about everything that you would want to see in Florence.   The breakfast was good, which brings me to the point of the restaurant.  We decided to eat at the restaurant the first night because we arrived pretty late at the hotel.  We were pleasantly surprised by the menu and how delicious the food was.  It was so good, that we ate there again the second night!  My only complaint was that they don't turn on the air conditioning until May 1st and the room was warm and stuffy; however, that seems to be fairly common…

title: Pleasant stay
review: Dear Guest,   It's always a pleasure to see that you spent a little time to write on TA your opinions on the Rivoli.  I personally take care that all of us try to do the best to welcome and assist our guests.  The Hotel itself is a very particular building in the city center and, if from one side this might be positive other guest might not be happy ...but this is where we are!!  The restaurant is well appreciated from our guests and I hope you will have the chance of having a nice and romantic dinner in the Garden !! Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards from all of us and ...Arrivederci!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Never ever stay again at Rivoli

title: Would stay there again
review: As soon as we arrived at the hotel, we spent the next few hours figuring out how and where we will spend our 2nd night. It was that bad an experience. We could only sleep for 4 hours on our first and last night @ Rivoli. Stay with me, to learn more......  The hotel location is convenient from train station. The hotel has very good lobby & garden area, but that's where the pleasantries end.   The rooms are very basic and no where near what one would expect from a 4-star, especially for the kind of price they charge. Internet connection was lousy which pains when you learn that it is a paid service.  Breakfast, appreciated by a few visitor on this blog, and also something that hotel takes immense pride in this service, but sorry to say, it was a yammer. Fresh juice / eggs to order…

title: Helpful
review: Dear Guest,  I'm really sorry for what happened with your reservation; and I'm sorry you didn't like the other hotel of the first night as it's a 4 stars as we are, very central and charming.  I already ansewred via Best western, I hope you will receive it as soon.  Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli and offer you a better experience, best regards.   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Charming
review: Booking online, I was afraid it would be tiny and uncomfortable like some other Europe hotels, but this Best western is really good. Very close to the train station, good restaurants, and most sights in Florence central. Free wifi, good service, good breakfast, good rooms, complete amenities. Our room had charming balcony overlooking the street. Adjoining room was convenient. It was raining during some of our stay but there were umbrellas we (five of us) could borrow in the lobby.

title: Great hotel in Florence
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for the nice comment posted on TA. It's always a great satisfaction for our entire staff.  Hoping to welcome you again when will be a better season so that you will experience our Jacuzzi in the garden and have a good Drink relaxing in our garden, best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. MAnager

title: Excellent Hotel
review: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on here - made a brilliant choice! Great location - really close to everything including the bus station which is how we arrived,  lovely hotel and very kind, helpful staff - couldn't have chosen better!!

title: super location and staff
review: Dear Guest,   thank you for the nice comment! I'm really glad to read that you appreciated our House and services. Concerning the position...yes we are in a lucky location wich allows our guests to visit Florence without using busses and Taxi.  For us it's very important to have a feedback from our guests (especially when positive  :-) ) Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli from the entire staff and me best regards and Arrivederci!   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Location
review: Loved this hotel, it is beautiful. We were fortunate to be upgraded in our room, so we had plenty of space and a balcony overlooking the courtyard.  The room was large and so was the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast which was included was excellent.  The hotel is located within a short walk to everything and has great restaurants nearby.  The only downside with this hotel is the deal on the wifi, it is not free. I had to buy a 24 hour subscription for 5 Euros. This was 24 hours from when you log on, so if you log on for half an hour to check emails and then go to bed, get up, check emails again and go out for the day, by the time you get back, your time is up and you may have only been on line for 45 minutes. One morning we could not even connect, and…

title: Good hotel, nice rooms, good location
review: My husband and I have just returned from a break in Florence, staying at the Hotel Rivoli for four nights from 16th March to 19th March.  We booked the complete package with Voyage Prive, including flights with Vueling, private transfers and meet and greet parking at Heathrow.  The package included an upgrade to a superior room and breakfast was included.  The location is excellent with all the major sights within walking distance. The staff were extremely helpful, the food was very good, with plenty of choice at breakfast.  We stayed in room 115, which has a small balcony overlooking the courtyard gardens.  It was extremely clean and comfortable - Best Western even offer you a selection of pillows to choose from! The flight with Vueling was direct to Florence (not Pisa as…

title: Nice Hotel close to the train station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Yes... it is about Florence style
review: This hotel is within walking distance of the train station, which was great, but it was a bit of a hike to the  sites.  We stayed there for 2 nights.  We had the room by the small pool, which was a bit loud at times, with very steep narrow steps to get up to it, but otherwise ok.  The breakfast was very nice with a good selection of fruit, meat, cheese and even eggs and bacon.  We loved that you could choose the type of pillow you wanted because the pillows on the bed initially were very hard.  The staff at the desk, although a bit slow, were helpful.

title: Would have been a 5 star review but read and beware !!!
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for your nice comment!  I hope you will give us a second chance to give you a 100% stisfaction with your sty in our hotel.  From all of us, best regards and Arrivederci!!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Top hotel, great staff
review: The Best Western Rivoli Hotel in Florence has a very interesting position and an impressive style. I’d like it very much, being small and warm even the spaces, furniture and finishes are made in an old style, which sometime mean cold, the atmosphere is plenty of happiness. Whatever is about Florence... There are also few parking places if you rent a car to visit Italy. Old and modern in the same time, with friendly staff and a pleasant breakfast.  Because of the position and the age of the house itself, even the hotel has just few levels, there are not balconies.

title: Lovely city and quaint hotel accessible to places to visit
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for the nice comment. In effect the building of the Hotel is dated XIVth century...I agree with you when you say it's old, but we try every day to give our guest the best we can!  Hoping to welcome you once again at the Rioli, best regards,  La revedere !   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Location And Charm
review: Easy walk from railway station and central to all tourist attractions in Florence. Reception and restaurant staff were all very helpful and happy to respond to any request. We enjoyed the pillow selection menu which was organised by numbers.  All areas of the hotel were clean and maintained that way throughout our four night stay. We occupied a room on the inner court yard, which was very quiet during both the day and night. The breakfast menu provided a range of hot and cold selections with hot drinks being via the waiter service. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to family and friends.

title: Ideal location
review: Dear Chris,   thanks for the nice comment you posted here; our staff is always so pleased to hear that we met our guest expectations.  I'm glad you enjoyed one of our quiet rooms over the patio, our restaurant and our  Pillows Menu... next time you have to experience also the new chance of late check out time choices!! Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards.   Daniele Torrini  Assistant Manager

title: Good value in Florence
review: Stayed at the BW Rivoli for 4 nights, and really made our trip to Florence so much better.  The Reception were all very helpful and very friendly, the rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfasts were the best in the 4 hotels we stated in Italy.  The location is closed to the train station and within walking distance to just about everything you want to go in Florence.  Highly recommended and will definitely stay here again with no hesitation the next time we are in Florence

title: Great location, wonderful staff.
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for your very nice comment on us and our Hotel.  It's always a great pleasure discover that our house is welcoming in all the aspects. I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and have a relaxing drink in the garden by the pool. From all of us, best regards and Arrivederci!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: the very best
review: Really excellent hotel good location for both sightseeing and the bus and train station. Ideal if you take the bus from the airport - a lot cheaper than a taxi and very convenient. Parking in this area is worse than London so try to avoid if you have a car. Ideal Hotel if you want to stay in Florence with good quality without paying a fortune..   The area outside has many café's etc. and some nice eating places without going too far. It could be a bit intimidating at night but take the usual precautions and you see some authentic food and people. The centre is the place for atmosphere but prices can be much higher- so you pay your money and take your choice. If you would rather be more central and don't mind paying a lot more OK,  but if you are on a budget (its not cheap) don't…

title: Homey comfort in Florence
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for writing down your impressions on our hotel.  It's always a pleasure to read that our guests appreciate our Hotel and job.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli in the next future and for now all of us just thank you and greet with a warm Arriverderci!   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Hotel Rivoli
review: Although I've never stayed in a Florence hotel before this one, I can't believe that any other could be better.  From the minute we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by the front desk staff (I should have remembered some of their names), one young lady of whom had the most amazing ability to remember our name and room number.  Of course, the Rivoli is a smallish hotel, that added to its charm.  It is very conveniently located, and the highlights of Florence are easily accessible by foot from its front door. Our room (double, with a good-sized bed) was very comfortable and the housekeeping staff were pleasant and quietly efficient. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfasts in the very pleasant restaurant.  Yes, the default coffee served to North Americans was less than great, but the…

title: Handy location
review: Dear Mrs Joyce,   I'm really glad reading that your first experience in Florence was so positive, and I'really proud that part of this sensation was given to you from our staff and Hotel.  We really like our job and like to let our clients feeling at home.  Please, don't kill anyone for a Cappuccino !!! Try to resist and come back as soon as you have the chance and I will be more than happy to ask my collegues to prepare you a special one !! Waiting to welcome you again at the Rivoli,  best regards from all of us !  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: never again
review: We spent 5 nights at this hotel and found it a charming place. It is conveniently close to town and train station most places are in a short walking distance.   There are some marvellous restaurants close by ; some very popular with the locals.   The staff of the hotel deserve special mention all where helpful and polite. I would like to especially mention Francesca. She is to be commended for her excellent service. She has a great sense of humour and made our time a happy one. Also Ermalinda who was a fountain of knowledge and always had a smile on her face.   The restaurant attached Benedicta has an excellent menu. And our diner was excellent. The staff also gave excellent service.

title: NICE HOTEL
review: Dear Mr Joseph,   thanks from all of us for your nice comments on our service.  We all try to do our best and it's a pleasure when we have a feddback form our guests that we are doing well.  Francesca and Ermelinda are very proud of your special mention and personally thanks you.  Hoping to welcome you once again at the Rivoli, Merry Christmas and Happy 2014 from all of us !  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Excellent B&B hotel if thats what you want or you can go all inclusive
review: By far the worst hotel experience in Italy and we stayed in hotels for 3 weeks. Room was musty and staff was stuffy and not very sympathetic to guests needs. One of the power outlets burned out my wife's straightening iron. When we asked for assistance it was like pulling teeth and finally they sent someone in to tell us there was nothing wrong with the room.

title: Handy location, rude front of house staff and very noisy
review: Dear Guest,  I'm sorry to read this comment and, if after over 4 months you still have this feeling about our hotel and service it must have been very negative. We always try to be attentive and caring to our guests and I'm really surprised that, not only we have not been in your case but we gave you such a bad impression.  Concerning the room I don't know which was this room but if you didn't like it it was much better to ask us and change it.  As I read you won't give us a second chance to let you change your mind on us, but in case you decide please let me k now and I will be more than happy to welcome you.  Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Just Okay
review: We stayed here one night as the jump off to a tour of Italy. Wife and I were looking for a place that was reasonably priced and central for walking around for one day and this fit the bill.   Room was very small, and we were packing heavy for an extended trip so it didnt leave much room to move around. There was also a good deal of street noise. We could have asked for a different room (I dont doubt the staff would have done anything they could to accomodate a move), but just decided to live with it for the hours we were there.    The staff were very friendly and accomodating, breakfast was fine (everyone should be able to find something they like). Room was clean. Bed was small.    I would receomend it for business travel and if you're looking for central location and…

title: Great hotel, nice staff, wonderful place to stay, excellent breakfast
review: When was the last time a front desk clerk checked you out without saying thank you or good bye or anything nice at all?  My answer:  at the Hotel Rivoli earlier this month.  They also use colored towels (pink and blue), which means they don't bleach them although I'm not saying they were dirty -- they were clean.  Room is clean and in excellent repair and pretty big, but unattractive.  Hall carpet needs replacing or at least a good cleaning.  They cater to a business conference clientele that makes for a noisy crowded lobby at times.  Also, our room was on a low floor in the front of the building so it was super noisy sometimes.  Breakfast was ok.  Location was quite good. You will never need a cab or public transportation for sightseeing or to go to the train station.

title: Excellent staff
review: This is the second time in this hotel and we will continue to return. 5 minute walk from train station is super convenient, excellent location in SMN area. Once you get your bearings, easy walk to all the sites in 5-10 minutes and easy to pop back in afternoon if needed after walking. We ask for a countyard facing room thinking it is quieter; it can be unless courtyard is occupied, but still like this orientation vs. streeet side (never tried); Did not get a chance to try dinner in the restaurant, onlly breakfast, but it is very highly ranked.  Enjoy

title: Not bad
review: We stayed at this hotel at the end of September 2013.  The hotel, the service, its position in the centre of Florence were exactly what we were looking for.   I came away not knowing I had left three items of clothing behind but only realised one month later while looking for one of them at home.   Without much hope, I emailed the hotel to ask if they had been found - they had!!   The staff could not have been more helpful and after an exchange of emails I finally received the things I had left behind.   I cannot praise the staff enough for their help whilst in the hotel but most of all for this excellent service.  Thank you Hotel Rivoli,

title: Excellent location and nice room
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great Central Stay
review: My husband and I stayed here on our three nights in Florence during our honeymoon.  A travel agency had booked everything for us, and this hotel did not disappoint.  We found the location to be perfect - we never had a far walk to anything we wanted to do during our stay. The staff were helpful when we needed to make some calls to make reservations, etc. We found the bed a bit firmer than we like... but this is typical in Europe, we find. Our stay included breakfast each day, and we found it to be a decent spread. Our room had a small balcony - there wasn't much to see, but we enjoyed being able to take a bottle wine out and sit and enjoy the nice evening air.  All in all, we enjoyed our stay and have no complaints.

title: Good hotel for the money
review: Just returned from a great stay here. The location is excellent. Close to the bus and train station, and within easy walking distance of all the sites. The hotel was quirky, we loved the courtyards, friendly staff and great old Monks Door into our room 404. We were overlooking the jacuzzi and patio area. Bed was very comfortable, great walk in wardrobe and our bathroom was enormous. It must have been 18 feet long.  Breakfast was very good with an excellent choice, and in the Original Monks Dining Room. Staff here were very courteous and friendly. We can't think of anything negative to say, and would love to return here in the future.

title: Good Hotel In Florence
review: We stayed for a week at this hotel and really enjoyed our stay there. The hotel and rooms were very clean and well cared for. The buffet breakfast was good with a good choice each day and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a courtyard garden which was nice and we also tried the hot-tub/whirlpool on the last day. The hotel is very close to the train station and also the bus station. It is also not far from most of the main destinations in Florence

title: Hotel Rivoli
review: This hotel is very comfortable and clean, the staff are friendly and very helpful. It's within walking distance of most of the attractions. Breakfast is excellent with a great choice. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Reasonably priced as well.

title: No Frills
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: We DID return to Florence for this hotel!
review: This hotel room was our least favorite during our Italy trip. Our room was downstairs and smelled musty like a basement. The room was on the smaller size and didn't feel overly clean. The best part was a private walk out terrace. Staff was nice as well and made great restaurant suggestions.

title: Fantastic hotel
review: After staying at this hotel three years ago and writing a review for Trip Advisor that we would return to Florence just for this hotel, we did just that!  We requested and received our same room (405), and our stay here was as enjoyable as the first.  The location near the train station was perfect for facilitating easy day trips.  Staff is helpful, the breakfast buffet is delicious with a good array of choices, and the breakfast room staff always cheerful and friendly.  Our room was comfortable and large, with a large bath and large closet.  Entry to this particular room does involve stairs, which we didn't really mind, even though we're in our 70's.  The room was worth the minor inconvenience.   Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent location, nice rooms
review: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in September.  Our lovely room had a small balcony overlooking a charming courtyard.  Staff were very helpful and managed to secure tickets to local galleries and attractions.  Breakfast was extensive and of high quality.  Coffee excellent.    Location was perfect and only a few minutes walk to the Duomo and other attractions.  An easy walk to the station.  Thankful for the laundry across the street.  There are two good bottle shops / mini mart in the same street for small purchases.  Many good restaurants at good prices close by.

title: Convenient for all the sights.
review: Location is Excellent: walking distance from the train station and major attractions; self service laundry is just across the road; excellent restaurant in-house.   Room is clean and comfortable. Ground level public area has good atmosphere and reflects that history of the location. The room is normal business hotel kind of style. Breakfast was decent.

title: would love to be back
review: The only good thing we can say about this hotel is the location. Very close to bus station and easy walk to the rest of the city. We did not get the free wi-fi that was advertised we had to pay 5 euro a day for very poor quality. The hotel is old and not vintage but circa 1980's shabby calico. The beds felt like worn out hard doors. The bath was shabby. The hotel is very very noisy you can hear every one in every room, hall and court yard. The air conditioner has a lock on it and won't get very cool then shuts off and you have to reset every 3 minutes to maintain temp or open windows to smoky noisy courtyard. The free breakfast had a lot to choose but was just ok on taste. The " American coffee" is really Sanka so be warned. Thats like saying Tang is orange juice. The staff was…

title: We'll be back - again!
review: Dear Guest,  I'm really sorry that you didn't like our room # 222, it's a room that many other cleints like and appeciate for the quietness seen that this room is facing the garden, in this case you could ask us to change the room as we have 80 rooms and they are all different one to the other .  Probably for this inconvenient,  we have not been able to let you appreciate all our services, and I'm hoping you will give us a second chance and the possibility of letting you appreciate our house and services as many other guests do.  Sorry again for noth matching your expectations, Best regards and Arrivederci !  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: A very pleasant hotel in Florence
review: We loved our stay here. Very close to Railway Station and Bus Station.  We enjoyed walking to all the places of interest in Florence from our hotel, thanks to its central location. Very good bath room, spacious  compared to other hotels in Italy we stayed.  The breakfast was sumptuous. Only problem we had was that the Wifi not available in the room.

title: Overall very good
review: We continue to stay at the Rivoli because it is a comfortable place and so well located to both the station of Santa Maria Novella and Centro Storico.  The staff are always helpful and cheery and ready to oblige immediately.  It is difficult to find something new to say but this time I discovered that Sani, the evening barman, makes as good a Dry Martini as I have had anywhere in the world - and I've had some great ones from Chicago to Hong Kong.  We'll be back. PS.  It does have wi-fi!

title: Not worth the price.  B&B's are just as clean for 1/3 of the price.

title: Good Room and Service - Beware of Extra Costs
review: I paid for 3 people but had to ask for service EVERY day (towels,  glasses, toiletries). NO WIFI OR INTERNET. I struggled entering and departing with luggage for 3 as I was with 2 seniors and those at the front desk, feet away, watched without helping, both times. The beds are terrible.

title: Pleasant stay
review: Dear Mrs Ciaccia,  Thanks for sending a comment on our hotel and services. I'm really surprised reading this as, during your stay here at the Rivoli, none of those "problems" has been reported, and this made it impossible to us improving and giving you the services you where expecting.  I hope you will give us a second chance to give you our best services, reported here on this review site from many other guests.  Hoping to welcome you once again at the Rivoli, Arrivederci a presto.  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: fantastic stay in Florence
review: The room and service at the hotel were very good, but the extra charges were somewhat disappointing.  This was the only hotel of this standard in 4 weeks of travel in Italy and Croatia that charged for Wifi (5 Euro for 24 hours per device).  And while it could be that our reading of the menu at breakfast was incorrect, it appeared that the hotel also charged 5 Euro per person for coffee which we expected to be included with breakfast, as it is in every other hotel we have stayed at.

title: neat hotel
review: We were in this hotel for 3nights. It's very close to the metro station and walking distance to all attractions.  Room was decent, the bathroom was small but very clean. Breakfast was great, and staff was very friendly.  Overall a nice stay

title: Charming, relaxing and impeccable staff

title: Great hotel with good central location
review: Just returned from three days in this wonderful city.  The Hotel Rivoli is very well positioned, close to many of the major sights.  The hotel staff are very welcoming and always have a friendly word and smile.  The room was very comfortable with a fully equipped bathroom.  The bed linen was changed every day and the hotel provided an iron and board within minutes of our request.  The breakfast was as substantial as you wanted to make it and delicious.  We so enjoyed our bubble in the outdoor "hydromassagio" - a perfect tonic to end a long day of city exploring.  We so enjoyed our evening glass of wine, with nibbles, in the Courtyard.  Do watch out for the mosquitoes though - despite heavy slathering with full strength repellent, we came home with the most bites we have every…

title: Love the Courtyard!
review: Dear Mrs Jill,  thanks for your nice comments! It's so nice to hear from you and share with the entire staff of the hotel.  We really appreciate and hoping to welcome you once again at the Rivoli,  Arrivederci !! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: comfortable
review: Despite being located in the centre of Florence, the Rivoli has a lovely relaxed atmosphere. This is helped by having a courtyard dining/breakfast area and another bar/jacuzzi courtyard. Staff are most helpful and courteous. Food is excellent. Short walk to the main attractions of Florence. Garage parking is extra.

title: Good location, though lack of free Wi-Fi a letdown
review: We planned a family trip (2 adults, 2 teenagers) for 4 nights in Florence. I chose Rivoli because of the lovely courtyard and small hot tub. We thoroughly enjoyed breakfast in the courtyard every morning, late afternoons in the hot tub and an after dinner glass of wine on the patio. The staff was not overly friendly, but attended to our needs. The door sensor and AC stopped working our 2nd night,and they moved us to a nicer room with 2 floors and 1.5 baths. The breakfast waiter was fantastic - overly friendly and accommodating. The location was acceptable - not in the heart of Florence, but walk-able to the train station which was great for us.

title: 2* experience in a 4* hotel

title: Nice location and fair price
review: We had a pokey twin room on the 2nd floor – have attached photos of our ‘view’!  There were no tea & coffee facilities in the room I had to request them.  When they eventually arrived, there was no milk, powered or otherwise.  I requested a soft pillow and was told to fill in the form in the room. There wasn’t one.  Finally they begrudgingly asked a porter to get me one.  Early in the morning (before 7.30) we were woken up by workmen, using loud voices, music and power machinery!!  This was the case each morning.  It went on through the day so we couldn’t even go back to the room in the afternoon for a rest.  In the evening (11.30 pm) we were again woken by work noise.  When I rang to complain the phone was put down while I was speaking!  I rang back and was told it was an…

title: Great place to stay in Florence, Italy
review: I again am just not used to the star rating in Europe. In the US, 4 stars is generally great and spacious. The rooms were pretty small, singles as small as a dorm room. The hotel was very close to the train station and downtown. It was freezing every night we were there and when we asked the staff to turn on the heater, they said they don't turn it on in May. The beds were essentially two beds pushed together and in order to stay warm, I would use the blow dryer to warm my body. The outlets were also hit/miss. Sometimes they worked and sometimes they didn't. You also have to have your key in the door slot to get electricity so make sure if you room with someone that they do not take the key!

title: Good location
review: Hotel Rivoli is a great place to stay. It is located close to the railway station and is within walking distance from all major attractions. It is moderately priced. The staff is courteous and very helpful. The free breakfast is also very good.

title: Best place for stay and see Florence and travel all over Toscani.
review: Nice hotel with good location. Walking distance to the Centrale Station. Room is big and spacious (there's a lot to say for triple sharing). Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Enjoyed our stay here.

title: This is Great
review: This was our second stay in this lovely hotel. This time their were 15 of us and we had a fantastic time. The hotel staff are excellent and cannot do enough to help. The hotel is very centrally located and facilities at the hotel are first class. A brilliant stay.

title: Centrally located, quiet and clean hotel.
review: Dear Guest,  I'm really glad to see that all of you decided to come back to the Rivoli. For us it's a great honour to be considered a "home away from home".  We alway try to give this kind of "feeling" and I'm really glad when guests let us know it.  I hope to welcome you again next year and will be glad to welcome you again here.  Best regards and Arrivederci!!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Bob P
review: This hotel is fantastic. Unlike my hotel in Rome, there was no balcony but the view was much better, the windows (which you can fully open) overlooking a Florentine street. I stayed on the second floor. The rooms were clean and looked pleasant. There was plenty of space to maneuver within. The service was in general friendly and helpful. Me and my friends piled up five requests in just 12 hours on the first day but the front desk dealt with all of them. I accidentally locked the safe and forgot the code, but the staff fixed it swiftly. The free breakfast was a nice addition, which allowed some money to be saved on a morning meal. The only thing I disliked was the internet fee. Wi-fi access cost 5 euros per 24 hours, which I thought ridiculous because it was actually slower on my…

title: lovely quaint hotel in great location
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for your kind comment shared with the Tripadvisr world.  I'm relly glat that our hotel and our service to the guests.  Unfortunately, due to an old contract for the WIFI service, we are still forced to havfe tha little charge for it, but in the future (as soon as wi will be "free" from the contract) we will be able to give it for free for our guests.  Thanking you once again and hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, best regards from all of us.  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: A real 4 stars
review: What a perfect place to stay for 6 nights while we did day trips by train to Pisa, Lucca, Sienna and San Gimignano.  We were a couple blocks from the train station and also close to all the major sights in Florence.  The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. There was a nice bar area and also a courtyard with misters (which were a must since the temperatures were over 100 F the week we were there!)  The desk staff were courteous, spoke excellent English and were very helpful.  We definitely will stay at the Hotel Rivoli when we return to Florence.

title: Exceptional Hotel
review: The hotel worth what it is rated at compared with Rome's hotels as an example. The place is so clean and well maintained. Space full room and toilet with a quite neighborhood. The Romanian front desk staff was so kind and helpful, others were nice as well. Breakfast is fantastic and staff were cheerful. The location is not far from the shopping areas. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: good hotel
review: My wife and I stayed three nights on our first trip to Italy. Everything about this hotel was wonderful, from the charm and friendliness of the staff to the comfortable public areas, to the very nice breakfast. The location can't be beat - a few hundred meters from the train station and only a few blocks from all the major sights. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. When we come back to Florence, we'll make a point to stay here. Thanks, Hotel Rivoli!

title: Nice Hotel
review: Best wester florence rivoli is located very close to the train station and only a few blocks from the duomo rooms are nicely equipped with large tv sets safe box and good amenities breakfast was really nice and all the staff if friendly and helpful its a good choice in florence!

title: Beautiful hotel and exceptional staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Lovely hotel!
review: The hotel is on a typical dusty street near the station but inside it is beautiful. There are areas to sit and chill out which are nicely decorated and contain elegant furniture. We ate breakfast in the hotel and used the jacuzzi, both of which we enjoyed. The staff were very attentive from the room maids, the waiting on staff and the reception staff. I would particularly like to praise Francesca in reception who was patient and resourceful in my time of need.  We had a lovely stay in this unique hotel.

title: Brilliant
review: Our party of 11 including 3 children, and 2 teenagers all loved this hotel.  The family room, a self contained duplex, was cute and comfortable.  The small pool was a fab way to cool down in 35 degree temperatures.  We all had our excellent breakfast in the shady, vine clad garden terrace. The staff were friendly and keen to help. The hotel is right at the heart of Florence and within a short walk of the station and the main squares.  We would undoubtedly stay there again.

title: Excellent hotel great location
review: This hotel was less than five minutes walk from the main station - ideal! Warm welcome, great room, and so close to anywhere you want to be.   We really enjoyed the open-top bus tour (which starts on the other side of the station) and it gave a great overview of Florence. We didn't use the pool or any other facilities as were only staying a couple of nights - but would definitely stay in this hotel again :)

title: Short walk to everywhere worth seeing in Florence
review: If you want a nice reasonable priced hotel close to the centre this is the one for you.  Great breakfast. Nice rooms lovely small garden terrace. The family room is a duplex and was excellent.  Breakfast included Valet parking for 20 Euros  We booked through Kyak, though the family room had to be booked direct through Best Western

title: A hotel to return to again and again
review: My husband and I arrived at the Rivoli after a flight from USA to Milan and a train ride to Florence. As we walked into the Rivoli the Manager behind the desk welcomed us and greeted us by name. We were given a room overlooking the courtyard, and we immediately settled into the most comfortable linens we had experienced in a while and took a deserved nap. It only got better as time went on. The hotel was quiet although there were at least two organized student tours there whom we saw at breakfast. The restaurant food was superb. We make it a practice to eat at restaurants away from the hotel where we are staying. The restaurant in this hotel was so superb that we were disappointed when it was closed on Sunday evening. Once again the manager suggested a nearby spot where he liked…

title: Not for Us
review: I have just returned from a week's holiday in Florence with my friends and have to sing the praises of the Hotel Rivoli where we stayed. The location was perfect, just around the corner from the train station, bus station, shuttle bus to airport and the hop on, hop off tourist bus. It was within walking distance of all the major sights and had some great restaurants close at hand. Our room was spacious and had the bonus of a private balcony, perfect for some relaxation after a long day on your feet. The breakfast was very good and the restaurant provided a lovely evening meal for us one night. The staff at the hotel were the best I've come across. They couldn't have been more helpful or friendly and no request was a bother to them. Definitely a hotel to return to again and again.

title: Fantastic hotel
review: This hotel was a disappointment for us. When we arrived we were given superior rooms which overlooked the garden and whirlpool. This was appreciated but did not make up for the smell that greeted us in one of the rooms (113). It seemed to be a mixture of poor plumbing and stale air conditioning. We did mention it to the staff and they did their best to alleviate the smell. However, it was never quite right. Also, the furnishings and décor was in need of updating. It is clear that some people found it charming, but it just wasn't to our taste. The breakfast was good however. The rest of our time in Florence was really enjoyable.

title: Pleasant Surprise in Florence!
review: Have loved staying in this hotel,  staff have been fantastic,  rooms and bathroom very roomy and the air con works very very well.  Very clean hotel.  Breakfasts have been great with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, cheese, cold meats, cereals, yogurt, fruit and the yummiest croissants!!  A great location, a few minutes walk from main train station and only a short walk from all the main piazzas. Highly recommend

title: Nice location
review: Staying at two Best Westerns in Rome, this was the only hotel we stayed in when in Florence.  My 21 year old daughter commented that it was like staying in a large, lovely home.    The public areas are charming and decorated to give the feel of Florence with more traditional furniture and decor.  There is a nice courtyard in the middle where you can relax, and enjoy drinks from the hotel bar nearby.  There is also a hot tub off to the side of the courtyard.    Since we were on the first floor (Which Americans would refer to as the second floor, with the main level counting as the first floor) we went up a flight of steps instead of taking the elevator.  The hallways had long rugs and were nicely decorated, wiht many windows, so it felt like a home and less of a hotel.  Our room…

title: Very nice hotel in excellent location
review: Great location and nice size rooms.  The garden and bar were nice.  The only complaint would be that you have to purchase WiFi, and it was the poorest WiFi service we received in Italy.  Our electronic door lock also did not work and we were late while waiting for assistance.  The bartender was very friendly!

title: Romantic Florence
review: Rooms:  Very clean and spacious;  nice safe in the room.. big enough for a laptop. Elevator:  very small.  Can comfortably fit only one average person and an average suitcase.  My husband and I  took turns taking the elevator with each of our suitcases.  Location:   right in downtown Florence.  About a 5 minute walk to train station.  Walking distance to plenty of eating,  shopping places and museums. Staff:  Very friendly... all of them!   Hotel is very nice overall.   Very good breakfast; very attentive restaurant staff. Definitely will come back here if I go back to Florence (Firenze).    .

title: Beautiful Florence
review: Best Western Hotel Rivoli was friendly, welcoming and clean. Everything a guest could want. Bathroom was a bit cramped, but clean. We had a lovely view of the garden patio and it was quiet at night.We enjoyed the breakfast, it was our favorite of all our hotels on our visit to Italy.

title: Good Overall
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Do not waste your time or money!!!
review: Stayed here for 5 nights.  We had rooms that faced small interior courtyards.  They was not much light.  The rooms were clean and roomy.  The bathrooms had a shower tub and were, for bathrooms in Europe, a good size.  The rooms were a good size.  Staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was adequate.  They had the usual fruit, yogurt, pastries but they also had scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon.  The location was excellent.  It was near the train station and the old town center.  Overall a very enjoyable experience.

title: Good hotel, great restaurant inside
review: We recently stayed here for two nights. We are a large family and had booked two rooms. The location is probably the only good thing about the hotel. Although it is not a very nice part of Florence. Close to the train station and not to far to walk to the Duomo. It's a very old hotel and they use a very heavy deodorant spray to cover up the stink that the hotel has. The carpet is very worn out on the stairs and floors to your rooms. We had a problem with the sink not draining and getting hot water in the shower in one of the rooms. We called and they couldn't fix it till the next day. They fixed the sink but never fixed the shower so there was never hot water to take a shower. Thankfully we had two rooms so 6 people had to manage to share one shower. Not Fun!!! They never…

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
review: Dear Mr Sandfeld,   I'm really sorry that you didn't appreciate our hotel and services, probably the Rivoli is not really the hotel for you. You are totally right when you say the hotel is very old, as the building is a XIVth century Convent. The other comments you make are personal so, I can not argue with this. I only hope we will have the chance to let you change your mind in a next stay in Florence.  Best regards,  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Perfect!
review: Can't beat the location of this hotel. Close to the Central train station, an amazing church, and the river. Easy to walk to the major attractions in Florence, including the Ponte Vecchio for you shoppers:) The hotel rooms are fine, though they are very modern and come with no directions. We enjoyed the bathrobes and the upstairs spa with jacuzzi, sauna, etc. You do have to reserve those in advance, and there's a guy who checks you in and hangs around, so no funny business:( The restaurant, Benedicta, was a real jewel. I'll say more in a review of it. Florence is a nice town, not the huge city like Rome or Milan, and not as "touristy" as Pisa and Venice. Enjoy!

review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace.
