title: Hotel
review: Everything about this hotel is fabulous! The rooms are generous in size and it's in a great location. Generally people in Florence were rude, so the hotel was a great in- betweener because everyone here is lovely! Great stay, wish we could stay longer, eat at the hotel restaraunt Benidicto it's magnificent! No complaints!

title: Comfortable, Friendly with Great Location
review: Just spent 4 nights here, the hotel was wonderful, great location large bedroom and bathroom and the staff really helpful and friendly. Breakfast was also very good and again the staff were really nice

title: absolutely superb
review: Loved this hotel. We were on the 3rd floor, quiet, with a nice view of the clock tower. Room was spacious and clean; beds were very comfortable. Location of hotel was perfect. The square was right up the steet and everything a person wanted to see was within walking distance. Bathroom, however, was small.  Staff here was incredibly friendly and accommodating. Very good breakfasts in very nice indoor and outdoor settings. Having drinks by the indoor bar in the lobby was always fun while Sani and Paula (the bartenders) could not be more helpful!

title: Great location and room
review: What a fantastic hotel. Booked a four night stay here to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary having never been to Italy and always wanting to go. It lived up to all our expectations and more,from the moment we walked into the hotel it was 'wow!!' The hotel is beautiful and it's staff a credit to it.The porter showed us to our room which was lovely it overlooked the inner courtyard garden area and jucuzzi which a few people used whilst we were there but the noise was never a problem and had a lovely spacious balcony for enjoying a relaxed glass of wine.Breakfast was fantastic with a large selection of cooked, cold meats,cereals,fruit and pastries on offer and nobody should walk away hungry or dissatisfied. The breakfast staff are lovely, always cheerful and polite and a joy…

title: Sadly, just left
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Overall, a very good hotel, but it can be noisy
review: This was a great hotel. A little hard to find at first, but once there appreciated how close it was to the train station. We watched people drag suitcases all over Florence, and realized what a jewel we had - close to the station yet a very short walk to everywhere we wanted to go. We stayed 4 nights and could not have been happier. Our room overlooked the outside dining courtyard so it was perfect.  A few things: Shower doors are poor design and water leaks, and the plugs are mostly 3 prong now but there were a few 2 prongs left. Pool/spa was tiny but we didn't use- too much to see! Breakfast was wonderful, staff gracious, and dinner delicious. We hope to get back to Florence and when we do this will be our choice.

title: A gem of a hotel
review: We booked three nights on an Animod voucher for $300, a great deal in Florence.  We were on the second floor in a room overlooking the courtyard and pool with a little balcony.  Thankfully people were not out there late at night because you could hear everything.  But, the noise from the corridor was awful with people coming in late at night (what is it about hotel corridors that when people come in at midnight they have to shout at each other and have no consideration for people sleeping???)  So, my suggestion is to book a room as high as you can and overlooking the courtyard rather than the street.  Otherwise, it was clean and comfy (and small by US standards).  The breakfast was fantastic and there was no extra charge for eggs and bacon as others have suggested.  The location…

title: Great hotel in Florence!
review: My husband and I were at this hotel with a group from Road Scholars.   The hotel is clean, well-appointed and attractive.   Our room was small with no view of the street, but we were in it for such a short time, it didn't matter.  The breakfast rooms were cheerful and decorated attractively.   The breakfast selection was outstanding (typical European lack of good eggs and bacon, however, according to my husband)  although we bemoaned the lack of fresh fruit.   The staff were attentive and helpful and the owner's presence indicated his desire to provide excellent service to the public.  I missed being able to serve coffee to myself from the machines, but who can complain when each cup of cappuccino came with a little heart outlined in cinnamon on top of the cream?   Check out the…

title: Great hotel in Florence
review: Enjoyed our stay at Hotel Rivoli. Beautiful courtyard area. Our room was very quiet - third floor. Very comfortable room temperature. Very clean & great shower pressure! Great location for walking to center and train. Would stay there again when in Florence.

title: Wonderful hotel close to the train station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: What a hotel should be
review: We pick this hotel because it was close to the train station.  We had two room which you can do triples which was great as we were traveling as 6 people.  The rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms were large.  The hotel staff was wonderful and very friendly.  The meal plan for breakfast was wonderful.  The do have a restaurant and the food was wonderful and the service was great.  I would definitely stay here again and recommend this place to others.

title: Great hotel and location!
review: This is a very pleasant hotel, a short walk from SMN station and in walking distance of the centre. It has a lovely courtyard area with bar tables and a jacuzzi.  Room was well furnished and high quality.  Surprisingly, given its location on the ground floor overlooking the courtyard, it was not noisy. Shower was powerful, though badly designed and could soak the floor if you were not careful.  I was impressed that reception provided tea and coffee making facilities free of charge. The only service failure was the time taken to check out - everyone seemed to choose 11:30am on a Monday to leave, and some had complex issues. Not the staff's fault.  To improve the hotel they should offer lower priced food in the restaurant.  We would have used it, but it was about 2-3 times our…

title: Couldn't fault it!
review: Our room at the Rivoli was spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff was very helpful and room service was excellent too. Great buffet breakfast which was also served outdoors in a lovely patio. Only a couple of blocks away from the main train station and at walking distance from the Duomo. I would definitely recommend it !

title: Beautiful Hotel!!
review: We had spent our honeymoon here 25 years ago and we loved it. There is always a danger going back that it won't have the same feel - from the moment we stepped over the threshold any doubts were blown away.  The staff were wonderful, the room was large with a lovely balcony, the breakfast was perfect for setting you up for whatever plans you had for the day. It is ideally placed and all the major attractions were well within walking distance.  There were many restaurants right on the doorstep and a great Gelaterie on the corner of the street. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Must be one of the best hotels in Florence
review: Stayed here on our last few nights in Florence  Absolutely gorgeous hotel.  The staff was top notch.  The rooms were excellent, the facilities superb.  Definitely worth staying at.  Close to the city center and all the sights.  Breakfast was excellent.  I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Florence.  Walking distance to the train and bus station is a definite plus.

title: the best of the best!!!!!
review: Did find the hotel on best western . Com . Located close or 5 minuts from the busy central station. Warm welcome by reception. Posibel to have ligth snacs also hot during the day. In the evening there is a restaurant on sigth, did not try it(pricelist did look ok). Room was small but very clean and for business 1 person ok, the internet/wifi was fast and good. Bathroom was absolutly to small and some people could have problems. No noice problems during my stay and all the staff was very service minded and very helpfull. Breakfast in the morning as from 07.00 was Very good and all i did want hot and cold and pleanty of everything. Will for sure stay here again and can recommend the hotel for business as well as for turist as close to the center and the river.

title: Good location, get a room with a (quiet) courtyard view
review: the staff, the facilities, the rooms the restaurant with morning breakfast, the location -could not ask for more!!!!! we highly recommend this hotel to the. future travelers and hope they will enjoy it as we did

title: Pleasant Stay
review: Pros: - 5 minute walk from train station. The major sites in Florence are in a compact section of the city so everything we wanted to see was within walking distance of the hotel.  - staff was friendly  - rooms were spacious- separate sitting area from bedroom  Cons: - our room faced a street and it was so noisy from 11pm- 4am. We woke up and couldn't go back to sleep the first 2 nights so we asked to switch rooms. We spoke to 2 people at the front desk who both said "usually it's a quiet street." obviously they haven't tried to sleep in that room. It was so loud I thought my husband had the window open but it was closed. Constant noise of cars and what sounded like (drunk) American students carrying on, yelling, singing in the street until 4 am at the hostel/apartments behind…

title: In general OK, but I wouldn't stay there again
review: Excellent location within easy walking distances to train and bus stations, attractions, restaurants and car hire (if needed for a later tour of Tuscany). Reception staff very helpful, particularly Francesca. Breakfast had sufficient choice of cereals, yoghurts, fruit...etc., although cooked choice was more limited. Speciality coffees incurred an extra charge. Service depended upon which staff were on duty. We were given a 'superior' room which was quiet, large with inside sitting area as well as french doors onto a balcony/patio area with furniture overlooking the inner courtyard with other rooms opposite. The bathroom was small but adequate, however the hair dryer handle became very hot in use and guests are asked not to use their own appliances. Hospitality trays of…

title: Nice hotel in a great location
review: The hotel grounds and rooms were great, it was everything else that wasn't the best.... The staff at the front desk were helpful, although they didn't seem "happy" about being helpful if that makes sense! Also, every other place we stayed in Italy (we travelled Italy for just over 3 weeks) the wifi access was free. They charge extra per day for this and it's even more expensive if you use their computer. So we paid for the wifi, but we couldn't even get access to it in our room! We had to go into the common areas and were still charged. The breakfast was TERRIBLE. Again, everywhere else we stayed had yummy breakfasts. I couldn't find anything I liked at theirs and we ended up going elsewhere some mornings. The croissants were stale and the eggs were rubber. The hotel was in a…

title: Great hotel in Firenze!
review: This hotel benefits from an excellent location, close to the train station and most of the tourist attractions. The staff are superb. We had a warm welcome upon our arrival and they were attentive throughout our stay. Breakfasts were good with hot and cold options, although fried eggs and omelettes incurred an additional charge. The bedroom, however was a bit of a disaster! We had a "Classic" room which was small, had no view at all and was particularly noisy when the rain dripped from the guttering onto a plastic roof just below the bedroom window. This let the hotel down badly - hence the "average" rating. We would certainly return to this hotel but next time we will book a room which overlooks the front of the hotel or the attractive internal courtyard. A traveller tip - if…

title: Super hotel perfect location for sightseeing
review: Dear Guest,  thank you for sharing your nice comment with the Tripadvisor readers. I'm really glad you appreciated our quality and our service, and since now, for your next stay, I will be more than happy to offer you a different kind of room. Our hotel is a 15th century convent, converted in hotel, for this reason all our rooms are different one from each other, just informing  us you didn't find comfortable that room, we could have changed it with non problem at all.  Waiting for receiving you once again at the Rivoli, from all of us best regards.  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great rooms, super location, need to improve wifi and breakfast.
review: The hotel is 2 minutes' walk away from Santa Maria Novella, and about 10 minutes' walk from the Duomo (or 20 slow walking and window shopping). It has a very quiet and lovely inner courtyard with a superb restaurant. There is a fab hot tub as well, although as it's also in a courtyard you feel rather on display as many rooms overlook it!  The restaurant was a real treat, and I enjoyed the most delicious stuffed zucchini flowers I have ever had. Staff were courteous and charming, and I would definitely go back... someday!

title: Near Train Station
review: The USP of this hotel is its location. Its barely 5 mins from the train station, which makes it super convenient. It is also extremely close to the Santa Maria square and some great restaurants around the area. You can walk to Duomo and other museums which aren't more than a 15-20 mins walk. Our room was great, looked like it was recently renovated, and had a good fresh feel to it. No real view from the room, but it wasn't a big issue for us.   The breakfast as in the rest of Italy has a small spread, and you had to pay more if you wanted eggs made to your liking, and other 'good' stuff. The 'free' hot chocolate was pretty good though. My only negative other than the not so extensive breakfast was the wifi in our rooms. First, you have to pay for it, and second, it doesn't work…

title: Excellent Location, Great Staff
review: We arrived in Florence via train. The BW Hotel Rivoli is about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the train station. At check-in the hotel upgraded our room. The room was very nice with free wifi the first night then available for 5 Euros daily. The hotel has a very nice breakfast buffet excellent selection with a friendly staff. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from major museums and shopping. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Location is all about
review: A very good price for a clean, well furnished room with a great view close to the station and the sites in the old town.  Staff was friendly and helpful an there were some nice amenities but the pool was substandard.

title: Fantastic hotel and restaurant
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Fabulous staff and hotel
review: We spent two nights at Hotel Rivoli, and would have happily stayed longer. All the staff we encountered were friendly and professional. The hotel decor was lovely, and our room was very clean and comfortable. The stand-out for us were the meals (dinner and breakfast) we enjoyed at the hotels' restaurant. The dinner service was outstanding, the wait staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. The food was the best we had in Italy, so much so that we returned the second night. It was great to see the chef and his staff out in the restaurant too. The breakfast was also delicious, with the same great service. Great job Hotel Rivoli, we would recommend a stay here to anyone visiting Florence.

title: good location
review: Dear Guest,  thank you for the nice comment! My collegues and I are really glad that we met your expectations!  We really try every day to do our best and It's so nice from you  to tell us that you appreciated that. Hope to see you again at teh Rivoli. Best regards,   Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Treated like royalty
review: Thank you so much to the fabulous front desk staff at this beautiful historic hotel in a beautiful city!  I had a bad fall in Rome and broke my 2 front teeth.  I was determined not to miss my train to Florence.  Within 15 minutes of arriving the front desk had an appointment for me with a wonderful doctor-dentist and within one and half hour I had two new composite front teeth and was smiling again! And enjoying Florence for three more nights and then a ten day cruise.  Absolutely saved my vacation! We Highly recommend this hotel!  I will be forever grateful and tell everyone I know including my dentist in the states who very much admired this work as there was not much tooth left to build on. Hope to get back to Florence and stay at this hotel again!

title: A home away from home...
review: We stayed here for 6 nights in late April 2013. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We were given a room overlooking the courtyard. Most of the time it was quiet, though there were nights we were kept awake by people chatting outside.  The room only has the air conditioning turned on from June to Sept so it can get warm with the window closed. I noticed a few times at about 3am, that a good deal of other guests had to leave windows open all night too - I assume they were all not smoking out the window at this time!  By leaving the window open, it meant mosquitos visited us. The room had a safe and mini-bar fridge to keep drinks cool. The bathroom brought new meaning to "compact" but it was clean.  There was a Wi-Fi connection at a charge of 5 euros per 24 hours.…

title: Historic Hotel at a Reasonable Price
review: This hotel is evidently located where an old monastary formerly stood. There was an old beam in our bathroom that I though was an odd decoration but now realize was probably a featured demonstration of the antiquity of parts of the building. This hotel is located in central Florence, just a couple blocks from the Arno River near the Santa Maria Novella Church and Square. It is rated a 4 star hotel but the rooms are smallish and some of the bathrooms are tiny to the point of poor functionality. There is a beautifully appointed 'sitting room' with antique chairs on which sitting is forbidden and a pretty but small garden square. However, the rest of the decor is somewhat dingy and unexciting. Our small bathroom was a real problem. We had only a shower and there was no lip or rim…

title: Good location, GREAT breakfast, Decent rooms for the price
review: This was a lovely hotel in a converted monastery with an excellent location - very near the railway station.  It was an interesting old hotel with an elegant salon full of beautiful paintings and antique furniture.  The courtyard was also a pleasant place to sit, although we were there in the winter so it was cold.    Unfortunately, we found that our room was a bit small, considering that the hotel is supposed to be four stars.  The bathroom was tiny.  However, the bed was comfortable and the hotel was very clean.  We also obtained tea and coffee making equipment, so that improved our stay.  It was disappointing that there was no free Wi-Fi.  This was expensive, but there are some Internet cafes near the station.  We especially enjoyed the breakfast.  Fresh fruit, croissants,…

title: Four Friends from London  8th April to 11thApril
review: Location: Literally a 5 minute walk from the SMN Train Station and 5-10 minutes to the Duomo.  Laundry across the street.  We packed light and paid €8 to drop off laundry here and it was so worth it.  Street was a bit scary at night, wouldn't walk it alone.  Rooms: Clean and comfy. Not modern but that was totally fine.  Breakfast: Worth paying for the breakfast.  Hot eggs, sausage, bacon, yogurt, breads, pastries, cereals, fruits (fresh and canned), cold & hot drinks, CHOICES GALORE!  Was full until late lunch, one of the only hotels where I can say that.

title: Would highly recommend it!
review: This is a very nice, comfortable hotel. Location is perfect.- minutes away from everything.  The staff are excellent.  They are very helpful and very pleasant to everyone. I cannot praise them enough! The rooms have a fridge and a tray with a kettle etc. is supplied on request. Excellent food in the restaurant.  I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Catch the 12 bus from outside the station, which will take you to Piazzale Michaelangelo.  The views are stunning.  Return on 13 bus from a stop almost opposite.  Eating at restaurant opposite hotel was very good. A short walk away is Maso restaurant, Via Maso Finiguerre 10, 055212106. An amazing vegetable risotto. Everything perfect. If returning to Pisa airport. Stop off at Pisa central.  There are lockers there costing 4…

title: Lovely hotel - excellent staff - what more can you want!

title: Great
review: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in Florence, chose this hotel after reading some of the reviews....and it was a perfect choice. Our room didn't have a balcony, but this wasn't a problem - it was furnished very well and was very comfortable. The staff here really do know how to do things right, nothing is too much trouble and everybody is so pleasant & helpful. Breakfast very nice, good continental choice & this sets you up well for the walking!  Hotel location is perfect - just a short walk from the Station - also a short walk into the main city centre. Florence is beautiful, and there are so many things that you can recommend. Have a leisurely lunch sitting in one of the many beautiful Piazzas before sightseeing the Pitti Palace, Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi etc & then enjoy…

title: An elegant hotel
review: Spent two nights on a business trip there. Hotel is great and the service was outstanding. It's close to everything.  I appreciated there breakfast take away beg prepared for 5:30 am. I highly recommend this place.

title: Short walk from train station~Huge Rooms for Europe
review: Dear Guest,   thanks for your nice comment posted here on TA !! I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli on your next tryp to Florence.   Best regards, Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Location, staff and price
review: The hotel is conveniently situated a short walk from the railway station and within easy walking distance of all main attractions. The hotel is very beautiful originally having being a monastery, the staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble.  The rooms are spacious and very clean and quiet, our room had a small balcony with a view of the courtyard and jacuzzi.  The hotel restaurant is very good but there are plenty of other restaurants close by.  I am Coeliac and am unable to eat food containing gluten,  at breakfast I was provided with a pack containing cereal, crackers, cake, rice biscuits and jam all without gluten this was in addition to an extensive buffet.  I would certainly stay there again.

title: Excellent 4 night stay
review: Location full points, 200 meters from station and very very close to duomo. No need for taking city buses since hotel is walking distance from all sites. Breakfast was nice with lots of variety. Rooms comfortable and spacious. Hotel staff friendly, for dinner there is a pizzeria on the street offering good pasta pizza.

title: Nearby the Train Station and Great Restaurants.
review: What else can we say except this hotel does not deserve any bad ratings, the staff were so friendly and helpful throughout our stay. From printing off train time tables, to the daily weather. You were always greeted with a smile. The rooms and bed were firm which was wonderful for someone with a bad back and other bad joint problems. There is a lift so you do not have to walk up the stairs etc, great for people with disabilities. The room was large for a European country. Bathroom large, Everything is really clean. *The Breakfast was really good with fresh coffee made to order and a good selection of cereals, eggs, bacon, juices, yoghurt, fruits etc The price for the room was amazing considering what you get in London for triple the price, we got more here for so much less! The…

title: A Convenient Stay in Florence
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for your comment! I'm really glad we match your expectations!! From all the staff and form me again thank you and hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli !! Best regards  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Worst day in Florence
review: We choose this hotel based on its reasonable rates and close distance to the train station. It is located on street; via Della Scala, a quiet street off the busy intersections that lead to the train station. Our room was a superior room overlooking the courtyard.  I did see the regular size room and compared to the superior, it is much smaller and tight spaces all around. Room and Bathroom are clean and functional but a renovation is due especially in the hallways and elevator areas. Heat from the vents is very strong that we turn off the system during the night because the room temperature gets really hot. The noises that we heard were shower water draining sounds from other bathrooms coming from the vents.  The water sounds felt very much that water was going to pour out from…

title: Enjoyable stay
review: this hotel is nice but the staff makes the stay. the restaurant staff is very friendly and helpful. the breakfast is ok but the warm interactions with the wait staff helps start the day off great. we had dinner there one night and had a great time. the waiter spoke english and spent time teaching us about florence. the room was OK but nothing special. hotel arranged for parking of our car.

title: Hotel saved me from nightmare trip
review: My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon tour of Italy.  We chose Hotel Rivoli as it seemed the best hotel against similarly priced rivals.  As everyone says, it's close to the train station and only a 5-10 minute walk into the centre of Florence via Santa Maria Novella square.  Our room was near the top of the hotel overlooking the courtyard.  It was clean and functional but in my opinion could do with a little updating.  We loved the fact that you could choose what sort of pillows you wanted from a menu!  Great idea.  The courtyard was nice to sit in during the day as they spray a mist of water every 10 seconds to keep guests cool in the summer.  Although I most enjoyed sitting on our balcony in the sunshine with a good book!  The jacuzzi pool was ok, only used it…

title: Best Hotel in Florence
review: I arrived in Florence 1st July 2012, my first trip abroad on my own. I had everything in place, but when I arrived the taxi driver took me to the wrong place - I not knowing at the time I was in completely the wrong area of Florence with no contact from people I was staying with panicked like crazy. I made my way back to the train station as I used it as a central point. I walked down the nearest street and saw some dodgy looking hotel, knowing the Best Western brand I decided this would be the best option for the night. I walked in (in quite a state) and the man at reception was so helpful and reassuring, he gave me a little off the price of a night stay as it was quite expensive. I was taken to my room and showed around, I had a single room and it was lovely. Amazingly comfy…

title: Overpriced Old hotel
review: This hotel was one of the best, we've seen other reviews that have not been so positive but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The staff were great, very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. There is a wonderful courtyard garden with a jacuzzi and pool and we enjoyed drinks and nibblys which were served by a very lovely friendly Italian wait person. There is a great dining room for breakfast with all manner of food available both hot and cold.  For dinner there is a beautifully landscaped garden courtyard.  The food is amazing!!  We had a two story room which was very spacious and comfortable.  It was behind the courtyard dining area and very private.    We had friends visit us here on their way home to Australia and the staff were only too happy for them to leave their…

title: highly recommended
review: As others have said, it is a well located hotel (walk from the train station) with friendly and helpful staff.  We read that we needed advanced reservations for some things but the staff suggested we just go and save the additional fees for their booking.  They were also gracious and polite when we had unsupervised children recently off of their leashes upstairs.  No fault of the hotel but I will say that you may hear your neighbors upstairs if they are stopping around.  The rooms are quite tight as are the bathrooms.  We were a bit surprised that our hotel in Rome was so much more spacious than this one.   The breakfast choices were adequate but one staff member made my blood boil.  He was friendly and asked if we wanted a coffee, tea, hot chocolate before we even sat down.  Of…

title: A marvelous place to stay
review: Dear Guest,  thaks for sharing your comments and giving us the chance for improving our services. We try to give our best and for some reasons not alays we respect clients expectations. I'm deeply sorry for the misunderstandig with the restaurant staff, I will try to change theyr way of approaching the client.  I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and have a new opinion from you, waiting for this I whish you all the Best for the next 2013 !  Best regards Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great 4 star Hotel in Florence
review: I will try not to duplicate the other reviews, which are accurate.  Yes, it is within walking distance of the train station, but the hotel also offers a valet service for your car (no street parking!) which ranges from 22-28 euros, depending on the size of your car.  The breakfast buffet is amazing, and complemented by the individually made coffees to order... go ahead, get a cappucino with a little foam heart.  (note: a 'doppio' is a double espresso.. beware!  this is premium octane).    There is a beautiful central courtyard where you are welcome to bring panini, etc to eat (there's a nice, sandwich shop on the same street), and a large jacquzzi (tell the front desk you want to use it, and they'll bring you decadently large towels and hoody bathrobes).  What was amazing was…

title: Sweet hotel in an excellent location!
review: Dear Guest,  it is a real pleasure to read your comments, I shared with all my collegues and all of us are proud about it.  Thank you also for pointing on the "negatives", yes, we are not perfect but thaks to our guest comments we try hardly to do our best to improve us. Hoping to welcome you again at the Rivoli, from all of us All the best for the next 2013 !!! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great Place to Find Peace in Florence
review: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Rivoli in Florence. We enjoyed ourselves so much last December that we decided to make a return trip, and we were not disappointed. The staff are exemplary: professional, friendly and helpful. Their command of English is excellent and nothing seems to be too much trouble. The hotel is spotlessly clean, is in the perfect location for the tourist, being walking distance from the rail station and right next to Santa Maria Novella. You can walk to the Duomo in about 5 minutes. The breakfasts are good and the facilities are perfect. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Florence.

title: Grazie Mille........
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for choosing the Rivoli again for your stay in Florence, it is always a pleasure and a very good surprise receiving such a nice comment! I hope I will have the chance of welcoming you again in our house.  From the staff and me besty regards and Arrivederci! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: perfect location
review: I've been traveling to Florence for over 20+ years and have stayed in many good hotels. That said, I have to say that the Best Western Rivoli was by far the best of them. The hotel staff is friendly and professional. The hotel itself is nearly restored and incredibly charming. There is a small garden and a terrace with a pool. And the breakfast is top notch. Note: Best Westerns in Europe are nothing like the Best Westerns in the USA and Canada. They are individually owned and operated and are of a much high quality.  It's also centrally located and only a 5-10 minute walk from the Ponte Vecchio and all major sites. If you are looking for charm, comfort and a bit of peace in crowded Florence I'd stay here. Matthew B.

title: Friendly, Clean, and
review: Wonderful stay at the Best Western Rivoli. The staff were excellent; helpful, friendly and a fountain of local knowledge!  The room we stayed in was reasonably well appointed with a view over the heated spa pool and courtyard area all of which are lovely.   One note of advice, when in Florence keep your bathroom door firmly closed! Unfortunately as with all of Florence the drains are well known for their 'puzza' aroma. The bathrooms though are, as you would expect from Italians, very well appointed with excellent facilities!  The hotel is well situated to enjoy all the sights of this fabulous city & all are within easy reach either on foot or via the wonderful local buses and, with the SMN Station for both bus & train travel only 5 minutes walk away, the rest of Italy is also…

title: Fantastic solution in the centre of Florence near the SMN station
review: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Rivoli for 3 nights having fled from the Venice high tides.  The public areas have character as it was originally a convent centuries ago.  The rooms are smallish but well appointed - comfortable beds with lovely bedding.  I particularly liked the bathroom. Again,it was small but had heated floors and heated towel rack with lots of nice towels.  There was a tiny balcony, which,in better weather would have been lovely.  There are courtyards and a whirlpool but again the weather precluded our use of these.  The breakfast was generous with lots of choice.  With the exception of one waitress, who seemed to think one cup of coffee should be enough, the service was good.  The front desk staff were wonderful and spoke excellent English.  There was a…

title: Great Location
review: I have been here with my girlfriend and we spent really good time. There is a small pool outside in the middle of the hotel with hot water, really fantastic in winter. The rooms are clean and beatiful, service is good and continental breakfast is rich and delicious;) The position is good, one minute by foot from the SMN station and ten minutes walking from the most interest places in Florence. Have a nice time.

title: Decent hotel and centrally located
review: I reviewed Tripavisor prior to booking this hotel, and I am a Platinum at Best Western, so when I can stay at one, I do, earn the points to stay free at others, like I am now in Lucca, Italy.  When we drove up to the hotel, I was not sure, kind of old and dirty looking from the outside.  Once inside, it is very nice, not a 5 star, but clean and for the most part, all were friendly.  The receptionist, Massimmilo, was very nice.  The room was nice, usual type of European stuff-sparse, but clean and all we needed.  The breakfast was good, help there was not as friendly as front desk.  Most people we met at the hotel were from North America, so would recommend.  It was close to the train station and not that far from the main attractions of Florence.  Good restuarants very close…

title: A nice, centrally located place
review: I stayed there for 2 weeks.   Location : Not in touristy area but 5 minutes walk to the Santa Maria Novella station and Sita bus depot. Rooms : Very small and even smaller bathrooms but may be because of it's location in the city center. So, are the passages. The beds were not so comfortable and blankets not enough.I could also hear sounds from the other rooms. Food : Good breakfast. I also had a good dinner at the hotel restuarant. Service : Courteous and helpful staff. One of the best services I have seen in Florence hotels. Hotel : It is carpeted and is beautifully decorted with a small little garden bar and area inside.  WIFI and laundry services could be cheaper. Would like to be back just because of the good service.

title: Functional hotel with a good location

title: Not horrible.....but not 4star!
review: Stayed there for 3 days this past week.  Not in a touristy area but short walking distance to sites and restaurants.   Staff is friendly and conversant in English.  On first night my wife woke up with bites on her hands.  The second night I too woke up with bites on hands ans shoulders. They did not itch built were small red welts.  Hotel front desk were concerned but said they were Mosquitos.  I'm not to sure of that since they did not itch.   The breakfast buffet was decent and hand any choices.  Most of the folks staying there seemed to be part of tour groups.

title: Very nice
review: Dear Guest,  thank you for your comments, I'm Daniele, the person you spoke with that morning and I'm glad to confirm you that; after speaking with you, I went up to your room with the Housekeeper and completely undress the room. The main suspect in those cases is that room is "occupied" by other insects, but in your room there was no other than mosquitos. Infact room has been sprayed and in the second morning you didn't report anymore the problem.  Our hotel follows a disinfection program to prevent (as much as possible),  bedbugs and other insects but unfortyunately in this period, when temperature in the house is higher than outside mosquitos comes inside and we can spray the room just as we are shure that clients are note allergic. Hoping to welcome you again at Rivoli, best regards.  Daniele Torrini - Ass. Manager

title: Nice experience! Loved it totally!
review: The location is very good, walking distance of the main attractions, and in a fairly quiet street. Reception is efficient and welcoming, as are all the staff. But a couple of big areas detract from this hotel .Firstly it is just shabby... Carpets on stairs are old and grubby, bedrooms (we had classic rooms) are dark, small and dull (though beds are comfortable) Secondly breakfast...barely acceptable for a 3star ..and just not even close for a 4star.We did not even venture into the hot tub as it looked so uninviting.This hotel has excellent staff...just needs to invest some of those dollars on bringing the decor  up to acceptable three star...and maybe even 4 if they really go for it.

title: Spacious Room, but dated and noisy
review: Very nice room. Helpful staff and good breakfast. They also offer different types of pillows! I liked that a lot! Good location. I won't say extraordinary but really can't find any real faults unless you consider the bed was hard but all of the beds were in Italy. We are just spoiled americans😄we would stay here again.

title: 5 stars for service location and facilities, but lost 2 stars on maintenance issues
review: Almost everything about this hotel was delightful: our room (a twin, junior suite), the lounge, the bar, the HUGE jacuzzi (which we had all to ourself in the afternoons) and, of course, the location. Easy to find when you stumble out of the train station in a foreign city, and easy to find your way back to after a day's sightseeing. A couple of OK restaurant nearby, but for the good ones you have to walk a few more blocks. But the mosquitos! We had a room on the third floor, and if we had the window open, the room was soon filled with tiny, aggressive, bloodthirsty mosquitos. When we closed the window and had the aircondition on, we got the sneezes, so it was a question of choosing which was worse. This was at the end of September. On the negative side: the charge of 5 euros per…

title: Not much from the outside, but inside...
review: Dear Guest,  thank you for your nice comments on our hotel ! Unfortunately the very hot summer and the warm autumn we are having, gives mosquitos very good chances!! Concerning the coffee you said it was the worst, I inform you that I already informed th F&B Manager in order to check and provide. I hope to welcome you again at the Rivoli and offer you a "good cup of coffee". Thank you for giving us your opinion and Arrivederci at the Rivoli. Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Beautiful hotel very near train and bus station. Nice street, plenty of restaurants and good places to eat nearby. Very close to everything. Room was quite modern and very clean. I accidentally dropped a coin below the TV stall, and when moved it to get my coin, found lots of hidden dust. Not a big deal, but just because i saw it, i have to report it. Lovely breakfast, abundance of cakes, croissants and pastries, as well as cold meats, scrumbled eggs, bacon and sausages. Fresh fruit salad as well as fresh fruit available for breakfast and throughout the day. Staff very polite and helpfull, service at par with some 5 star hotels i have been in italy. The outdoor jacuzzi was a plus, water always warm. Now the 2 issues that brought the stars down my total review stars to 3: - in…

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: We spent four nights there and were delighted. The rooms are large and clean. The staff was helpful and seemed to care. It is close to the train station and a very short walk to most of the places of interest. It is not far from the river or the museums. The breakfasts were excellent and the servers very good. Good value.

title: Great Rooms, Fantastic Bartender
review: My wife and I have just returned from a trip to Europe and part of that was 6 night in September 2012 at the Rivoli we had an inside room with balconay overlooking the court yard a great spot. We arrived by train and found the place easy to find and close. The staff were very helpfull in every way with recommendations for eating, places to go (we had a long list beforehand though) and how to get there. We found the room to be just right very clean and everytghing you would want. The breakfast was very good and to be able to sit outside in the courtyard added that little bit extra. We dined at the restraunt at the hotel a number of times with a great front of house man and very good food. We loved our stay hera ane would recommend it to anyone and we would definatly stay here…

title: Hotel Rivoli in Florence has exellent service
review: The rooms are very nice and clean although a bit small by US standards. Storage was fair. The bathroom had an odd bathtub/shower combination that leaked water on the floor. There were adequate outlets for charging electronics. Internet card was about $7 euros per 24 hr. The complimentary breakfast was a buffet that featured the usual European fare plus scrambled eggs.  The restaurant on site had an odd evening menu but the food was excellent. The standout here was the bartender, Sani. He was a true mixologist who made excellent drinks. By the time we reached Florence, we were wine weary and ready for something different. The only downside was that he worked the bar alone. He had to mix, clean, take the money, etc so service was a bit slow at times but definitely worth the wait.…

title: Convenient location
review: I stayed for 2 days in Hotel Rivoli in Florence. I liked the location few steps from  railway station  and the service was exellent for a 4 star standard. Rooms very neat and clean and breakfast was good. we had two dinners in the restaurant and staff was couteous. I will recommend this hotel for families looking for 4 star accomodation in Florence

title: Nice Hotel and convienent location
review: Good location, not too far from all the sites.  I came in by a train, and it was very easy to walk to the hotel. First look of the street made me think twice if i booked a good hotel but in the end i was very happy i stayed there.  My room was small but it had a terrice looking out to the court yard where people eat (learnt that after i flashed the old ducks), very nice if you want to sit out and have a wine in semi private area. Breafast was good, staff were very friendly and always greeted you. Only downside was you can hear people checking in late at night.  Sites are walking distance, no need for a taxi unless you are going to piazza michelangelo.  There are two laundry mates close by, right across the road and down the street (away from the train station), better one is…

title: This should really be a 5 star hotel
review: Booked a four night stay at Rivoli for September 2012 and was not disappointed.  The hotel is so central to all the main Florence attractions it was perfect - but it was also on a fairly quiet street and we heard no noise at all (room was out the back.....).  Service was fantastic - warm welcome, very friendly staff, extremely helpful reception.  Good selection for breakfast, plenty of it and good coffee.  Room was spacious with a reasonably priced mini bar - no tea or coffee for the room though, not that I think we would have had any if it was there!  Great base for exploring Florence and Tuscany.  O and the train (and bus) station is definitely no more than three minutes walk away, even with luggage!

title: Great little hotel
review: The first thing we loved at this hotel was the wonderful lobby with the small fountain and small antiques, and when we got to our rooms we found out they're connected which was cool. The room was really big and really clean with an lcd tv a mini fridge and a roomy bathroom which was really clean. The hotel's restaurant was amazing it has really great food for either dinner or breakfast . And the hotel also has a hot tub which is a little unusual since its a little big.I highly recommend this hotel

title: 100 % guest satisfaction
review: Stayed 2 night here on our honeymoon tour of Italy.   Easy to find, great location as 5 mins walk from train station and 10 mins walk to the main square. Check in was quick and friendly and happy to answer my barrage of questions! Bell boy took up the luggage which is always appreciated!  Room was lovely. Great view overlooking little pool and courtyard. Room was clean and roomy.Only thing that would have been nice was tea and coffee making facilities. lovely big balcony  Breakfast was nice in a cute little restaurant. Small hot selection and lots of bread, meats and pastries. Friendly staff as well! Also got 10 percent off the restaurant there but never used it!  They had good room service and a lovely barman making us cocktails! lots of places to sit in the evenings inside and…

title: Nice Hotel with great staff
review: I really loved the hotel. Very nice old style design. Lilies everywhere. Complimentary fruits in lobby.  In-room small cosy details like books and pictures make you feel like at home. The location is very convenient- 8 min from the Republica Piazza. The room is very clean. The restaurant is very good. Food is excellent. Waiters are highly attentive. If you want something what is not in menu - just describe to the waiter and they will cook it for you. I never heard "no". Whatever I have asked- they replied "Yes, segnora!" :) In one word - i would stay there forever. Thank you for the great hospitality. Highly recommend and would definitely stay there next time.

title: In the heart of Firenze
review: The staff was very pleasant and always helpful...made recommendations besides Florence to visit Pisa and the beach which I did and this was a great experience.!  Ermelinda at the front desk helped with every detail willingly and with a smile.  Great value for what you receive!

title: Convenient location, helpful staff
review: the location of the hotel is perfect, cause it is 10 min to railway station Santa Maria Novella and also 10 minutes to the center of the city of Firenze. Very decent personnel, great variety of food during breakfast and even prosecco. Also there is a garden for breakfast. At the reception you can book tickets, for example, to Uffizi

title: A gem hidden away near the station....
review: This is a great place to stay! It was very convenient to get to coming from the train station. The staff was very helpful, especially when it came to our nightly inquiries about restaurants! It was great to have a pool to cool off in after a long day of sightseeing, especially in hot August! Hotel bar was great too to have a quick night cap before calling it an early night.

title: Pleasant Experience at Hotel Rivoli
review: Perfect for those arriving and departing by train, the Rivoli is within a modest walk to all that Florence offers....  The building is not a business box and the staff are friendly and helpfull...  especially when I left my wallett behind... Doh !  Thank you guys on the front desk !  The outdoor jacuzzi is great to chill away the day and the heat.

title: City Centre Oasis
review: I traveled to Florence by train. This hotel is not far from the train station. I can roll my suitcase to there. You can walk to the attractions, but be very careful and look the map often to make sure you are on the right track because the streets are narrow and too many. You could be lost very easily.

title: What a Find
review: After searching the internet  we picked a gem of a place .We were quickly shown to our room by a very efficient hall porter , Alexander a charming Rumanian always wit a smile ,our room on the first floor overlooked the front street however not a problem it was quiet and we were not disturbed by street noise ,the room was perfect very clean and quite spacious . The facilities at this hotel were perfect ,an added bonus was the courtyards a great place to relax and enjoy a drink after a day sightseeing I would like to thank Francesca on the reception desk for being so helpful and always with a smile also thanks to Sani on the bar for his great attention and conversation . Thank you to the Hotel Rivoli for making our trip to the City of Florence one that I will not forget . Would I…

title: Close to station
review: Dear Guest,  thanks for your nice comments on our Rivoli, I passed your compliments to Francesca, Alexander and Sani and I'm really proud that our efforts to make our guest's stay pleasant match your requests.  I hope to welcome you at the Rivoli and thanking you again I just say .... Arrivederci!! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Probably wouldn't stay here again
review: I have just returned from a 4 day stay at the Rivoli Hotel in Florence. The situation was excellent only 5 minutes walk from the bus and railway station. The staff were superb and although very professional were really nice and friendly. The room was of a very high standard and even had it's own library in the bedroom. The breakfast room was lovely and the food offered was superb.This hotel is worthy of 4 stars or even more and would recommend it to anyone who wants a few days of luxury.The weather was very hot and it was great to have a lovely out door court yard where you could eat or just have a drink all day and evening. my personal thanks to Francesca,front of house for her  humour and Sani  from the Bar to mention a few. will certainly return sometime in the future

title: Friendly Rivoli
review: Stayd in two other hotels one in Rome & other in Florence but this one (rivoli) stood out in service . It had a homly feel wad very comfortable and staff spoke excellent english wich is no to common anywhere in Italy. Even room service was full of smiles & cheer. Wouldn't recommend for the wonderful service alone wish I could take the with me to our awaiting Rome hotel .oh & Florence was amazing just go there!

title: Don't leave anything that you cannot afford to loose...
review: We have just returned from a 3 night break in the fabulous city of Florence and stayed at Hotel Rivoli.  The hotel is in a great location, only a few minutes walk from the station, and close to lots of major attractions and good restaurants.  Knowing the location of the hotel in advance, we requested a quiet room overlooking the courtyard and we were not disappointed.  The room was a little on the small side, as was the bathroom, but this did not spoil anything as we had everything we needed.  Everywhere was spotlessly clean.  We ate in the restaurant each day for breakfast which really was excellent.  In addition to the continental fare on offer, staff will cook any additional hot items that you may require for a small additional charge.  We did not eat in the restaurant in the…

title: Fabulous Florence
review: The location is great, a short walk from the train station.  The airport is a 24 Euro trip.  We had a pleasant stay at this hotel until… we went out for supper between 8:00 – 9:30 PM one night.  Someone with access entered our room and stole our iPad, iPod and some cash.  We were the lucky ones.  Two others rooms on the same floor where hit at the same time.  One couple had their valuables (Passports, Money, Travel Documents) locked in the in room safe and someone with access opened the door to the room and unlocked the safe.  We went to file a report to the police (The police will not come to the scene of the crime, you have to go o them).  They refuse to help us stating that we must come back the next day and file a report.  I guess they were to busy smoking their cigarettes…

title: Pretty as a picture!
review: Just got back from Florence and had to write to say how much we enjoyed staying at the Hotel Rivoli. Florence was very busy but the Hotel Rivoli was an oasis of calm- a perfect place to return to after a day seeing the sites. Every aspect of the hotel was perfect and it was clear that a lot of thought had been given to making your stay as easy and comfortable as possible.The building itself was beautiful and the courtyard area over which our balcony looked was really lovely. It was ideally located to explore and enjoy all parts of the city. Our room was spacious with super comfortable beds and every amenity we could possibly need, everyone was friendly and helpful- we could not have asked for more and would return to Florence just for the pleasure of staying here again. Thankyou…

title: Street front ordinary - oasis inside
review: Awesome place. Staff very helpful.   Location was super, room was great overlooking garden, A/C worked perfectly.  Small pool and jacuzzi fit in perfectly with the surroundings.  Breakfast was great;  eating area In the garden was pretty.  Also provided a pretty setting for having a cocktail before dinner.

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: Easy to find if you have clear directions as it is close to the central station, and of course close to all the sights. Reception was excellent and the room we were given had everything you would expect from a 3 star hotel. Buffet Breakfast had a good variety of food and no problem with quality or quantity. This same area is actually the in-house Restaurant......you really haven't eaten 'Italian' until you have eaten here - the food was superb and the waiter was exuberant - we loved him with his friendly and enthusiastic demeaner. Not only did he ask to 'escort' my wife outside to show her the wonderful garden and jacuzzi but he also was more than happy to supply recipes for some of the delicious food we enjoyed and with some dishes he was prepared to 'stake his reputation' on…

title: Valet parking great service!
review: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights for business in Florence. Nice room, well cleaned, small pool that can give some refreshment during the summer, fair breakfast and great localization.  Two comments that I would like to do: 1 - The room has a lot of modern features (digital air condition, electronic key, wireless internet and etc) but the TV is a very old model (90's decade) 2 - The hotel looks like was refurbished very recently but the piping makes a lot of noise when other rooms are using the water or toilet

title: Great Place to Stay
review: 12 April. An old monastery converted into hotel. Really lovely. Spacious rooms and lovely and warm. Very helpful staff as I could not get my wifi working! Did not eat there as we were busy out walking around the city. A wonderful building. Very economical. Would go there again. Close to train which we were catching the next day - oldies don't walk fast!

title: Excellent hotel
review: I spent three nights here in May.  Our room was actually two rooms, one was a tv/sitting room even though we had a tv in the bedroom.  The hotel is really beautiful.  It's just around the corner from the train station.  We walked to it.  Close to the river.  Quiet at night.  Great breakfast.  Nice employees.  The only complaint I had was you have to pay for the internet.  But you don't need to.  Just go across the street to the wonderful (and very popular with the locals) restaurant...they have free internet.  Definitely would stay here again.  And the jacuzzi/pool was delight to come homoe to and relax each evening.

title: hotel with charm
review: Dear Client,  thank you for your nice comment on us! We really appreciate your words that will be passed also to the rest of the staff! Concerning the internet fees, at the moment we are "forced" to have that little charge since we had a contract with a provider company that had this kind of Policy. I'm glad to inform you that in the next future we closed that contract and wer will be able to give it for free to our guests. Hoping that you will want to try this opportunity in the next future, from all of us, once again thank you and Arrivederci! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great hotel and location
review: I quite enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was a 2 to 3 minute walk from the train station. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Fridge in room. Wifi was 5 euros for 24 hours. Walking distance to most of the attractions and shops. An excellent restaurant across the street where I end up eating 3 times because the food was soo good. Breakfast buffet was ok with the standard continental breakfast items. I will definately return to this hotel.

title: Great location in Florence
review: We were traveling by train from Rome and wanted a hotel near the station, but not too far from the old city center.  This hotel fulfilled all our needs during our two night stay (May 10 and 11).  The walk from the train station (pulling luggage) took ten minutes and we easily walked to and from all sites both days.  The exterior of the hotel is deceiving.  We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the hotel.  We had requested a room with balcony, so our room overlooked the interior gardens from a balcony with a small table and chairs.  The room size was average, but there was a small seating area immediately inside the door which made it seem larger.  The bath was very small.  All staff were friendly and very accomodating.  Breakfast was included in our room rate and…

title: Lovely stay at Hotel Rivoli
review: Incredibly helpful staff. Room was quiet and comfortable. Great location to see all the tourist attractions in Florence. Everything was within walking distance. Superb breakfast.

title: Excellent service, great location
review: Having spent ages trying to pick a hotel in Florence I eventually picked the Hotel Rivoli and I'm glad I did. We spent 4 nights there and got a good rate through the hotel's own website. It's on a busy street less than 5 minutes walk from the SMN railway station. Our room was at the back so we didn't hear any street noise. There are lots of little convenience stores, restaurants and gelaterias very near to the hotel and it's an easy 5 - 10 min walk to all the main tourist sights. As my husband was attending a conference each day, I walked all over Florence on my own  and never felt unsafe. Our room was very clean and bright with a comfortable bed (2 singles pushed together), nice bed linen, safe, minibar etc. Bathroom just had a shower (no bath), which had a narrow  shower door.…

title: Not a nice reception !
review: Chose the Hotel Rivoli online because we had had good experience with other Best Westerns in Europe.  We were not dissappointed.  From the moment we entered, the hustle & bustle of the city disappeared.  The staff was very helpful, the common areas superb.  The in house restaurant Benedicta prepared a lovely breakfast and we also had dinner here one night. Rooms were clean & comfortable.  And the location was perfect, walking distance to everything.

title: Hotel Rivoli Florence Great Experience
review: Searched for a long time to find the right hotel in Florence.  I am never that impressed with Italian hotel generally but this one was different.  The hotels character shines from the moment you walk in. We were greeted by friendly staff and a reception with great character.  Our rooms were of all shapes and sizes but this only added to the hotels charm. Breakfast was well organized, staff served cappuccino coffees and were very attentive.  We all enjoyed a long soak in the jaccuzzi after a long days walking and sightseeing.  If I had to find something to complain about then our bathroom was very small, but it was only our one as the rest of our party had a reasonably large one.  Not keen on the white wood flooring either but I'm nit-picking now.

title: Great hotel in central location
review: Staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Beautiful hotel with great common areas both inside and out.  Hotel restaurant Benedicta was very good for both breakfast and dinner.  Location of hotel is perfect.  A block away from bus and train station close to Santa Maria Novella but within 10 minute walk of central Florence.

title: Great place to stay, Very helpful!
review: Dear Guest,  thank you for leaving your comments on TA and sharing your experience with thousands of "clients". I printed out your comment and show it to all my collegues; all of us would like to thank you for your nice words. I hope to welcome you once again at the Rivoli and just say Arrivederci! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Friendly staff and good location.
review: I have just spent 2 nights at this hotel in a triple room with some girlfriends. The hotel is ideally located within walking distance to the station and the town. Rooms clean staff friendly and helpful. We did not eat at the hotel just breakfast which was fine. The gallery's get very busy so we never managed them but saw plenty walking. Would stay here again good value for money.

title: Convenient, affordable,friendly

title: Excellent location and good service
review: Our stay at the Hotel Rivoli was absolutely delightful.  The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant staff was most polite, offered quick service and a very nice buffet breakfast included in the affordable room price.  One other important feature of the Hotel Rivoli is it's close proximity to the train station.....just a few short minutes walk.  This is a huge benefit when you are pulling luggage around behind you on cobblestone streets, on and off the train and no wait for a taxi.  We were at the hotel, checked in, settled in our room within ten minutes of arriving at the train station. This hotel has history and charm.  We were offered a lovely room upgrade at no cost to us.  Our pristine room had a balcony, marble bath, windows that opened which were…

title: Convenient to transportation
review: We stayed in a doube room for two nights with breakfast. The location is great, literally 5 min away from the station and 3 min from the city centre. The breakfast was really nice and the service was great. Very pleased with everything they provided.

title: All good with Hotel Rivoli BW - excellent location
review: Dear Guest, Thanks for spending your time sending your opinion with us! I will share it with all my collegues that for shure will be more than happy to see that our efforts in making your stay, a nice stay in Florence found your approval!  Hoping to welcome you once again at the Rivoli, best regards and Arrivederci! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Great location
review: Located 3 minutes walk to the station.  I stayed in a single room on the first floor which was a bit pokey, especially the bathroom where I knocked the phone off the wall a couple of times.  The room was a little dim and noisy.  Breakfast spread in the hotel is good.  Check in was efficient.  Great bartender in the lobby bar, very friendly and adds personality to the place.  Overall, its a reasonable hotel where street noise is not heard, however, the surrounding location is a bit tacky.  Excellent restaurant attached.

title: EXCELLENT hotel for families with children!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location, average hotel
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Rivoli. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast, amenities, and location were great. And the room was HUGE by European standards! The bathroom ALONE was bigger than most other European hotel rooms we have stayed in!  We had a family suite, with a kids' package that included a Wii, games, and a children's touring/history guide of Florence. This hotel was an EXCELLENT value for the money!

title: Ideal hotel and location
review: We stayed for 5 nights at the Hotel Rivoli in late February 2012 and while the central location was fantastic for exploring Florence on foot, the accommodation was average. The room we were in was in need of a refurb / refresh and was a strange shape but it did look over the hotel courtyard which made it relatively quiet. The staff were friendly enough but not exceptional and spoke excellent English. I'm pretty sure the hotel towels are pink and blue (his and hers) because they've been dyed those colours from their original white to get some extra life out of them. Breakfast had all the usual buffet trappings and was ok. Next time I'm going to try and spend a little more to try and find a neater, fresher hotel.

title: Would return to Florence just to stay at this hotel!
review: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was excellent for comfort cleanliness, polite staff and delicious food.  We booked thru Travel Republic and we flet that the exceptional rates for B&B were good value considering the high standards of the hotels.  The public rooms were tastefully decorated and furnished and overall the hotel could set an example to some British ones how a hotel should be run.  Nothing was too  much trouble and all staff spoke English - can highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Florence - close to shops, city and stations, yet in a quiet location.  Perfect!

title: Great location and great value
review: This was all one could ask for in a hotel in Europe.  The location was perfect - convenient to everything but not in a congested or noisy area.  The room - two double beds - was clean, large, and comfortable.  Temperature in the room with a/c was perfect.  Loved the huge walk-in closet with a safe; the bathroom was unbelievable for any hotel, but especially one in Europe.  Hotel personnel were friendly and helpful.  The complimentary breakfast was served in a large, light, comfortable area and the array of food choices was fantastic.  Servers were friendly and helpful.  Overall, one of the most comfortable hotel stays we've ever had in Europe.  Highly recommended.

title: Excellent choice
review: We have just arrived back from a three night stay at Hotel Rivoli. From the time we arrived it was absolutely stress free. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the station - having got the shuttle bus from the airport for 5 euros which drops you off here. Really nice warm welcome from the staff and really lovely room given with a small terrace overlooking the internal courtyard. There was adequate heating too, as our trip coincided with the extreme cold weather across Europe. As has been said in previous reviews, the hotel is 5-10 minutes from all the main attractions and shops. It makes it so much easier especially when you are not staying for that long. Breakfast in the hotel was really good, all nice and fresh and the welcome from breakfast staff was very cheerful without being…

title: The hotel is consistent with the level of 4 *
review: Our stay in Hotel Rivoli BW was a very pleasant one!If I could quickly summarize the strong points of the Hotel: -Friendly staff -Very good position, just 5 minutes from the train station (SMN) and 5-10 minutes from the main attractions of the centre (i.e. Duomo). -Fantastic restaurant! If you're staying here - give it a try. The decoration/style/furniture looks a bit old but it doesn't make a bad impression, it is...romantic in a way. I have to say that I didn't like the pillows (bit hard for me) but that's a minor.

title: Kudos to Central Holiday Northern Highlights Italy
review: The hotel is consistent with the level of 4 *. Great location, huge by Italian standards, number (303). Windows closed street noise almost inaudible, but the internal soundproofing is poor. Breakfast is even anything other than the usual continental delights there are eggs, scrambled eggs, sausage, fried bacon. Black coffee so-so, but if you order a cappuccino, then we can drink. Staff at the reception is not very friendly, but his work does well. Maybe this is a plus - do not shake hands 20 times a day. Plumbing normal, with no surprises. Cleaning quality. Change of linen daily.

title: A true Italian masterpiece
review: OCT 2011  , Three  senior couples  had great visit to Italy. The tour director Annik and bus driver Luciano  took excellent care of our Family of  Six. The hotels were very good in Venice, Florence and in Rome. All centrally located with super buffet breakfasts. The tour guides in Venice , and Florence and Rome, were very very good. The dinners provided and the suggestions by Annik ,  top notch. The Vatican  however should be ashamed of the lack of crowd control in the Sistine Chapel. All of the couples agreed that this trip was a great value, and highly recommend Central Holidays, Thank You   , George A.

title: Group of 6 Americans- two Rms, bfast included, good Location, 4/2010

title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
review: Family vacation (kids ages 23-28 And 2 older parents). Stayed in 1 rm of 4 young adults- got a two room suite type with 2 flip beds and 1 queen. Big for a European hotel room.  Breakfast is decent w several buffet items. Cappuccinos and coffee are served quick. Leave coins for a tip if pleased.  Courtyard was cool and the open room on the side was a place to hang w a bottle of wine at 5/6pm after a long day of sightseeing and to recoup before a big Tuscan dinner.  Location is 3 blocks from the train so not bad rolling the suitcases from there (careful at the corner). There is a nice courtyard with a decent gelateria at the end of the block. The duermo is very very close!!!! Shopping the streets is like 1/4 mile.

title: Fantastic service staff
review: Stayed here for 3 nights in December 2011 and couldn't fault the place. Rooms were beautifully decorated, clean and comfortable. Staff from front desk to bar to kitchen were very courteous and helpful. Great breakfast. Hotel is close to station and about a 10 minute walk to the shopping areas. Would definitely stay here again.

title: A ideal location for a stay in Florence
review: I'll start with what we loved about the hotel - the staff. I couldn't fault any of them, from the bell hop to the kitchen hands. The kitChen staff even remembered our drink orders and room number, which  liked. The front desk staff were so accommodating with requests and it made our stay very comfortable. We even lounged at the lobby for a few hours waiting for our train.   The hotel location is very suitable for train travellers and the room we had at 219 was large, clean and the bed was comfortable. Didn't have a view though.   I would come back here.

title: Beyond the call...
review: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights whilst we visited Florence as tourists. Its location makes it a perfect place for walking to all the main sites in the city and it is also an easy stroll to the main railway station if you have come from Pisa airport. The staff were, without exception, very professional and friendly and our room was large and very clean and comfortable. We could find no fault at all and will certainly return. It is worth, however, paying extra for a room overlooking the courtyard as the Via della Scala at the front of the hotel is very busy: our room was perfectly quiet.

title: Pleasant Surprise
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: A quite hotel in the heart of Florence
review: What a nice surprise this hotel turned out to be!  Within walking distance from the train station and Santa Maria Novella Square.  Also not a bad walk to the Ponte de Vecchio bridge and other attractions. After much walking during the day it was nice to be able to come back to the hotel and relax in the courtyard or the jacuzzi for awhile!    Fabulous staff, especially Sans, the bartender!  Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Sweet suite for a night
review: Having stayed at many different hotels in Florence over the years the Ravoli Hotel came as a nice surprize. 100yards from the Santa Maria Novella Square its location is excellent. Many types of rooms all set in an old Monastry make this hotel a pleasant surprize. You may have to really look to get the right room as some are not up to standard but there are some lovely rooms with small terraces overlooking a charming courtyard. Service in general is very good with attentive staff always ready to assist with everything you may require. Great resturant is located within the hotel, again with a great setting for outside dinning. The key to this hotel is get the right room.

title: Great staff, great location
review: As fate would have it, our originally booked hotel room was not available so we were comped a nights stay at Hotel Rivoli... lucky us!  The lobby was clean and staff friendly and helpful when we arrived.  Our room was an upgrade from what we booked, so we were happy.  There was a lot of closet space and drawers to unpack.  The bathroom was quite large and equipped with all the amenities we needed (blue towels for him, pink for her).  A comfortable bed and heavy curtains to block out the light and heat were an added bonus.  In the morning, the breakfast was tasty and offered many options to start the day off right.  Truth is, we wanted to cancel our other hotel reservation and stay put at the Hotel Rivoli.  The location was nice, close to the train station, and not too far from…

title: Breakfast in the garden
review: Apart from being embarrassed when we arrived in a taxi from the station (didn't realize it was so close and that we could have walked) this hotel was great value and great to stay at.  All the staff and particularly Ermalinda on the front desk went out of their way to be helpful, nothing too much trouble for anyone.   While not exactly in the centre of Florence it is an easy walk to anywhere in the  city (we stayed in mid September so it wasnt too hot).  Our room had a balcony overlooking the pool/spa area which was a bonus. The hotel has great relaxing areas on ground level and is attached to an excellent restaurant (benedicta) Our only negatives we experienced  were that in common with most hotels we stayed at in Italy the lifts were very small and I have never been a fan of a…

title: Could be ranked higher
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great hotel, not a very central location
review: We stayed here Sept 1st for 3 nights. Pros:  Close to train station, easy walk so you don't have to usa a taxi. Location is fair, most of the main sites are within walking distance. Room was decent size, nice bathroom. Service was very good, thanks to Daniele for helping arrange a day trip to the Tuscany area which was the hilite of our entire trip. Definetly go visit this magnificent area....we ate lunch at a small winery in the Chianti region and it was awesome. The 4 of us were able to get a private van and driver for about the same price you spent on one of the large buses. Jacuzzi pool and spray mist from above in courtyard a nice touch.  Cons:  Daily charge for Wifi....should not be a charge for this service. Carpets very worn in some of the public areas. Breakfast was not…

title: Pleasant stay, good location
review: This hotel was lovely, quaint and charming. The room was large, especially by Italian standards. The hotel also had a small jacuzzi which was a welcome relief during the hot August afternoons! Nice modern bathroom and very clean and well decorated rooms. Our room overlooked the courtyard where the jacuzzi was and it was lovely. Breakfast spread was superb, one of the best we had on our Italian trip.  The only problem with the hotel was its location. Now, Florence is small enough that irrespective of where you are, you can pretty much walk the entire city without needing to use taxis or other transport. We were under the impression that being near the railway station (where this hotel is located) would keep us pretty much in the city center. However, that isn't entirely true. It…

title: Great location, great room, nice hotel restaurant
review: I stayed at Hotel Rivoli for three nights, and was very happy there. The location was awesome, really central to everything and my room was large and nicely decorated. The tv was a bit old but I guess you are not there to watch TV! The staff at the front desk were friendly enough and professional. I had booked in for two nights, but they were fine with me extending my stay for another night. Breakfast was great, lots of choice and a really nice out door courtyard that you could eat in.  You do have to pay €5 for a 24hour access card to use their wifi, where a lot of other hotels I've stayed in during my European trip provided it for free, but otherwise I was really happy with my time there.

title: Best European Hotel!
review: The location couldn't be beat for this hotel - in the inner city historice zone well within walking distance to all the major sites.  Only caveat is if you're driving, figure out your route (GPS?) before getting there.  It took us a long time going back and forth on narrow one-way streets before we happened onto the hotel, even though we could see exactly where it was on a map!  Aside from that, the hotel was great.  Our first night we went to the outdoor courtyard restaurant which was almost magical.  This hotel also has a large "hot tub" which actually is more like a small swimming pool as the temperature was on the cool side; it was still nice for a refreshing dip though at the end of a travel or touring day.  I would definitely stay here again if I was ever in Florence again.
