title: convenient hotel in Florence
review: Reasonable hotel.  Room was clean and a double was fairly spacious from the European standard.  Front desk service was okay, not extra warm but competent.  Everything in the room works, including the air conditioning, which was quiet and held the temperature fairly constant.  In-room safe big enough for a laptop and a small fridge with mini-bar.  TV was old and hard to figure out the channels.  The bathroom was on the small side and the shower was a bit strange with doors on two sides and was a little hard to keep water from going out and flooding the floor. Service in breakfast was very nice and the food was acceptable.  It was not cheap but probably because I stayed there for a conference that drove up the price.  Location was convenient for the conference and very close to…

title: 4 Plus Stars!
review: Dear Guest,  thank you for sharing your experience with so many other review readers.  I'm really glad to see that you pointed out your impressions, as we try to give always a good service to our clients and on this matter I will not miss to ask my collegues at the Reception to be a little bit "warmer". Concerning TV we still have som old ones, but we are changing all of them with the new Flat screen TV. Thank you for giving us the chance of improving ourselves and hoping to welcome you once again at the Rivoli.... I just say Arrivederci! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Nice hotel in a good location
review: This hotel was very conveniently located close the the train station and all sites.  The staff was very helpful and the room very large and comfortable. Excellent restaurant on site.  Breakfast buffet was OK.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this location and appreciated the helpful arrangements made by the front staff with booking the gallery tickets and private driver.

title: Lovely
review: Dear Guest,  thank you for your nice review. It's always a pleasure for us to know that we satisfied your expectation.  We all try to do our best to let our clients feel welcome in our house and assist them during their stay.  Hoping to welcome you in your next visit in Florence, from all the staff and from me just...GRAZIE!  Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Would definitely Recommend
review: We were impressed by this hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious as was the lobby and common areas. Great graden terrace. Breakfast was wonderful. Near to the train station and close by to most attractions. But the customer service is what we liked the best. Always with a smile and above and beyond service.

title: Very distinguished hotel
review: Dear Guest, thaks for the nice review you left here!  We are so glad to see that you apprecieted our job and hope to see you again at the Rivoli. Arrivederci! Daniele Torrini Ass. Manager

title: Lovely!  Would stay again.
review: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of July. It's located a couple of minutes from the train station, about 5-10 minutes from the Duomo and approx 5-10 minutes from Ponte Vecchio.  All staff we met were polite and helpful, rooms and communal areas were spotlessly clean and well presented. Rooms were a decent size and the jacuzzi and garden bar (open 3pm -9pm) were a certainly welcome facility at the end of a long day sight seeing.  Breakfast was good - cold meats, cheese, bread, pastries bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, cereal and yogurts - so there is something for everyone! The breakfast staff I thought were particularly good - always cheerful, quick to fetch coffee and they worked extremely hard.  Overall, an excellent hotel and I would definitely stay there again if I went…

title: Pleased with this hotel!
review: The hotel is located in the city center, close to most of Florence attractions, built in the ancient times and still conserve its elegance, rooms are very wide, although it was a standard room, yet we felt it's a junior suite. Breakfast was diversified with excellent service. Receptionists were very helpful. Really loved it and wish to be back there again.

title: Slightly Tired, but well located.
review: Located just very close to Santa Maria Novella Station ( just one block away) which was perfect hauling luggarge was not far to walk.  The street appeal was very ordinary, but the hotel was not.  Huge community areas and lounges.  With a jaccuzie pool out back which was great. (rare in Florence) to cool off after sightseeing all day.  The rooms were reasonalbe sized and we had a large back balcony with table and chairs..  Room had air conditioning that was really cold, beds great and had a fridge.  Spotlessly clean and bright decor.Breakfast was wonderfull with great selection and included in the price and was located in a courtyard or inside.  The staff here did a great job and were a credit to the hotel.  This location is very close to the sights and the duome catherdral and…

title: You get what you pay for - basic!
review: Dear Guest, thank you for spendig a little of your time for share your experience at the RIVOLI with so many other people. We try to do our best every day to satisfy our guests and believe me, it is always a pleasure to have a positive feed back. Thank you once again and hoping to welcome you again, I just say ARRIVEDERCI from the Staff and the Managemet of the Rivoli

title: You get what you pay for, which wasn't much
review: As with all Best Western Hotels, this is a hotel that later took on the name of Best Western in order to help compete with the throngs of other hotels.  It is very well located - few blocks from the train station, about 6 blocks from the main square and 4 blocks from the river.  Features a courtyard spa/pool (not spa and pool, but a spa-pool".  Free breakfast.  Really the only thing that made it feel tired was the older carpet and with that and the front desk staff that wasn't too friendly, prevented this, even with it's great location, from being higher rated.  Keep in mind that this is not a 5-star hotel - and thus my rating is for those hotels within the same category.  I booked this hotel on Hotels.com, which made it easy.  Room was a good size (Jr. Suite) with a courtyard…

title: Good Location but room is a bit tired
review: Throughout our stay, staff were pleasant & helpful, no complaints on that front. The rooms were basic, bed & shower. Decor is dated & carpet needs a good clean, everything was functional though. Florence itself is small so location wad easily accessible to station & major sights with no issue. Negative was the 5-6 visible bed bug bites I received. Pillows need to be replaced also, they are old & flat.

title: We'd definately stay here again & would recomend to friends
review: We stayed here for a night got the suite for 275 Euros, for 4 people with breakfest.  Its a nice hotel, good breakfest and clean. Value for money is not the best but in Florence everything is wayyyyy overpriced and choices are limited.  There was construction on the street so we were woken up early, but overall we would recommend this to friends.

title: Very Good
review: The hotel was very well located, close to the train station and all the sights were within easy walking distance. As someone else has already said don't judge the hotel from the outside. Inside the hotel has pleasant and relaxing public lounges and also has internal courtyards, one for bar/seating with one adjoining with jacuzzi/seating and another for restaurant/breakfast; the courtyards were peaceful and relaxing and really made the hotel special. We had dinner at the hotel one night which was excellent and well worth it. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Top tip - ask for an internal room overlooking the inner courtyards, our room even had a large balcony which was lovely to relax on.

title: my opinion is that is expensive for what you get
review: I stayed in this hotel two weeks ago after following my parent’s advice and I can confirm that it was worth! The hotel is very nice: even if it is an old building, bedrooms are renovated and modern. The staff is very friendly and breakfast is good (not exceptional but good). It is not a cheap hotel but in Florence nothing is cheap. In my opinion the best quality in this hotel is its position: it is very central! You can go everywhere by foot and enjoy the best of Florence. My husband and I went to Florence by car and, even if the hotel is in a limited traffic zone, there was no problem with parking (the hotel have a “deal” with a private car parking - € 21.00 a day). I would recommend this hotel for everybody (because I certainly would return).

title: Great hotel in the heart of Florence!!
review: Rivoli is located 10-15 min walk from down town center, it is in old house which is reorganized in hotel. Rooms are adequate size but furniture is a bit old and carpenter is aged. Bathroom is too small for two people. We had room on back side, and this side is quite but there no view at all. Breakfast is too simple for four star hotel, two kinds of salami, scrambled and cook eggs, small sausages and fried bacon, cereals and fruits, donates and croissant and that is almost all. Public spaces are really nice with beautiful antique furniture. They have a deal with public garage for 21 euros per day, which is ok price for Florence but every time when you take car you have to pay to driver extra 5 euros. I do not recommend Rivoli hotel because my opinion is that is expensive for what…

title: Rivoli Revealed
review: Conveniently located within walking distance of museums and sights.  A1 service from staff. Lovely room overlooking the garden, we enjoyed the balmy spring weather. Should we return to Florence, we shall certainly make it a point to stay at the Hotel Rivoli !

title: A great hotel in a great location
review: With out knowing that the Hotel Rivoli was sited as one of the best by Trip Advisor, we chose it for its location in Florence Italy. It lived up to its advertising. Like most of Florence, the hotel is on a narrow street about a block and a half from the train station Santa Maria Novella. Since we were taking three day trips by train this was a must. It turned out that it was only 3 or 4 blocks ( short blocks) from the Piazza di Repuiblica which is a wonderful gathering spot and also a block from the Duomo. We discovered that we were in close proximity to everything. The hotel itself was marvelous. The rooms were good size, great bathrooms and the staff were wonderful. Breakfast was included( buffet with scrambled eggs, bacon and more), was delicious and we didn't have to go…

title: Decidedly Average Hotel
review: This is a charming hotel in a really excellent location - situated close to both the mainline station and the beautiful church of Santa Maria Novella.  It is only a 10-15 minute walk to all the key visitor attractions in Florence, ie the Uffizi, the Ponte Vecchio, Accademia Gallery etc.  The hotel itself is beautifully presented with an elegant lounge, bar, very smart restaurant and shady courtyards.  The weather wasn't warm enough while we were there to sit out and eat breakfast, but I imagine that this would be really lovely in the summer.  The staff, without exception, were professional, helpful and friendly.  The reception staff were willing to help us with our many trivial requests and questions.  The waiters and waitresses in the restaurant were efficient and exceptionally…

title: Great location, staff & bang for your buck
review: Future patrons should be aware that the Hotel Rivoli strictly adheres to the 'apparent' Italian Law that no hotel 'needs' to turn on it's air conditioning until the 14th of April. Any implorement you wish to make to attempt to have it turned on any early, even if your room is at 23 degrees at 2 in the morning on the 11th of April, will require you and several other patrons to be down in reception, in your jammies, having a heated discussion with the night staff. GOOD LUCK Also, the hydro pool is closed at the drop of a hat as well...

title: Disappointing 3 star hotel - Avoid if you expect 4 star quality
review: If we're fortunate to return to Florence, we won't bother looking for any other place to stay. This hotel has gracious, accommodating service, nice-looking and spacious public areas, and clean, large rooms. The age & history of the building lends a ton of charm, but the rooms and baths are bright, modern, and roomy. They offer pink & blue his/hers towels which offer a nice touch, and their front desk service is friendly, professional and knowledgable.

title: My beloved Firenze
review: Our rooms were noisy, the carpet was worn and stained, the walls were worn and stained, the sink did not drain, the pillows and bed were hard, and most importantly, the property web site portrays the place as a modern, quiet 4 star hotel. We left and they refused to refund our prepayment.

title: Excellent quality, beautiful charming Hotel
review: Just can't express enough for the wonderful memories staying at the Best Western Rivoli. As a repeated customer who returns to Florence over 5 times, BW Rivoli will be be my only choice. The front desk staffs, all of them are very helpful. Ms.Francesca, the front desk staff is a true gem to the travellers, very helpful and knowledgable getting all my needs before my arrival . The hotel is clean, very conveniently located. Being in Florence I will stay nowhere except at this BW Rivoli.

title: Just perfect
review: Stayed here with teenagers during our visit to Florence. Requested a family room, and got a very large beautiful room. Modern furnishings, very clean. The hotel is a former small palace and has some beautiflul architectural features. Lovely outdoor courtyard for morning coffee or evening drinks. Great breakfast buffet. Staff very helpful, polite and knowledgeable. Front desk personnel helped us arrange an excellent tour of Florence that we all enjoyed. About  eight to ten minutes walk to the train station and a very convenient 10-15 minute walk into the city center. Really lovely charming Hotel. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Hotel, good location, staff was helpful.
review: Positives: This is truly a nice hotel, really close to the train station and just a walk away from all major attractions. Breakfast was great, room size was decent, it was clean and cosy. Staff personnel was really nice beside the reception lot which were a bit stuck up for my taste (not too sure if it is in their own interest being so overly conceited)  Negatives: We have been given a room by the main street which at first was not a problem but it turned into a bit of a nuisance in the evening as the windows are really thin and old. First of all  we could hear the revellers from a close by pub/bar chatting really loud untill well past 1 o' clock. Then at about 6 AM the street cleaning cars suddenly woke us up and from then on we could not get back to sleep as we could hear…

title: Not bad, Not Great
review: We had a total of three rooms- 1 with a queen bed, decent amount of space, very bright room with a large window, very small clean updated bathroom, 1 room with twin beds had a lot of space and a large new clean bathroom, large window with sunlight all day, my room was a small twin no room to spare, dark room that overlooked a small court yard that was shaded, bathroom was large, new and clean.  Rooms were quiet, however once a night above one of the rooms there seemed to be a lot of activity around midnight. Not sure if it was a quest room or a hotel staff room. Staff was very helpful, nothing seemed to be out of their realm of experience, we asked questions about many things related to our stay, and our questions were answered with smiles and grace. The desk arranged for a…

title: Great location, friendly and helpful staff.
review: Some of the staff were nicer, some not so helpful.  The room was a nice size the decor needs to be updated. The bathroom was very small. When I asked about this at the front desk, they said that since the hotel was a converted convent, every room and bathroom was different. When I asked about getting a king or queen sized bed for my wife and I, they lied and said that all rooms had only twin beds. I later saw a room with a king sized bed and inquired again. I was then told that 2 rooms in the hotel did have king sized beds.   The free buffet was generous but the hot food (scrambled eggs, etc.) were cold all 5 mornings of my stay.  All the other hotels that I stayed in, in Italy, provided free WiFi for their guests. This hotel charges 5 euros per day.

title: Nice hotel, convenient location
review: The Rivoli was a nice hotel in a very good location - central and close to shopping, restaurants, sites and the train station.  The staff were extremely friendly and quite helpful.  The included breakfast was primarily processed and packaged food, but sufficed.  The rooms were relatively large for a European hotel, but were a little dark due to the window dressings and lack of direct sunlight.  If you are leaving early in the morning, ask for a boxed breakfast.

title: Average
review: This hotel is easy walking distance from the train station and boasts beautiful courtyards in the center of the hotel. It seemed to me that every room had a view. The room was very large with a private sleeping area for our son. We did hear several late night party-goers in the hall but that could have been due to the festive time of year (12/24). Staff incredibly accommodating and cheerful, room very clean with large closet for storage. While it seems to be on the edge of the 'touristy' part of town, we loved the location and found it easy to walk to museums, shopping, and restaurants.

title: Couldn't be more pleased!
review: everything about this hotel was average. the location was ok. a short walk to the train station and the main area for bus tours...

title: no problems.... all good
review: We spent 4 days at Hotel Rivoli.  It was an absolutely perfect base for seeing Florence.  The location is ideal:  one block from  Santa Maria Novella church, close to the train and bus terminals and walking distance to all the important sights.  We never needed a bus or taxi.  If you reserve early enough you may be able to snatch a promotion like we did which gave us an upgrade to a superior room for  the price of a classic room.  Our lovely large room was more like a suite with a sitting room separate from the sleeping area (see photos).  We requested a room facing the garden, and our room was totally quiet.  All the personnel were most pleasant and helpful, especially Francesca at the front desk.  The breakfast (included) was outstanding:  choice of juices, coffee, capuccino,…

title: Convenient location for walking, car rental
review: close to santa maria... small city so can walk everywhere easily... simple but clean hotel, good breakfast, lots of towels in rooms, little garden, good breakfast... all good

title: Excellent location, friendly staff and...
review: Our two hotels in Venice and Rome (Ca Vendramin and Hotel Canada respectively) were cheaper and much nicer than this one in Florence - proving you don't have to settle for mediocrity in Italy.  The Rivoli is okay but after the above it was a disappointing final 4-night stop.  Service is indifferent.  While our room was of a pretty good size, it was very dated (get rid of the carpet and change to tile for a start!).  Hotel is pretty good location near the station and clean.  Everything is so close in Florence.  Breakfast was 'okay' but we were spoiled elsewhere too.  The restaurant is cute with lovely terrace but they do nothing to promote it to hotel guests or outsiders which is really strange.  We paid more than we should have for what we got.  If you get a really good rate, it…

title: Just what we needed in Florence
review: Excellent location, friendly staff and rooms are of a good standard. Hotel has nice courtyards including a large jucuzzi. Recommended.

title: Do not Judge a book by its cover
review: We stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel Rivoli in Florence and for us it was perfect. We flew into Pisa and arrived in Florence by train. The hotel is a very short walk from the train station.  At first the street it is on looked a little boring but soon realized it is a nice quiet place to sleep. The room was very comfy - ours looked over the court yard and I had asked for a room with a balcony.   We had a small fridge (mini bar) that we stacked with food, snacks and cold drinks which was really handy when we came back to the hotel to relax. The front desk also gave us a kettle so we could make tea and coffee in the morning.  We had breakfast included. There was plenty to chose from - eggs, cheese, cereal, meats, breads and cakes. This would fill us up until lunch.  All the staff…

title: Charming Hotel
review: We have stayed here numerous times and found this to be our favourite hotel in Florence. It is in a great location, just minutes from the train station and tucked away from the hordes around the Doumo, yet the main sites are just a ten minute walk. The hotel looks non descript from the outside, but when you get past the lobby, the courtyard and garden surprises. The breakfast room and courtyard are where you can have breakfast or have an excellent supper. Try to get a room at the back of the hotel and away from the main street. The only restless night we had a few years ago was when we were placed there. All in all, this is our favourite hotel in Florence. The room rates vary, so do some research before booking. The hotel staff were also very helpful when we booked advance…

title: Should have 5 stars - absolutely wonderful - highly recommend

title: Lot of bang for the buck
review: We were on the 2nd hotel of 3 week trip (Rome, Venice, Florence & Lake Garda), we arrived via train, private transfer from station to hotel. In fact, so convenient for the station that the transfer wasn't necessary. The outside of this hotel gives one no indication of delights within. Step through the doors into a charming cool & beamed ceiling enclave to be met by the highly professional, unflappable, calm & extremely friendly and smiling Francesca. We had two rooms for 4 nights, ours was comfortable, good sized and had the wonderful advantage of balcony with table & chairs overlooking the courtyard - what a delight - so pretty and a lot of trouble taken to make this a very special place to be. I can't speak too highly of the extremely high quality of the staff, elegant service…

title: Beautiful Hotel in Beautiful City, Will Return
review: Great value, the rooms were large, bathrooms beautiful and the amenities and public spaces lovely, especially liked the garden for breakfast and the hot tub for relaxing after a long day of sight seeing...staff was a bit stuffy...great location near  train station.

title: Friendliest breakfast staff you will ever meet!
review: Hotel Rivoli in Florence, Italy is one of the best Hotels I have stayed at in over 40 years of traveling.  Giani, the manager and owner of the hotel, is always available to help with special requests and the staff is among the most hospitable and accomodating I have ever encountered.  The Hotel is very nicely appointed, extremely comfortable with a morning breakfast that is again the best I have been offered in my extensive travels.  Hotel Rivoli is always cool which is most important for July travelers and very very clean.  The location is excellent as you are within 5 minutes walk from the central train and bus station.  The neighborhood is safe and interesting with Santa Maria Novella only half a block away from the hotel not to mention one of the best Gelaterias in Florence.…

title: wonderful from start to finish
review: The hotel was just outside the center of Florence aka the Duomo. The room was spacious with A/C, a balcony, an awesome shower with jets on the wall (not all rooms), and the bed was pretty good. You could get internet access for 24 hours for 5 euros. The breakfast staff was incredible. They made the start of our day so bright and cheerful. The breakfast spread was also really good. We thought the price of the hotel was a little high, but after staying in a three star you can definitely see the difference.  Also there is a restaurant attached to the hotel and they give hotel guests 10% off, but we never ate there.

title: great hotel w/ many amenities
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good hotel in a great location for the price.
review: Our room was great here, it was large (as was the bathroom) had cable, free internet & computer downstairs as well as breakfast! Couldntt ask for more...

title: Brilliant little hotel, very well located for Florence SMN station
review: Hotel was in a great location, near train station and within walking distance to all historical sites in Florence.  There are plenty of good inexpensive restaurants near hotel, as well as a laundry mat across the street.  The staff was helpful, the hotel had great internet service, and the breakfast was very good.  If you like the nightlife, this might not be the hotel for you, as some could think the street a little seedy.  Since I was traveling with my daughter, we were out of the hotel during the day, and usually had a late dinner near the hotel, and were back in our room by 10 or so.  The hotel was run down in areas, but the rooms were adequate, the air conditioning worked, and it was perfect for us.  I would recommend this hotel to friends for the price, location, and…

title: Great place to stay
review: This hotel was easy to find when we got out of the station (direct train from Pisa Airport), the staff made us feel welcome and were very efficient in checking-in and out as well as the staff at breakfast who were superb and incredibly hard working.  The rooms and decor of the hotel was looking a bit dated, but I suppose in some way added to the charm.  I think also the Jacuzzi was probably also in need of a service as the water jets didn't seem as vigorous as the photo's on the website!     However, the place was very clean and there was always someone doing more cleaning which was nice.    Once you got your bearings around Florence it was quite a good location to be in.  We unfortunately went at a time when the weather was scortching - 40degrees and humid.  I'd certainly stay…

title: A Great Place to Stay
review: Just got home today.  We spent the night at this hotel before returning home.  The location is great - especially if you are going to take the train.  Super clean rooms, big bathroom, air conditioning works and we had a large sitting room.  Breakfast is good and staff is excellent.  We stayed in an apartment for first part of our trip in Italy and I would for sure stay at the Rivoli instead again any day.

title: CONGRATULATIONS !!!
review: Some friends asked me why I would book a Best Western in Italy.  I told them the reviews on Tripadvisor sounded really good and it was near the train station in Florence.  What a great choice I made!  It was in a great location - just about a block and a half from the main station.  The rooms were really lovely and spacious.  The breakfast was free, and although not an "American" type buffet, there was still plenty to choose from.  I would have really liked free internet, but we paid for one day and it was not really expensive.  The decor was more modern than some other hotels, but we really liked it.  Our room had a rather large flat screen tv, which was nice.  There was a safe in the closet, and the bathroom and bed linens were first class.  The staff was so nice and offered…

title: Excellent hotel!! location+value
review: There was a beautiful birthday celebration of mine. They gave us, for this special ocasion, a nice and very spatios apartment. They are very kind and attentive to all our request and specialy the guy from the coffe bar from inside was respectful and charming.

title: Very satisfactory
review: I satyed at this hotel on May 2010. It was my 1st visit to Florence.. The location was the best!! My husband and I arrived and leave the city train; and walked like 100-200 mts from the main station to the hotel...  The room was very big for european standards.. the bathroon very clean and spacious too.. the staff speaked a perfect english, and helped us with a bag with something to eat as breakfast at our departure day, cause we left too early to eat the buffet breakfast the hotel offered..  The city is gorgeous!! we walked around to get to all the touristic spots!! we never step on a bus or train inside the city..  **** you need to have in mind that the Uffizi and the academia gallery dont open certain days as mondays.. check that out before planning your trip..

title: Lovely hotel with great breakfast but mediocre rooms in a borderline neighborhood.
review: About 300 mertres from the river, near the railway and bus stations. plenty of good eating places near, if you want a good steak try Il Giglio Rosso at about 300m.

title: Imagine English country house interior with outside Tuscan flowery terrace--that's the Rivoli
review: My husband and I stayed here for one night in Florence.  The staff were extremely friendly and fairly fluent in English.  Our room was enormous and beautiful, mostly with antique-type decor.  It has air-conditioning.  We had a lovely view of the garden and hottub below.  The bathroom was very well equipped with shower, tub, hairdryer and toiletries.  Breakfast the following morning was excellent.  The hotel is conveniently located and we were able to walk to all the nearby attractions we wanted to visit.

title: A delifgtful stay in Florence
review: Delightful historic building with comfortable, antiques- filled public rooms and typical Tuscan terrace with terracotta floors, geraniums and Jacuzzi. All the staff are charming, helpful and efficient making the guests feel very much at home. Our regular double room had a small balcony overlooking terrace. Bathroom extremely small with very low toilet and bidet. There was a smell from the drains--this was mentioned to the staff.Might I suggest foreign newspapers as well as the Italian ones. Breakfast good but surprised not to find olives and a wider cheese selection. Location ideal for sightseeing on foot, access to transport, and choice of restos near the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Would stay again
review: I travelled to Florence with 4 girlfriends for a 3 night stay. We stayed at the Hotel Rivoli which was extremely good and I would recommend this to anybody. All I would say is be careful where your room is and request not to have a room facing on to the side street as this can be quite noisy early morning. The rooms overlooking the courtyard are on the other hand very tranquil my friends were woken up each morning with the birds singing.   We opted for superior rooms and can report that these were excellent along with large bathrooms of a high standard.  The hotel is an easy 5 minute walk from the Santa Maria Novello Station and was also in very easy walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. On the odd occasion we did take a taxi these were very punctual, clean and the…

title: Look inside....
review: Excellent hotel our room was hugh - breakfast was good.

title: Very Nice Hotel

title: great staff + great hotel = great time
review: After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor, we reserved our 2-night stay at the BW Hotel Rivoli and we were not disappointed.  Lovely hotel, well-located.  Friendly and helpful bartender named Sammy recommended a restaurant our first night...and it was terrific! Hotel rooms were quite large, clean, comfortable...and great showers!

title: perfect location and value for money
review: Ok I think others have rightly pointed out that bathroom was tiny.  It was however spotlessly clean as was the whole hotel.The staff were, without exception, courteous and friendly without at any time being obtrusive. We stayed ina superior room and had asked for a balcony which was provided. This is a bonus as it places you to the rear of the hotel away from any road noise and overlooking the charming inner courtyard. We only had breakfast and toasted sandwiches in the hotel but they were fine. If we ever go back to Florence (I hope so) we would again choose this hotel.

title: Nice, clean, well located but the rooms need to be updated.
review: one would not expect this hotel in walking distance of the train and bus central stations. Nice room to the (recommended to the courtyard) was pleasant and silent. Breakfast fine, service extra friendly and helpful. in the neighborhood side streets you can find Osterias which are otherwise hard to find in the city. Short walking distance to the river and the museums. Hotel very much to be recommended.

title: It is a good, clean hotel but...?
review: We had a very pleasant stay at Hotel Rivoli.  The hotel is very well located, the rooms need a lift and to be updated.  The staff was nice and helpful. The breakfast was good and served in a very nice restaurant. The hotel gardens are manicure and well appointed.

title: GREAT!
review: Convenient location to train and historic sites. Good buffet breakfast with better than average waiters.  Complimentary use of gym 100 meters away open 10am to 10pm. Nice clean room with fridge, safe, and good size bathroom. Charm of being a former monastery with a nice courtyard and jacuzzi.  Nice, polite, helpful staff,especially the gentleman Sani at the bar. Internet is 5 euros daily if you bring your laptop. Nice restaurant "Benedict" on premises. Only complaint is that our CNN didn't work the last two days of our stay and they didn't fix it or replace the TV as they said they would.

title: Comfy and Cosy in Florence
review: First time in Florence, first time in Europe. I was worried about so many things especially the hotels. The service here was fantastic. Our room was on the second floor over looking the street. We had a fantastic bathroom, all marble. The breakfast and dinner were great. Location was also great. 5 min walk from train station, 10 min walk to Duomo. No need for taxis we walked everywhere. Plan on returning again this Aug and staying here.

title: They don't come much better
review: We arrived in and departed from Florence by train so we chose the Rivoli based on its proximity to the station, just an easy 5 min walk.  We went for a superior room which gave us an entrance area with a table and chairs and a good size bedroom area with a desk.  We were also lucky enough to get a balcony and with some unexpected mild weather we made very good use of it!  The bathroom was tiny although spotlessly clean.  The little clothesline that came out from the wall was very useful.  At first glance I thought the room looked a little worn around the edges but after a night here I really loved this hotel.  It has such character, it very very clean and really is a very comfortable, even homely, place to stay.  I would not hesistate to stay here again, I really did enjoy it. …

title: A gem that deserves more stars!
review: This was our fourth stay at the Rivoli; we've kept it a secret from everyone except close friends until now.  It's extremely well located being only a short distance from the main station of  Santa Maria Novella and yet only 5 mins from the best sights and shopping.  The staff are smartly attired, polite, friendly and helpful.  The rooms and their bathrooms are a good size.and some look out onto a lovely internal courtyard.  On top of all this it has real restaurant and not just a breakfast room.  It also has a cosy bar where you can enjoy a Campari or prosecco after a hard day's sightseeing.

title: WE LOVE THIS PLACE

title: Perfect Location
review: We love this place...Florence is our favorite city and the Hotel Rivoli is our favorite hotel.  It is close to the historical area, transportation, good restaurants and shopping.  We have stayed in this Hotel  three times in the last four years.  The staff is wonderful.  Everyone from the front desk to the waite staff is helpful, friendly and courteous.  The rooms have always been spotless, the linens and beds comfortable.    We just returned home last night and are already planning our return next year, new grandson in tow.

title: Lovely Hotel close to the Duomo
review: A great location and a very good hotel. The only thing that could have been better is a bigger bathroom and if we had a balcony. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean and well maintained. Most sites were close by and walkable and only 5 minutes from the station. The jacquzi was great to relax in after a day of walking. Breakfast was sufficent and good to start your day. No complaints.

title: Excellent hotel - great breakfasts
review: We traveled to Florence from Rome on the Eurostar, arriving at the Santa Maria Novella Termini.  The Hotel Rivoli was conveniently located approximately 2 blocks away from the Termini (easily walked with our rolling suitcases).  Located on an unassuming street in the historic district of the city, it is a block from the Santa Maria Novella church and within 5 minutes of the incredible Duomo.  During our three day stay in Florence, we walked everywhere as the Rivoli was ideally located for reaching all of the sights - most were within 5-10 minutes walking.  Florence is an incredibly walkable city but it does help to be located in the thick of it!  The hotel is lovely, although its entrance is so discreet as to easily pass it by.  We were traveling with another couple and both of…

title: The Hotel that could!!!!!!!!!
review: We have stayed in Florence before, at the Hotel Bocaccia, which was excellent. However, on this trip that hotel was booked up, so we stayed here.  The hotel was excellent.  The staff were very helpful, and spoke excellent English.  The room overlooked the courtyard and got the morning sun.  It was reasonably sized and well appointed, and the bathroom was excellent.  All was scrupulously cleaned and generally great.  Only two complaints - apparently there were elephants in the room above us, to judge from the heavy footfalls, and towards the end of the week some American ladies seemed to take great delight in using the jacuzzi very late (midnight!) at night, and being very noisy in it - no reflection on the hotel, but rather on the inconsiderateness of other guests.  Breakfasts…

title: " We are truly in Italy "
review: Stayed here with a friend, just 10 mins walk into the main part of the city but far enough away to be out of the chaos. Very close to the station also - no need for taxis. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, breakfast was very good for Italy and the room was very clean. The best feature was the Jacuzzi pool in the inner courtyard - a welcome treat after long day walking the streets of Florence. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Hotel, great location, great service.
review: Tiled bedroom floor , Lemon colored with a blue flowered design at center . Typically narrow streets surround .

title: It would be great, if there wouldn't be greater
review: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights and we had no complaints on this Hotel, the staff were always friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. It was like an oasis after walking the streets of beautiful Florence all day. Some lovely areas to wind down and have a drink, mind you, with the £ against the euro everything is pretty expensive, but hey we were on holiday. Everything was very clean, breakfast was great. You just need to ask Reception for Tea/Coffee facilities if not  already in your room.  The Hotel is just round the corner from the Station and only 15 min walk to the centre.  We loved it!!!!!

title: Perfect location and wonderful staff!
review: In generally this hotel is normal. Nor very luxurious, nor common. Very average. Delighted that the room was clean and the maid was so endeavour that she "cleaned" away my wach and shoehorn. I wonder what she will do with the last one? The exterior of the hotel frightened at the arrival. because the street, on which the hotel is located is tipical station area (if you get what I meen). And if you ask in  the reception for any service, verify your inquiry several times to be shure it is done correctly. For shure I would not recommend this hotel to any of my colleaques or friends.

title: Little gem, perfectly placed for exploring the city.
review: My 20 year old daughter and I have just arrived home from three nights at Hotel Rivoli.  It had everything we could have wanted and more. There was a lot of choice for breakfast and it could be taken in the courtyard garden.  Our room was very clean and spacious, the staff were excellent and friendly.   We had a dinner at the hotel one night too and this was our favourite meal of the holiday.  It is very central - a short walk from the station, and let's not forget the jacuzzi - a welcome soak after a day sight-seeing.  All in all, this hotel has it all.

title: Superb choice for a few days in Florence
review: I booked this hotel for a suprise special birthday for my other half and was not disappointed.  The hotel is well placed - 5 minutes walk from the station, 15 minutes walk from the Duomo. From the street this looks like any other hotel, but on entering you step from the hustle and bustle of street life into an oasis of calm.  The staff were very friendly and always helpful with our queries.  Breakfast can be taken in either a brick domed room, or outdoors in a courtyard garden - breakfast in a garden is a very good way to start the day.  Food choice for breakfast was good, but the bacon and eggs were poor.  There is a second courtyard garden which has a jacuzzi - this looked nice, but we never used it.  The hotel also provides free access to a gym a couple of doors down the…

title: Great Value - Great Location
review: This was a great end to our holiday, cycling from Venice to Florence.  The room was quiet and had a large balcony and very good facilities - eg brilliant shower!  The location is excellent: very close to the main rail & bus terminals and a short walk to the river and all the main attractions.  All the staff were extremely helpful.  Breakfast was excellent.  We also had one evening meal which was very good.  The Jacuzzi worked well and was a real plus after  walking around Florence each day.  We booked well in advance on the internet and got a very good rate.  People checking in on spec had to pay a lot more.  I would definitely go back if I ever visit Florence again.

title: Great Hotel, Splendid staff and well located
review: We stayed one night in Florence as part of our week trip.  We arrived by train from Rome and this hotel is very close by.  We did not walk to it as we had too much luggage and two children in tow.  The rooms were very clean with a large closet and bathroom.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our room overlooked the garden terrace and whirlpool which our children used after a long day of touring.  At first the location seemed to be a little iffy (seemed like an alley way) but once we got our bearings we walked to all the major attractions easily and felt safe.  I would recommend this hotel if you are staying for a short time and are not looking to spend a lot of money unnessessarily.   The breakfast was one of the better ones included in any of our stays during this trip.…

title: Some reviews are overenthusiastic - this is a good hotel, nothing more

title: Arriving at Florence by train? The lovely Hotel Rivoli is in the ideal location
review: I spent three nights here for business/leisure. The hotel is a good 3* / barely decent 4*. It does have nice things such as the terrasse restaurant, a small outdoor whirlpool (a gadget if you ask me, never used it, never saw anybody use it). My room smelled of mildew and had oldish carpet and furniture. Location was great for my needs: next to the train station and bus service to Pisa airport, easy walk to all the sights; but Florence is a small city, so many hotels are within walking distance of everything. Staff was courteous. Breakfast was OK but nothing extraordinary. The hotel does not have a fitness center but they have an arrangement with a nearby sports club so that hotel guests can use their facilities. There is no proper business center, only a computer; you pay…

title: Our Sixth Visit to Our Favorite Hotel in Tuscany
review: As part of our "Italy by train" holiday we stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for our 2days in Florence. The hotel was within walking distance (Even with suitcases) from the Station, and close to the city centre. Our room was delightful with a terrace overlooking the courtyard, the staff were very frendly and helpful and the food extremely good.  We highly recommend this hotel!  Debbie & Peter Owen, Northamptonshire, England.

title: Beautiful Hotel, GREAT STAFF, excellent location
review: We love Florence and we love the Hotel Rivoli.  The rooms are comfortable , clean and quiet and the staff treats us like family.  The buffet breakfast was nourishing and delicious in their new restaurant.  We also eat dinner in one of the courtyards of the Hotel.  The food was excellent and beautifully served.  The planting at the Hotel Rivoli is really extraordinary, perhaps the loveliest (for a city hotel) we have ever seen.  We used the Rivoli as a home base to make day trips to other cities in Tuscany during this visit (Siena, Lucca, Pisa, etc).  Since the Santa Maria Novella train station is only about one and one-half blocks away from the hotel, this worked perfectly!

title: Fabulous hotel in all aspects
review: This hotel is a hidden gem.  It is 4 star but sits between a lot of 2 and 3 star Train station hotels, one block from Florence Train Station.  The front of the Hotel looks common----but inside it is not.  The building was a former Monestary and the public rooms carry this elegently.  The "sitting" room (huge) reminded me of an English Castle type room.  The restaurant is used for breakfast and dinner and is modern and Westin style.  Free breakfast buffet was good.  The rooms are large (think American hotel size) but vary widely in design due to the buildings nature.  Batroom big and modern.  Room furniture needs to be replaced from a late 80s remodel? Close to all attractions.  I would stay again.

title: Excellent Hotel!

title: Not suitable for young children
review: We stayed at the Hotel Rivoli for 3 nights in Florence in May 2009. I loved Hotel Rivoli they were very accomadating in every way. One of the female managers....I believe her name was Francesca? She went above and beyond to make sure we had things we needed. They let us extend our stay at the discounted rate we originally booked and they helped us book tickets for the Coliseum before we headed to Rome. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the breakfast was good, and the staff was wonderful. I would definitely stay there again. The location was very convenient next to the train station, although you sacrifice the neighborhood being picturesque it was convenient and the room was very reasonable for Florence.

title: Can it be better?
review: We have stayed in Florence many times, but this time chose to go with this hotel. The staff are very attentive and the hotel is fine if you do not have children. We got an excellent rate (140 euros) for a quad room (no. 504) and were happy at first. But there was noise from the bar next door, keeping the kids awake; there were mosquitos at night (even though the windows were closed!); the jacuzzi was closed for four days. Hotel apologized and offered 10% reduction, but we were not pleased. Moreover, in a hotel of 4 stars, should guests we asked for 5 euros per hour to use the computer in the lounge? 3 euros for a cup of coffee outwith mealtimes? Yes, the hotel is very tastefully decorated, has an excellent & quiet restaurant, and employs great staff in a good location (though on…

title: excellence in all areas
review: Excellent room overlooking the green courtyard including a wonderful whirlpool (great after a day out), very comfortable bed, the best possible location 100 meters from SITA bus station (e.g. bus to Firenze Airport or Siena), 200 meters from rail station (e.g. train to Pisa Airport or Pisa) and 200 meters the opposite direction to the historic centre. Still the rooms are not noicy at all. The whole atmosphere is very relaxed and discretely sofisticated (not suitable for families!),  including very friendly personel. The breakfast is very nice including sparkling wine and the coffee of your choice. This excellent BW hotel offers very competitive reasonable prices and is highly recommended!

title: excellent hotel highly recommended we will come back again and again…
review: we greatly enjoyed our stay at hotel rivoli - splendid staff and surroundings.  we loved the garden courtyard (with jacuzzi) - the peace and quiet among the busy throngs of Florence.  best of all, we loved the Ristorante Benedicta with Luciano Ioppoli, the manager, dealing with our every whim.  His chef and staff were great and helped us to understand the Florentine cuisine .We hope that the restaurant is really successful and that the hotel rivoli becomes five-star - it clearly deserves it.  Thanks to everybody for a great stay.     .

title: Great restaurant, nice rooms
review: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Florence.  My wife and I stayed here recently and we were extremely satisfied with it.  The location is great being only about a 3-5 minute walk from the main train station and it is also convenient to the main tourist areas of Florence such as the Duomo area, several museums, and the river.  There is a great selection of restaurants near the hotel and the hotel staff was very helpful and willing to recommend different places to eat based on our preferences.  There is also a restaurant at the hotel but we did not eat there.  Our room was fantastic with a large bed, sitting area, bathtub, and a very nice balcony with a table where we enjoyed the great weather.  The hotel staff was warm and welcoming, especially Daniele…

title: This was, by far the best hotel in Italy that we stayed at
review: Although a little on the pricey side, especially considering we were there in the middle of February, Hotel Rivoli delivers on location, nice rooms, and a wonderful restaurant. The first night, we went to the restaurant just out of convenience with no expectations since it was a hotel restaurant, but it was worth going to in its own right. Mind you, the restaurant isn't cheap either, but it was so good, we went there the following night as well.

title: Garden Room was wonderful
review: Service at this hotel was impeccable, the stay left you wanting for nothing.  The rooms were larger than typical European rooms, with all the amenities needed.  Pool was heated and quite warm for January.  The elevator is a little cozy.  The day manager Massimo Milano was always helpful and courteous.  The attached restaurant Benedicta was the best restaurant that I had been to since Gordon Ramsay's Claridges restaurant.  Luciano Ioppoli took care of our every need and desire, and teamed with his head chef produced some of the most exquisite meals that I have ever had the pleasure to sample.

title: Wonderful location and helpful staff
review: We thought this hotel was good value for the location.  We were given the Garden Room (#505) which is a two-story, very private and quiet room overlooking the garden.  The breakfast was good - wide selection of pastries, cereals, cheeses, meats.  The location is very central - we had a car (which you really don't want in Florence) and had trouble getting to the hotel because the one-way street changes direction at some point and we always managed to be at the wrong point.   Apparently GPS systems don't work in Florence!  Room was clean and comfortable.  Front desk staff were very helpful.  Walking distance to Ponte Vecchio, the Duomo, restaurants and shopping.   When we were there they were building a restaurant on-site, but I'm not sure when it is opening.

title: Absolutely Magnificent
review: We were booked into the B&H Club hotel. When we arrived at the B&H it was dirty and very unpleasant. We walked around the neighbourhood and found the Rivoli. The staff were helpfull and welcoming. As tired travellers we needed a lsanctuary. They provided it. They showed us a room in advance of us booking in. The room was outstanding. We stayed at the Rivoli for three nights. The room was excellent, very clean. The breakfast was very good every day. Most of all, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend it.

title: Didn't pay a lot ; didn't get a lot
review: We were on a business trip to Florence and had been booked into, and stayed the night at another hotel but had to move as our first hotel had a bed bug infestation!!  We managed to find rooms in the Rivoli and were welcomed there with open arms by the incredible reception staff.  The hotel is clean, nicely decorated, has good amenities and is centrally located. It is a fantastic situation for the train station, conference centre as well as all the great sights in Florence . All the staff were extremely polite, friendly and very very helpful.  The breakfast was  lovely with a terrific selection of bread, pastries, cooked breakfast items, fruit and beverages.  There is also a nice bar area where drinks are  served  quite late into the night.  We didn't get to try the pool as our…

title: Great Little Hotel
review: Booked the Rivoli for a spur of the moment trip to Italy with 2 nights in Florence. With kids in tow we needed two rooms. Sadly, I did not recall I stayed at the Rivoli in 1997. Little has changed since then. The decor tired in '97, is exhusted in 2008. More importantly, the filthy carpet throughout and the moldy bathrooms need a good cleaning.  The train station location was central, if a little seedy.   The boys, 14 and 11, were happy with the whirlpool and the included breakfast was a savings.   Try to book someplace else.  I popped in at the Alba Palace across the street  to check availability and price, they were fully booked. If the rooms are as nice as the lobby I'd give the place a chance.

title: very nice
review: This was a really small but cute hotel that looked like a converted pensione ( which it was).  Even though the bedroom was small and we got two twin beds, when we specified queen, the balcony was really quaint and the shower was awesome.  It had it's own quirks but over all, for the price and location, we agreed we would definitely stay here again.  By the way, the staff was really nice too.

title: Six Nights, Seven Days

title: A Jewel in the Crown
review: My wife and I spent six nights at the Rivoli the second week of June. The rooms were relatively clean, the beds firm but comfortable.  Our room was on the courtyard above the pool, and noise could be heard when noisy people were in the pool or courtyard.  Don't plan to spend any time swimming, as the pool is miniscule.  Could also hear cars go past on the small street (almost an alley) behind the hotel but the windows did well keeping most noise out. The courtyard is a nice place to relax with a drink from the bar.  Some noise could be heard from the room above us , but nothing unbearable.  Water temperature in shower was uneven at times.  A/C works well and easy to control from room thermostat.  When exiting the hotel, be sure to turn right, as going left is a bit seedy,…

title: Very nice
review: My mother and I stayed at the Rivoli at the beginning of June. We chose this hotel mainly because of it's location - close to the station and previous positive experiences with other Best Western hotels. Thankfully we were not disappointed.  The hotel was easily located, check in was simple and pleasant and our luggage was carried to our room.  The room was spacious, clean and comforatble, we requested coffee/tea facilities and these were bought up within 15 minutes of our arrival.  To be honest although I liked Florence I did find it a little shabby and the hotel made a welcome retreat from a long days sight seeing. With it's jacuzzi and terrace it was a pleasant place to relax and unwind. The staff were always pleasant and the barmen were freindly and attentive and made an…

title: Good location but paid too much
review: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Rivoli for two nights. We found it to be very comfortable, quiet and the staff very friendly. Our room was at the back of the hotel and looked out onto a narrow, quiet street. A room at the front might not be so quiet as Via Della Scala is fairly busy. It’s very central, close to the railway station and a 5-10 minute walk from the main attractions. There is no car park so the valet parking service at €23 per night is necessary.

title: Worst night in Italy
review: We booked this hotel with our airline tickets as part of a vacation package with Northwest airlines.  We ended up paying about $315 per night for a triple.  The room was large, clean, and nicely furnished.  The water in the shower was inconsistently hot and cold.  Breakfast was very resonable, with both scrambled and hard boiled eggs, sausages (which tasted like little hot dogs), ham, cereals, yogurt, pastries, toast, and fruit. Hot beverages were made to order.  Staff was friendly and have good recommendations if asked.  We were traveling with a 4-year-old and they were particularly nice to her.  Location is good - an 8-minute walk from train station, where you can also catch tour buses, etc.  Self-service laundry was available down (and across) the street where you could drop…

title: Beyond our expectations!
review: We booked that hotel trough the Ryan air web site. We were quite please with it.  This hotel is situated about 5 minute walk from the train station.  It was very convenient since we had to take the train to go back in Pisa to take back our plane.  This was a very clean hotel.  The room size was great and the bathroom was very efficient and clean (one of the most important thing for us) We were off season so the price was very good.  The people working at that hotel were friendly and helpful.  It was conveniently situated near a lot of restaurants and bars. I would recommend that hotel if you go in Florence.

title: Good for the price
review: From our arrival we received five star treatment. The staff were very friendly and professional. The room was spotless and comfortable. Although some renovation work was taking place outside during the day - it just didn't seem to matter as everything else was so good! The location was perfect - near to the station for travel to airports and Siena (a must) but in a quiet street close to all the main city attractions. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were always on hand if anything  was needed. We had a great time in Firenze and were lucky with the weather - I suspect that the hotel arranged this as well! We would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone. We didn't try the 'hot tub' but look forward to a return visit.

title: Great Location, Great Staff
review: A pleasant enough 2 night say in February. Hotel communal areas and courtyard very nice, free welcome drink when you arrive is a nice touch. Breakfast is adequate. Our double room was OK, very blandly decorated and fairly small. Temperature not controllable except by opening window - quite hot even in winter. Bathroom very small, bidet and toilet opposite each other with about 12 inces between - very litle moving space. Shower temperature up and down uncontrollably. Continuous noise from music PA in courtyard til atleast 10pm - very annoying. Staff pleasant. If arriving by car (good luck!) then you have to pay 23euro a night for it to be valet parked in a local garage. For the money a decent enough stay.

title: A Very Good Choice
review: Stayed at the Rivoli for three nights at the end of December.  We had two Triple rooms and they were both very nice.  The location is great.  Less than ten minutes from the train station and a short walk to all of the great sights of Florence.   The front desk staff is really great!!!  They were very helpful with walking tour guides, restaurant ideas, and even helped find out where my bag was when Air France lost it(surprise surprise).   If you stay here, ask the hotel front desk to book a walking tour with Luca.   He is the best!  Also you must eat at Ristorante Buca Mario.  It's really close to the hotel and the food and atmosphere are great!!!   About a hundred feet to the right of the hotel is the Joshua Tree Pub.  It's a great place to grab a pint and talk about your day's…

title: Wonderful Hotel  ..
review: Had a few doubts after reading some of the reviews but all ended well. Hotel very clean.Staff couldn`t have been more pleasant or helpful.Garden area brilliant after a day sight-seeing.There is a bar in the street where customers do spill onto the pavement--walking on the other side solves the problem!  Hotel within walking distance of most sights/galleries--however taxis didn`t seem expensive when used.Would certainly stay here again

title: Walk Florence from here!
review: Just come back from a beautiful weekend in Florence - Bristol to Pisa - Bus to Florence amazing 8 Euro .  Would recommend anyone looking to go to Florence & save some money to travel this way. Simple & easy.   Stayed ay Hotel Rivoli what a lovely place . had an excellent deal booking on line with hotel.com. The room we stayed in was clean, spacious and had a beautiful balcony area overlooking the courtyard which did make it even better as after a day of walking around florence it was nice to relax, reflect & enjoy the wine without any bother. Rm 216. Don't be shy using the hot tub/jacuzzi usually find people don't tend to stay in there too long anyway . Found the staff helpful ,particularly the bar staff they where great. I can honestly say I read hundreds of reviews before…

title: A Little Outdated, But Overall Nice
review: Just returned from a 12 day stay in Rome, Florence, and Tuscan villages.    The trip was fabulous -- we weren't prepared for the extreme heat that Italy was experiencing.   Our definition of air conditioning is not the same as Italy's.      One note:    be sure to insist on the a/c being turned on in your room.    Ours was turned off mid-sleep, causing the room temps to rise to 89 degrees.   The staff came to the room in the a.m. to "fix" it, but we were told to pack all of our belongings before leaving the room, just in case we had to be moved.     When we returned, there was no apology for the inconvenience of the heat or repacking.    After talking with other guests, we discovered that this seems to be a common occurence.        As far as location, this is a great spot.   …

title: Very Nice
review: We stayed at the Rivoli for two nights.  They probably had the "best" service out of anywhere we stayed in Italy.  (This isn't saying much, but still!) The front desk checked us in efficiently and booked us reserved tickets for the Uffizi.  They also gave us excellent advice about the Galleria dell'Accademia, which is open until late evening on Fridays.  So even though we did not arrive until about 4:00 that day, we were able to drop off our things quickly and head out in time to see the Duomo (closes at 5), Museo dell Duomo (I think open til 7), and the David--all before having dinner!  The hotel itself is nice enough; our room with a queen bed had enough space, a comfortable bed, and was clean--the three most important things to us. The decor was rather boring , and while I…

title: Comforable but noisy
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Huge room! Good breakfast!
review: We did a lot of research before deciding on which (of many) hotels to book for our special first wedding anniversary in Florence.  I put a lot of weight on the reviews on TripAdvisor.   The Rivoli is just OK for the price. The front desk/concierge staff seem like they can't be bothered if you are standing right in front of them for quite a while before they deign to turn and give you some attention.  The bathrooms are comically laid out. It is a challenge to bend over the sink when brushing your teeth or washing your face, or find a place to put your shampoo/conditioner/soap in the shower other than the bottom. There are no racks or places for those items in the shower.  The breakfast is very good - lots of protein choices which is a nice option in Europe. Service is good at…

title: Perfect, Charming stay at Hotel Rivoli
review: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Rivoli for 3 nights. The room was huge and VERY clean! It is near the train station so it was easy to get to. However, the hotel wasn't super close to all the other restaurants and cool things to see. However, everything is within walking distance.  I loved the free hot breakfast everyday. However, I think I gained 5lbs from eating in Florence.   The bar and breakfast staff were super friendly and provided great service. Most of the front desk staff were nice except for the Night Desk man. When I called to ask if they had a fan. He was a total jerk. It was pretty hot at night. (Apparently, normally not that warm) He grumpily told me air conditioning wouldn't be turned on for another month and to just open the windows. Well, yes we did that. Next…

title: Pleasant stay at the Rivoli
review: We stayed at Hotel Rivoli for 6 nights and had a great time.  It's in a great location.  2 blocks away from the train station.  10 minute walk to the Duomo.    The 1st night we had a room facing the street, but it was noisy with all the cars.  We asked Massimiliano for a room on the other side with a view of the courtyard.  It was perfect.  We even had a walk in closet and our room was significantly bigger than our friends' room next door.  Breakfast was good with cereal, meats, eggs, ok juice, fruit, yogurt, etc.  The breakfast staff was so nice.  Some front desk people are just ok at best.  But Massimiliano is a big help!   He helped us with train times to Pisa, Lucca, Siena, and San Gimignano.  He even helped booked a wine tasting tour that's cheaper than the bigger tours. …

title: ok,could do better
review: We stayed two nights at the Rivoli in 3/07.  We booked through Gate 1 travel and were very pleased with all three hotels through them during our time in Italy.  The Rivoli is conveniently located very near the train station, and we were easily able to walk to the hotel from the station, even with our baggage.  (Tip:  When exiting the train station, go downstairs via the escalators so you will emerge at street level and avoid the big staircase in front of the station.)  The decor in the Rivoli was pleasant but standard.  The room and bathroom were large and clean, and it was nice to have a bathtub instead of just a shower.  The double room had two twin beds (made up with separate sheets and blankets) pushed together to make one big bed, which was slighly inconvenient but fairly…

title: nice quiet stay
review: Some of the reviews of this hotel were a bit out in left field; We were pleasantly surprised with The Hotel Rivoli. We just returned from a 4 night stay, The location is just 2 short blocks away.   The good: Loved the room, we had enough space for a European size room, I thought. Very Very clean. New Mongramed Linens were changed every day, they were ironed and felt very clean. Our room overlooked the beautiful pool and hot tub courtyard area. Very peaceful and charming. The breakfast was 5 star, the buffet had hots and colds, and champagne every morning for mimosa's if you wanted it. Served in a beautiful breakfast room. There is a nice lobby with different sitting areas and a beautiful dish with candy, nice touch. The front desk staff were top notch and very very helpful, We…

title: Nothing great, nothing bad
review: Arrived late in Firenze, travelling with parents, into a whirlwind of traffic.   Found Hotel Rivoli between train station (Piazza Statione) and main square (Piazza Republica) is a nice 4 star hotel.  Staff was fine - no problems, no extraordinary care or service. We had been travelling and doing a lot of walking and it was a great respite to just park the car and spend a few days. Breakfast was full of food, from american scrambled eggs/sausage, croissants, proscuittos and cheeses, and cereals - more than enough.  Internet access available for a very small fee.  We had a very nice room, separate bedroom w/double bed for the parents, the sitting room for me - sofa-bed.  All comfy.   Shopping in Firenze - most go to Mercado San Lorenzo - the biggest  tourist shopping area near San…

title: Lovely
review: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days at the end of Sep '06.  I didn't want to write a review as this was the beginning of my vacation and I wanted to see what the other hotels were like in Italy (1st time in Italy) before I gave it a review.  We'll i'm at the end of my trip and I think the hotel is just average.  This hotel was booked for me by gate1 so I didn't really have a choice but the room I got was pretty average.  I'm not sure what I ended up paying since it was booked through the travel agency but it was really just average.  There was absolutely nothing special about this place.  The guy at the front desk was kinda rude and not very friendly, the room was small (even compared to other Italy hotels) but on  a positive note, it was close to everything, and it was fairly…

title: Terrible Service! Uncaring and Callous
review: Location downtown but hard to find due to many one way streets. Parking in the street is free but the hotel need to know the licenseplate number in advance. Otherwise it is not allowed to drive around or park in the downtown area. An old building updated with care to modern standard. Very different but nice rooms, som with a little privat patio with table and stools. A very nice courtyard away from the noise of the city with first class barservice and a small pool. You can find bathrobes in your room. Breakfast buffet very good. Very friendly service from the hotels staff.

title: Nice hotel
review: Great help from the front desk who were able to assist with numerous issues easy or difficult.  The air conditioning works great.  The room was quiet even when Italy won the World Cup!  Near train station, landmarks.  Central Market not far away.  Excellent location.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: My friend and I stayed for three nights at the Rivoli in Florence.   This was a lovely, quaint, friendly hotel where the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful.  We asked for a room with a balcony and were given a very pleasant room at the rear which overlooked the hotel's courtyard areas and surrounding rooftops and roof gardens.  The standard of cleanliness was very high - with clean, crisp white sheets provided every day!  The breakfast buffet was good, with a hot choice each day and served by friendly staff.  The hotel was well located within a stone's throw of the S M Novella train station and within 5 - 10 minutes walk of the main centre, the river and a whole host of restaurants and bars in the main piazza's etc.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Rivoli and would…

title: Booked a room - maybe not !!
review: I am always a little hesitant about booking hotels in Europe because the photos on the websites are often ...well...not as the actual hotel appears. In this case the photos on the website do the hotel injustice. This is a gem.This does not look like much from the street but once inside, it is gorgeous. The rooms are large and clean and acceptable even by North American standards. The breakfast room and food is very good and plentiful.The courtyard within the hotel is a  tranquile and pleasant surprise for having that nightcap after an exhausting day walking (and spending) in Florence. The staff is outstanding. They are as good a tour guide as found anywhere and their recommendations for tours, resturaunts and even when to go to local sites are invaluable. They will even make…

title: Well done Rivoli!
review: This hotel was recommended to me so I booked a 3 night break for March 06. Before I left I had emailed the hotel twice to confirm that they had our booking and to also inform them that we would be arriving late (11.30pm). My booking was confirmed and I was told "Don't worry about your late arrival we will hold the room for you" You can imagine how annoyed I was when we turned up to be told there "were many room problems" and told that we would have to go and stay at another hotel in their chain.  This seemed to happen to another guest in a previous review for this hotel. As it was the other hotel was fine but disappointing that we did not get the chance to stay in the hotel that we actually booked and paid for. This other hotel was also cheaper per night than the Rivoli and we…

title: Nice Charming Hotel
review: Very good choice - 10 out of 10! Service, standard of the room and breakfast were all excellent. We would definetely like to go back! The hotel is in the heart of the Florence but still quiet & close to the main train station. Very convenient, comfortable & easy to find.
