title: Pretty place, convenient to the historic landmarks, and a great night's sleep!
review: Stayed in this hotel for a nice February break. We were a little concerned about the area being unsafe, but it all proved not worth worrying about. The Hotel is great - charming and clean, our room was not huge but really nice, and the staff was very helpful and extremely friendly. Would definitely go back there - in fact, wasn't brave enough to try the lovely Jacuzzi hot tub, maybe in a warmer climate...

title: A Great Hotel!
review: Spent one night in late November. Booking late on internet, we got a reasonable rate and were expecting good value for money. Our experience confirmed our expectations.  The valet parking facility is actually very convenient, and the fee is not very different from what local garages would have charged you when access to the historic centre was allowed in the past. The hotel will also remove for you the "limited traffic zone" violation fine (68 euro I think) that gets automatically triggered whenever someone drives into the bounds of the historic centre without an appropriate permission.  The hotel, a monastery in the distant past, has a pleasant historic feel. Our "superior" room had a small waiting room, LCD TV and a large and extremely comfortable bed. The bathroom was long…

title: Rental Car held prisoner, but not a bad place
review: We recently stayed at the Hotel Rivoli traveling in a group of nine.  Upon arrival four of our suitcases did not make the trip with us.  The front desk called the ailines every hour and they had them to us in less 48 hours upon arrival.  We had 4 rooms total and all of them were very nice and clean.  Each one was different in size and one had a balcony, one had a fireplace, one had an LCD television, and one had a couch.  The bathrooms were nice and big.        The bartender from india was extremley nice.  He reffered us to our best meal in Florence at Bucca Mario.  He was very nice and very informing.       The hotel is a very easy walk to the train station, about a block.  The hotel is right on the same street as the Piazza Santa Maria Novella which is a great place to just…

title: Overbooked
review: Rental car hell!!! We rented a car to see Italy and trying to find Hotel Rivoli with the car is heck.  But nice lady at the desk talked us in finally (Thank goodness for my cellphone).  Then found that to park car at a garage that is not owned by the hotel, was about $25.00 a day.  Beware of driving a rental car there but if you do, get good directions and plan to budget in parking fees.    Did not even get offered welcome drink (which may have alleviated our stress at trying to find the hotel, but after thinking about it, it may have taken more than one).  Not far from train station.  Hotel room was clean, bathroom was a little small but not uncomfortably so (it is Europe so expected).  Breakfast was good and plentiful.  Not a complaint but dont expect your bacon crispy. …

title: Really good hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very pleased with Hotel Rivoli
review: Our stay was on March 2005 during 2 nights (my wife an me) after Rome and before Venice & Paris. Good location: 2 blocks from Rail Station, and you can walk to all nice places of Florence (Cathedral, Ponte Veccio, Pitti Palace, etc etc) The room was big (remember that it´s Europe!), absolutelly clean and nice! We took a superior room (20 Euros more a day) Bathroom REALLY GOOD, including a small whirlpool! Breakfast NICE. People absolutelly nice. We couldn´t enjoy the pool (remember that temperature was around 8 degrees C)but it looks GOOD   I would go back if I´m in Florence for sure!

title: Great location and servie
review: Stayed at Hotel Rivoli 2/17/05 - 2/20/05. Excellent location, 5 minute walk from the train station to the hotel. No more than a 15 minute walk to all of the major sites: Duomo, Accademia Museum, Uffizi Gallery, Ponte Vecchio Bridge etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was very good and a nice way to begin the day.  We did not find the area to be seedy or unsafe. Many nice reasonably priced restaurants near the hotel. One restaurant is a must when in Florence: 'Acqua al 2' on Via della Vigna Vecchia, 40r. You'll need reservations but it's worth it. The filet in blueberry sauce is wonderful. There was only one negative about this hotel. The temperature for the rooms are controlled at the front desk. Our room was always very cold even after requesting the…

title: Excellent hotel with understated high quality service
review: At first I was reluctant to stay in a hotel close to the train station (we were in our honey moon). But once we got there and entered our room #505, it was great. Two stories, the lower one with full bathroom, tv, sofabed, closet. The upper storie, with half bathroom, king size bed, tv.   Not to mention that room 505 is the only isolated room, with a little garden outside the door, just like a villa.   Staff was very friendly, breakfast was ok.  At the end, the location turned out to be great, not too crowded but close to most of must sees.
